319301010.speaker: 科尔盖特工
319301010.content: Um... I apologize, but I didn't really see it in the heat of battle.

319301011.speaker: 托特
319301011.content: It's alright. I didn't see it, either.

319301012.speaker: 科尔盖特工
319301012.content: If even you didn't see it, Capt... (Cough) Should we try to speak with her?

319301013.speaker: 托特
319301013.content: Everyone, I need you to check your anti-digitalization devices now. It'll be too late by the time your bodies feels the effects of the Source Layer.

319301014.speaker: 托特
319301014.content: I believe this is the first time you folks are going on a mission to the Source Layer, so apply all caution.

319301015.content: Although Ver doesn't know anyone in this group of soldiers, she recognizes the CORG uniforms they're wearing, as well as Ain Soph's Source Layer. She also recognizes the Visbanes they just defeated.

319301016.content: And because all of these things seem so familiar to her, she can't quite process the scene she just saw. So when someone walks toward her, she instinctively goes into a defensive pose, and only slowly relaxes afterwards.

319301017.speaker: 托特
319301017.content: Easy. We're a field team from the CORG Egregious Crimes Department. I'm Captain Thoth.

319301018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301018.content: Um, hello. I'm Verthandi. And... thank you.

319301020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301020.content: Those Visbanes had been tailing me for quite some time. But what are you all doing in the Source Layer...?

319301021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301021.content: By the way, do you know how things in Xu Heng are right now? And where the Admin is? I seem to have been unconscious for quite a while, and when I came to, everyone was gone.

319301022.speaker: 托特
319301022.content: Xu Heng? I haven't heard of anything happening there. And who's this "Admin" you're speaking of?

319301023.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301023.content: The Administrator of Division Nine, #{nickname}#. Don't you know them?

319301024.speaker: 托特
319301024.content: "Division Nine"... The only organization with this department that I'm aware of is Aether Gazer. But I've never heard of this person before.

319301025.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301025.content: They are from Aether Gazer. Oh, I thought everyone had heard of the Admin by now.

319301026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301026.content: That's odd. I distinctly remember the Admin and I fell down here together, so why am I the only one here...?

319301027.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301027.content: Ah, I've got it! I must have fallen into the Source Layer by accident. That's why they haven't found me yet. I have to get back now!!!

319301028.content:
Ver gives her forehead a rather resounding slap and takes a few steps back, before raising her sword high and slashing the air hard.
She can hear the sound of the blade whooshing powerfully through the air, but nothing else happens.

319301029.content: Ver's eyes widen in shock. Absolutely nothing about the space in front of her has changed. With her eyes averted from the dumbfounded CORG soldiers, she readies herself and tries it again.

319301030.content: The area is so quiet, you could hear a pin drop.

319301031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301031.content: Why is nothing happening? Have I become too weak...?

319301033.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301033.content: Opening a passage back to the Surface Layer. Obviously.

319301034.speaker: 托特
319301034.content: Do you... not have enough Divine Power?

319301035.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301035.content: Yeah. I can't seem to access mine.

319301036.speaker: 托特
319301036.content: Opening a passage back to the Source Layer isn't something the average Modifier can do...

319301037.speaker: 托特
319301037.content: Are you from Aether Gazer Division Nine, too? Why are you here all by yourself?

319301038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301038.content: Have none of you seen it yet?

319301039.content: Ver looks up, and the soldiers all follow suit. Above them is the tremendously complex, yet seemingly endless Source Layer. There's nothing worth taking note of there.

319301040.content: The soldiers look at Ver in puzzlement. She cocks her head to one side and starts to make some abstract gestures.

319301041.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301041.content: There was a platform up there, and in the middle of the platform, there were many moving triangles, both big and small. They shoot out light waves that can dispel Visbanes.

319301042.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301042.content: There was also a child up there. They were holding a pendant that could also scare off Visbanes...

319301043.content: Ver is unable to continue. Just hearing herself recount the earlier events has filled her with even more incredulity. There's no way the CORG soldiers will believe her without any concrete evidence.

319301044.speaker: 托特
319301044.content: We've been in this area for a while now, and we haven't seen either the platform or the child you're talking about.

319301046.speaker: 托特
319301046.content: Typically, we'd think things like what you just described are illusions, especially in a place like the Source Layer.

319301047.speaker: 托特
319301047.content: Do you remember if something major or terrible happened to you recently?

319301049.speaker: 科尔盖特工
319301049.content: Captain, we have more Visbanes coming our way.

319301050.speaker: 托特
319301050.content: ... Got it. Get ready to move out.

319301051.speaker: 托特
319301051.content: Verthandi, although I don't know what happened to you, and whether or not what you described was real... if you want to return to the Surface Layer, you should come with us.

319301053.speaker: 托特
319301053.content: Of course. CORG and Aether Gazer work together. We should help each other.

319301054.speaker: 托特
319301054.content:
But we lost someone in the Source Layer, and we have to find her before we can return.
Are you able to protect yourself if the need arises?

319301055.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319301055.content: Oh, don't worry. I can help too.

319301056.speaker: 托特
319301056.content: You don't have to do anything... Just don't stand around in a daze again.

319301057.content: Thoth glances at the approaching Bane Energy signal on her map, then briefly looks Verthandi up and down. She lets out a sigh and starts planning for the upcoming battle.

319311001.content: Modifiers with big personalities are a dime a dozen. Back at Aether Gazer, Ver had also met her fair share of Modifiers who like to extend greetings using their weapons.

319311002.content: So while her first encounter with Lokken hasn't exactly been friendly, when she sees Lokken put her weapon down after Thoth's warning, Ver decides not to pursue the matter. Besides, she has bigger fish to fry...

319311003.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311003.content: So, Captain Thoth, do you have anything else to do here? Can we go back now?

319311004.speaker: 托特
319311004.content:
It's time we did.
Raphael, look for a Warp Node near us. We're returning to Nordburg.

319311006.speaker: 洛肯
319311006.content: Whaaat? So soon? I haven't had any fun here yet. It's not every day I get to come to the Source Layer, you know.

319311007.speaker: 洛肯
319311007.content: And I just managed to find my toys...

319311008.speaker: 托特
319311008.content: Do you want Paracaesar to talk to you about today's events again?

319311009.speaker: 洛肯
319311009.content: ... Hmph. You're no fun at all.

319311010.speaker: 洛肯
319311010.content: Have you found out why that thing appeared yet?

319311011.speaker: 托特
319311011.content: No. Because we had to spend all of our limited time down here searching for someone who left the squad without permission.

319311012.speaker: 洛肯
319311012.content: It's not quite fair to blame me for that, is it? Don't things go faster if you split up when you're searching for something?

319311013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311013.content: What are you all looking for?

319311016.speaker: 洛肯
319311016.content: Oh. I thought there were no secrets between Modifiers.

319311017.speaker: 洛肯
319311017.content: Why do we have to abide by so many rules, Captain Thoth? Are all captains this dull?

319311018.speaker: 洛肯
319311018.content: There are still so many Visbanes here. Shouldn't we deal with them all before we head back?

319311019.speaker: 洛肯
319311019.content: Also, what's that noise? It's so loud.

319311020.content: Lokken's complaint causes everyone to look over in the direction of a weak noise that sounds like an alarm. It's coming from the inconspicuous watch on Ver's wrist.

319311022.content: Ver looks down at the watch and starts fiddling with it. Its screen lights up, and the black display flashes with a dark red warning symbol.

319311023.content: There's some kind of progress bar at the bottom of the watch dial too, with a label that says "Spatial Collapse Warning Factor." It looks like the watch's designers have gone out of their way to make this bar rather inconspicuous.

319311024.content: Ver thinks back to the moment Lokken was about to attack her: It was the warning sound from the watch that allowed her to react in time.

319311025.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311025.content: How do I turn it off? I don't see a button of any sort.

319311026.speaker: 手表
319311026.content: User not verified. Unable to change settings.

319311027.content: Ver is startled by the sudden voice. She pokes at the flashing "Verifying..." text on the screen, and an unknown symbol replaces the warning sign. But the watch doesn't respond.

319311028.speaker: 洛肯
319311028.content: It's your watch. Don't you know how to use it? Or did you steal it from someone?

319311029.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311029.content: Please don't say that. I don't steal.

319311030.speaker: 洛肯
319311030.content: That sounds suspicious... Captain Thoth, does CORG handle cases of theft?

319311031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311031.content: I already told you, I didn't steal it. It was on my wrist when I woke up.

319311032.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311032.content: I seem to recall CORG has some kind of system that can trace objects to their owners? Can you find out whose this is?

319311036.speaker: 手表
319311036.content: Sergeant O-B-Two-Zero-Two-Four verified. Mission underway. Permissions granted.

319311037.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311037.content:
Mission? What mission?
Hello? Can you hear me?

319311038.content: Without answering Ver's absent-minded question, the watch's screen flashes like its battery is low, and then, no matter what Ver says to it, stops beeping.

319311039.content: Ver looks helplessly at Thoth. However, Thoth seems to be feeling a great deal of uncertainty and doubt. She takes half a step back and shakes her head.

319311040.speaker: 托特
319311040.content: That makes sense, actually. The president would have made other arrangements for something of this magnitude.

319311041.speaker: 洛肯
319311041.content: Hey, hey, hey. Are you serious about this "OPRIC" thing? So she's OPRIC?

319311043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311043.content: Just what is "OPRIC"? You aren't talking about me, are you?

319311044.speaker: 洛肯
319311044.content: Yeah, it can't be her! There's no way a dummy like her would be part of the president's elite guard! She must be an imposter.

319311047.speaker: 托特
319311047.content: The rule is, "Work together, but no contact otherwise." We don't have the right to question an office that answers directly to the president.

319311048.speaker: 洛肯
319311048.content: Hmph. Special folks and their special privileges.

319311049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311049.content: Just what are you talking about?! Why am I getting more confused with every new thing you say...?

319311050.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319311050.content: Should we just head back to the Surface Layer now? The Admin will know what's going on.

319311051.speaker: 托特
319311051.content:
... Alright.
Raphael, have you found an anchor point yet?

319311052.speaker: 拉斐尔
319311052.content: Oh, yes, I've found one. It's not far from us. But there's a chance the Visbanes lurking nearby will follow us through it.

319311053.speaker: 托特
319311053.content: That's alright—Nordburg is sealed off now, anyway. We'll just get rid of the few that manage to get through.

319311054.content: Thoth locks eyes with the very confused Ver for a moment, fights the urge to question her, and turns to look at Lokken.

319311055.speaker: 托特
319311055.content: No more trouble from you, you hear?

319321001.content: It's only when the passage is fully closed that the soldiers heave sighs of relief. Although they're not saying anything, they are all staring at the one who caused the battle to begin with.

319321002.speaker: 洛肯
319321002.content: Isn't this awesome? I mean, we destroyed so many Visbanes today. No need to thank me, though.

319321004.speaker: 洛肯
319321004.content: Ugh, say something, you guys. You're as boring as Captain Thoth.

319321005.speaker: 洛肯
319321005.content: Hey, and you, sergeant? You look like you're a little more fun than the rest of them. I mean, you even had the time to protect these soldiers during the battle...

319321007.content: The hand that was leaning on the sword moves for a moment. Ver is sitting by the side of the road, breathing heavily. It looks like there is a heavy white filter on the ground in front of her.

319321008.content: She's not looking up at Lokken, perhaps because she doesn't have the strength to do so, or because she'd rather avoid everyone's gaze.

319321009.speaker: 洛肯
319321009.content: ... What is it this time? That was a rather fight, wasn't it?

319321013.speaker: 洛肯
319321013.content: You're okay? How about we go for another walk in the Source Layer then?

319321014.speaker: 洛肯
319321014.content: If we slip away right now, the captain will come looking for us again. That'd be so fun.

319321016.content: Ver reluctantly raises his head to look at Lokken. All that is coming to her mind right now is how Lokken previously attacked her when they first met, and she's using all she has in the tank to repress the inexplicable urge to strike at Lokken now.

319321017.content: The moment their eyes meet, Lokken suddenly tenses up and takes a step back. She is so close to reaching for her weapon, and it is a while before she returns to a more natural posture, after she's sure that Ver really isn't going to do anything to her.

319321018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319321018.content: ... I don't understand. Why are you still so pleased with yourself, when you were the one who drew the Visbanes here and put everyone in danger?

319321019.speaker: 洛肯
319321019.content: What danger? We didn't lose anybody in the battle, did we?

319321020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319321020.content: Huh? But that's not the point...

319321021.speaker: 洛肯
319321021.content: Relax. Everyone at CORG is my friend. I won't let them get killed by Visbanes.

319321022.speaker: 洛肯
319321022.content: Although they're very weak, so are the Visbanes. So they'll be alright as long as I'm around.

319321023.speaker: 洛肯
319321023.content: I'm just like you—I'm protecting them, too.

319321024.content: Lokken reaches out a hand to Ver, whose first instinct is to avoid it. But the former's aim is precise, and Ver finds herself being firmly gripped by the shoulder.

319321025.speaker: 洛肯
319321025.content: Where do you wanna go if you're not going to the Source Layer? Can I come with you?

319321026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319321026.content: No, no, no, you're too dangerous. You're not going anywhere near the Admin.

319321027.speaker: 洛肯
319321027.content: What "Admin"? I don't know them. Boring.

319321028.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319321028.content: Then why are you following me?

319321029.speaker: 洛肯
319321029.content: To leave this horrible place, of course.

319321030.speaker: 洛肯
319321030.content: Since Captain Thoth believes that you're OPRIC, she won't object to me going with you. I'll be able to go outside and play.

319321031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319321031.content: So you're saying you want to play hooky?!

319321034.content: Thoth has been drawn to the conversation by the sound of Ver's astonished question. After uploading the mission briefing, she looks up and sees Lokken holding her head, sighing quietly.

319321035.speaker: 托特
319321035.content: Now that the mission is complete, I'll be taking you back in a bit.

319321037.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319321037.content: Um, Captain Thoth, I've been meaning to ask... what is this place? And why is there no one else around?

319321038.content: During the battle, Ver was too busy to look around her. But now she sees that something is definitely off about this neighborhood.

319321039.content: Thoth pauses for a moment. She takes a glance at the watch on Ver's wrist, but ultimately decides not to press the issue.

319321041.speaker: 托特
319321041.content: It has been closed off since that rift appeared, due to the multiple casualties and issues in the spatial structure it caused... It may not even be habitable in the future...

319321043.content: The moment Ver hears "Molander City," all of the breath seems to leave her body. Once again, she looks blankly at the desolate streets around her, her eyes flashing sharply.

319321045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319321045.content: I'm sorry, I have to take a look for myself...

319321046.content: Unable to restrain herself, Ver starts walking, her fists clenched and her back towards the CORG troops. One step after another, faster and faster... Then she throws off her heavy Archaic Oath armor and starts running.

319321047.content: Thoth watches in silence as Ver disappears around the corner of the street. She's gone south, which is the right direction.

319321049.speaker: 托特
319321049.content: I don't hear you express envy of other people very often.

319321050.speaker: 洛肯
319321050.content: That's because besides you people at CORG, I haven't even met enough people for a game of Prism-3.

319321052.speaker: 洛肯
319321052.content: You've never played it before? See, this is why we can't even chit chat.

319321053.speaker: 洛肯
319321053.content: But since you didn't say she's also part of CORG... I guess you don't believe she's OPRIC, either.

319321054.speaker: 托特
319321054.content: It doesn't matter if I believe her or not. The identity verification doesn't lie.

319321055.speaker: 洛肯
319321055.content: Really? It's that reliable? Aren't you worried about her being an imposter?

319321056.speaker: 托特
319321056.content: There's no need to worry. Even if she is an imposter, it's not my problem.

319321058.speaker: 托特
319321058.content: CORG is in full support of the Council of Observators' authority.

319321059.speaker: 托特
319321059.content: It doesn't matter if believing it or even choosing to accept it. This is the very core of CORG.

319321060.speaker: 洛肯
319321060.content: ... Ah. Those bosses of whom no pictures exist.

319321061.content: Thoth does not reply. Both of them know that they've come to the natural end of this topic of conversation.

319321062.content: The battlefield has been cleared and the teams have all reassembled. Seeing that Thoth is still standing in the same spot, the one called Raphael gestures to the others, telling them to stand by for further instructions.

319321063.speaker: 托特
319321063.content: Lokken, do you know why I agreed to let you travel with me?

319321064.speaker: 洛肯
319321064.content: Would you just tell me? I don't wanna think.

319321065.speaker: 托特
319321065.content: You don't want to think, or you don't want to talk?

319321067.speaker: 托特
319321067.content: Then I take it you already know the answer.

319321068.speaker: 洛肯
319321068.content: Sure. I am a genius, after all.

319321069.speaker: 洛肯
319321069.content: ... There are certain things that should not exist at all.

319321071.content: Lokken looks at her long, strong arms that are being restrained by cuffs. She glances up at Thoth, only to see her looking at Lokken out of the corner of her eye.

319321072.speaker: 托特
319321072.content: Is that what you think, too?

319331001.speaker: 老人
319331001.content: Haha! Molander may not be as advanced as a larger place like Core City, but we have all that we need here.

319331002.speaker: 老人
319331002.content: The young 'uns who like to have their fun, they can go to the city. Old folks like me should lead a slower life instead.

319331003.speaker: 老人
319331003.content: Every generation thinks differently. Young people always say they're busy with work and don't have the time to visit. I understand, you know. They're afraid that they'll have nothing to say to us when they return. That would be so awkward, don't you think? Hahaha.

319331004.speaker: 老人
319331004.content: So, young lady, are you here to visit family? Where do you go to school?

319331006.speaker: 老人
319331006.content: Oh, then the school you go to must be a really good one. You look like a clever child.

319331007.speaker: 老人
319331007.content: You should go home now. And I should set out on my walk.

319331008.content:
"Crossed the vast glaciers in my warship, I did, back to my pasture and farm."
"Had a barrel of mead at the banquet, I did, and shared it with my friends and love."

319331009.content:
"My hometown is safe from the rage of war, and glory is seen in its scars."
"The ancient runes may have faded away, but still we tell the tales of the stars."

319331010.content: Hands behind his back, the old man softly sings a song from an unknown time. It's a tune Ver has never heard before. Maybe it was a popular song from when he was young. It's full of fervent imaginings, but it also feels like everyday life.

319331011.content: What she remembers most about Molander is warm mornings like this one. They feel familiar and intimate, like the nostalgic singing of the old man, a world completely different from the ruins of the empty city to the north.

319331012.content: The light yellow rays of the sun have warmed the streets and squares, and she can see and hear nothing but the right amount of buzz for a town of its age. It's like everyone is on a wooden boat, floating leisurely across a lake.

319331013.content: The ground is still a little damp from rain not too long ago. A damp coolness reminiscent of early autumn can be felt through the soles of one's feet.

319331014.content: Ver takes a deep breath and finally unclenches the fists she's been making all this way.

319331016.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331016.content: It's only been a year since I was last here. Why has everything changed? ... I wonder how my parents are doing.

319331017.content: After looking around for a while, Ver begins to walk in the direction of the old town. However, she is soon stopped in her tracks by a certain enticing aroma, and she can't stop herself from rubbing her stomach.

319331018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331018.content: ... Is this how it feels to have not eaten for ten days?

319331019.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331019.content: Though I can't starve to death, I sure am hungry.

319331020.content: While Modifiers do not need to consume food to survive, they continue to feel the sensations they did prior to Awakening, such as appetite and hunger.

319331021.content: The source of the enticing aroma is a bakery, one that Ver remembers very well. When she was a child, she always saw a long line of customers whenever she walked by, and often she would spot a familiar face or two in the crowd.

319331023.content: The lady at the front of the line turns around. She stares blankly for a moment when she sees Ver.

319331025.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331025.content: How wonderful it is to see you here! I just returned to Molander. I feel like you look ten years younger.

319331027.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331027.content: I see that business here is as good as ever. If I join the line now, it'd probably be fifteen minutes or more before it's my turn...

319331028.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331028.content: How's everything at the school, Miss Erica? How is Headmaster Holly doing?

319331030.content: Ver's friendliness seems to take Miss Erica aback. She looks down and brushes hair off of her face. Finally, she doubtfully shakes her head.

319331031.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331031.content: I'm sorry, but I don't recognize you... Are you a family member of one of our students?

319331034.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331034.content: That's right, Verthandi from Class C. I haven't changed that much, have I?

319331035.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331035.content: I'm sorry, but I truly have no memory of you.

319331036.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331036.content: It's true that my name is Erica... But... might you have mistaken me for someone else?

319331037.content: Looking at the middle school teacher who's smiling apologetically at her, Ver feels like a bucket of cold water has been poured on her head. It's quite some time before she regains her composure.

319331038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331038.content: Miss Erica, I only graduated two years ago! Is this because I did so poorly at school...?

319331039.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331039.content: Two years ago? Were you in Class C in '03? Then I didn't teach you. You must have mistaken me for someone else.

319331040.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331040.content: What? Miss Erica, you must have made a mistake. I'm from the class of '13.

319331041.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331041.content: I... Please stop pulling my leg. I really don't recognize you at all. And I remember each and every student I've taught very well.

319331042.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331042.content: Are you filming for some kind of "gotcha" TV show? The new one on Ultrasensory Entertainment? Do you think I could speak to your producer for a quick moment...?

319331043.content: Erica carefully looks around, but she doesn't see any camera drones following her. She's about to turn back and face forward, when she sees Ver's confused expression.

319331044.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331044.content: Why doesn't Miss Erica recognize me...? This is so strange.

319331045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331045.content: I'm not lying to you, I promise. The day our class sat for our graduation picture, you sat in front of me. And afterwards, you even told me to come back to Molander as often as I can.

319331046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331046.content: I still remember the day I didn't wake up on time and my hair was a mess because I ran to school. Luckily, you had a comb and brushed my hair for me.

319331047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331047.content: I even remember a time Sinclaire was trying to play cool by jumping out at Headmaster Holly while wearing that giant hood, and ended up having to stand in the corner...

319331048.content: The line in front of the bakery is moving slowly, and the look of incomprehension remains on Miss Erica's face. Little by little, Ver comes to understand there is no point in talking to her anymore.

319331049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319331049.content: ... I'm sorry. I guess I must have mistaken you for someone else.

319331050.content: But Erica can't bear to see Ver go like this. She switches places with a customer behind her and soothingly pats Ver on the back.

319331051.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331051.content: I don't know why you said you're a graduate of the class of 2313, but if you are mistaken about something, maybe you can speak to some other people.

319331052.speaker: 艾莉卡
319331052.content: It's not that I'm refusing to believe you. But first and foremost, you should know that what you're saying is impossible. After all...

319331053.content: Erica pulls up her terminal and enlarges the clock to show it to Ver.

319341001.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341001.content: Question! What year are we in right now?

319341002.speaker: 路人A
319341002.content: I know! We're in the year 2305!

319341003.speaker: 路人B
319341003.content: Well, I thought I knew before you asked. Let me see... Yep, it's 2305, alright...

319341004.speaker: 路人C
319341004.content: Huh? Are you alright, little girl? It's 2305.

319341005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341005.content: You're saying that, too... but it says 2315 on my terminal. Look.

319341006.content: The middle-aged man rolls his eyes, disconnects his terminal from the network clock, changes the year on it to "2325," and then shoves his terminal in front of Ver.

319341007.speaker: 路人C
319341007.content: Fine, I was lying to you just now. It's now the year 2325.

319341008.speaker: 路人C
319341008.content: Now let me show you some magic, little girl... TADA! Now it's the year 9999!

319341009.content: Every single passerby Ver has asked gave the exact same answer. Now she's beginning to feel like she's on a prank TV show.

319341010.content: She's standing at a street corner, looking down at the "2315" and the "Network Clock Connected" text on her terminal.

319341011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341011.content: Are we even on the same network at this point...??? Did I really travel through time???

319341012.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341012.content: ... I ought to go back to Aether Gazer for a look.

319341013.content: The Photon Rail station in the Old Town isn't far from where Ver is. She purchases a ticket for Core City, then boards the train with much trepidation.

319341014.content: The train steadily ascends on the elevated track, reaching more than 40 meters above ground, then slowly starts to accelerate towards the north. Through the window, the whole of Nordburg appears to be covered by a veil of light, making it look both real and unreal at the same time.

319341015.content: But Ver is in no mood to enjoy the scenery. She pulls out her terminal, looks up her contact history with Admin, and tries to connect again.

319341016.content: "Call target not found in service zone."

319341017.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341017.content: ... Oh, that's right. I was the one who gave Admin their terminal after we met. It doesn't exist yet.

319341018.content: Ver thinks as she bites her lip. A little while later, she looks up the number of the Division Nine duty office.

319341019.speaker: 深空之眼修正者
319341019.content: Hello, this is Aether Gazer. How can I help you?

319341020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341020.content: Hi... My name is Verthandi. I'm a Modifier who joined the Special Task Force in the year 2314.

319341021.speaker: 深空之眼修正者
319341021.content: I'm sorry... Do you mean that you hope to join us in the year 2314?

319341022.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341022.content: No, no, I time-traveled here from the year 2315.

319341023.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341023.content: I can prove my identity. Might it be possible for Aether Gazer to send me back to where I came from?

319341024.speaker: 深空之眼修正者
319341024.content: Time travel... Alright. Would you be able to come over to Aether Gazer to tell us more? About what you're saying happened?

319341025.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341025.content: Are you really willing to believe me???

319341026.speaker: 深空之眼修正者
319341026.content: Well, loads of odd things have happened before in Gaea before after all... But of course, you have to be telling the truth. If this is some kind of prank, know that we'll deal with it harshly.

319341027.speaker: 深空之眼修正者
319341027.content: Just to make sure that I heard you right: did you say that you time-traveled here from the year 2315?

319341029.content: The train slowly speeds up, and soon, they're almost on the edge of town. Ver looks out the window in a daze while continuing to speak.

319341030.content: But like a video that's been paused, the scene in front of her suddenly stops moving backwards. Ver blinks, and raises her eyes to look at the world ahead.

319341031.content: The train appears to have crossed some boundary between reality and illusion while she's been left behind that line. The train car behind her passes through her body like it's a holographic image, then takes on substantial form again as it hurtles away into the distance.

319341032.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341032.content: ... What in the world is going on?

319341033.content: The rear of the car quickly disappears from Ver's view. Ver, who's still in a sitting position, starts to feel the pull of gravity again, and her body, which had been suspended nearly 50 meters in the air, goes into freefall.

319341034.content: Her heart is in her mouth. She instinctively curls up and tries to summon the Shield of Fate to cushion her body from the impact before she remembers that the shield is still damaged from her fight with Gremory. Besides, it's not going to be easy to call on her Divine Power after all that fighting she's done.

319341035.content: It'd take less than four seconds for an object to fall to earth from 50 meters high. Ver's eyes suddenly go blank as she watches the ground grow bigger and bigger in her field of vision.

319341037.content: A certain force in her body, one that she can't quite describe, has replaced her thoughts, it looks like. It's turned her body upright in the air, directing her to approach the ground below like some kind of drill, head up and without any form of protection.

319341038.content: The ground shakes violently from the impact of her fall. The resultant gravel and dust cloud attracts the surrounding AGI Mechas on guard, which quickly swarm and surround the half-kneeling Ver.

319341039.content: But before the AGI Mecha could issue any warnings, red energy waves begin to spread outwards like aftershocks with Ver at the center of the circle, and these sweep across the AGI Mechas in the blink of an eye.

319341040.content: All the AGI Mechas fall into a brief silence. Then, they raise their weapons at Ver.

319341042.content: Ver, feeling dizzy, has gotten up on her feet with her hands on her head, and the moment he sees these AGI Mechas she knows full well what just happened to them.

319341043.content: For a moment, she's tempted to summon her Access Key to destroy these corrupted AGI Mechas, but then she notices that several people on the street not far away have been pointing their cameras at her.

319341044.content: Although she's on the edge of town, it's not exactly inhabited out here, and she knows full well that once she's caught in a picture word of the incident will soon spread like wildfire online.

319341045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341045.content: (What do I do now... should I lure them somewhere else?)

319341046.content: Feeling that she doesn't have any more time to waste, Ver quickly turns and run aways from the town center, in the direction her train for Core City was heading to.

319341047.content: And so, once again, she stumbles back two steps, as if she's just hit a sponge wall. She looks to her front, her hand to her hand, but she sees no visible obstacle or barrier.

319341048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341048.content: Did I... just run into something?

319341049.content: She carefully extends her hand and feels something pushing back on her fingertips.

319341050.content: At the same time, she spots a translucent blue hexagonal grid gradually spreading outward from the spot her fingers are touching. The grid moves along with her hand, like a wall that will disappear as soon as there's no contact.

319341051.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341051.content: A data wall? Isn't this how CORG seals off disaster zones???

319341052.content: The watch suddenly sounds an alert, but Ver is not in the mood to look at it now. Neither is she concerned about being seen by civilians anymore. She takes out her Runic Blade, and tries to drive its tip into the invisible barrier in a mighty forward motion.

319341053.content: This action of hers doesn't have much of an impact. The interaction between the barrier and her Access Key is as pure as a physics experiment under ideal conditions: the two-way conversion of action and reaction, and kinetic energy and potential energy...

319341054.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341054.content: ... Why does this data wall feel harder than it should be, according to the ops handbook?

319341055.content: Seeing the AGI Mechas coming at her from behind, Ver is about to fight back when he suddenly sees a beam of light go through the cores of those AGI Mechas at a speed that'd be difficult for ordinary people to discern.

319341056.content: Then, her eyes grow wide, for before she could see where that beam of light had come from there is that sensation of something wrapping around her at the waist before she's suddenly pulled into the alley next to her.

319341059.content: Ver's heart stops for a moment when she's dragged away from the back. But she then breathes a sigh of relief when she looks back and recognizes the one with their hand on her.

319341060.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341060.content: Oh, Captain Thoth! You're here, too.

319341062.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341062.content: I saw you just moments ago. You're just in a different set of clothes.

319341063.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341063.content: Is your mission in the north complete? And do you know what's going on? My terminal tells me it's the year 2315, but everyone keeps saying we're in the year 2305!

319341064.speaker: 托特
319341064.content: The north... Ah, I see that you've already met her. It's just as well.

319341065.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341065.content: Hmm? Who are you talking about? Lokken?

319341066.speaker: 托特
319341066.content: I'm talking about me. Well, the me of 2305, anyway.

319341068.content: The beeping of Ver's watch, quiet though it is, can be heard clearly in the ensuing silence. Thoth and Ver look at each other's wrists—they're wearing identical watches on their left arms.

319341069.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341069.content: Why do you have one, too? Does it belong to you?

319341070.speaker: 托特
319341070.content: Come with me. I'll explain it to you along the way.

319341071.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341071.content: What are we going to do? Are we going back?

319341073.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341073.content: Back to Aether Gazer, of course. I need to find out how the Admin is doing. And I have to make my report to Odin and Shu.

319341075.content: The two of them suddenly stop walking. Thoth is looking at Ver, who's waiting expectantly for an answer. She knows she must look like a teacher staring at a student who hasn't done the reading for class.

319341076.speaker: 托特
319341076.content: I thought I had to check things out and make sure you were used to the environment here... Looks like there was no need.

319341078.speaker: 托特
319341078.content: The Administrator you speak of is fine—

319341080.speaker: 托特
319341080.content: Please, let me finish... You passed out from the Bane Energy corrosion you suffered at Xu Heng. I brought you to CORG for treatment, and you only came to today. It's been ten days.

319341081.speaker: 托特
319341081.content: #{nickname}# came by to visit you, even sitting outside your ward for four days. No amount of persuasion could get them to leave.

319341083.speaker: 托特
319341083.content: Then Shu stopped by and told #{nickname}# to go to Sasanami with some of your people.

319341084.speaker: 托特
319341084.content: I heard a little about the joint operation with CORG. It was going well, last I heard.

319341085.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341085.content: Oh... That's good to know. Thank you, Captain Thoth.

319341086.speaker: 托特
319341086.content: You can just call me Thoth.

319341088.speaker: 托特
319341088.content: Odin and Shu are aware that you're here. They want you to stay here while you convalesce. Surely you'll do as they say?

319341090.content: Ver looks down at her chest again. The red marks have disappeared, and she can't feel any pain at the moment.

319341091.speaker: 托特
319341091.content: Don't tell me you're okay. You saw those AGI Mechas just now too.

319341092.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341092.content: They were... corrupted by Bane Energy...

319341093.speaker: 托特
319341093.content: And you should know very well how they were corrupted...

319341094.speaker: 托特
319341094.content: The source of that Bane Energy is you.

319341096.speaker: 托特
319341096.content: You fought with Gremory at Xu Heng, and your body became severely corrupted by Bane Energy as a result. CORG has been working over the last ten days to stabilize the energies inside you, though we were unable to remove them.

319341097.speaker: 托特
319341097.content: Let me guess: You can't control your Divine Grace during battle. You can't summon it and you can't quite tamp it down either, can you?

319341099.speaker: 托特
319341099.content: All of the CORG doctors who've looked at you are desperate to know how you got yourself in this state. Though it looks like Bane Energy corrosion, they haven't been able to find a trace of it in you. Do you want to tell me what happened?

319341100.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341100.content: I'm not sure myself. I only remember that I really wanted to defeat Gremory and the Admin was in danger. So I tried really hard and...

319341103.content: The watch continues to sound its alarm. Thoth looks at Ver, who's glanced away, and sighs before she pulls Ver along with her. There's no point in asking more questions right now.

319341104.speaker: 托特
319341104.content: We decided to bring you here, to the hyperspace, to resolve your condition. The Bane Energy in your body seems to be rather stable right now, but we have no idea when it might erupt again. Neither do we know if it'd affect you during combat.

319341105.speaker: 托特
319341105.content: Looks like you're even more severely corrupted than we thought... Should the Bane Energy erupt, you could easily hurt the people around you.

319341106.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341106.content:
That sounds bad... Then I should definitely recover before I go back.
But doesn't coming into contact with me like that do anything to you?

319341107.speaker: 托特
319341107.content: Well, as well as you're alright, I guess...

319341108.speaker: 托特
319341108.content: We can talk about what's going on with your body again later. In the meantime, I'll give you an update on what's happening.

319341109.speaker: 托特
319341109.content: I can confirm that the Molander City you see right now, as well as everyone in it, including the Thoth and Lokken you saw earlier, are all from the year 2305.

319341110.speaker: 托特
319341110.content: Only you and I have been "shifted" into this World Line from 2315. This is temporary.

319341111.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319341111.content: So I did travel through time... But how do I get back?

319341112.speaker: 托特
319341112.content: No, not a time slip. Try not to think too much about the science fiction movies you've seen for now.

319341113.speaker: 托特
319341113.content: Your terminal is showing the year 2315 because it's connected to the network relay layer specially built by CORG for the hyperspace. As long as there's a good signal, we can go back at any time.

319341114.speaker: 托特
319341114.content: This is, after all, just an experiment. The "Off-axis Branching Space Algorithm Experiment."

319351002.content: Ver and Thoth have stopped in front of a nondescript-looking bookstore. A weathered wooden sign is painted with the words "Land of Moons."

319351003.content: Thoth takes out a key and inserts it into the door's keyhole. She turns it gently and, to Ver's surprise, opens the door.

319351004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319351004.content: Is this a safehouse with a bookstore as a front?

319351005.speaker: 托特
319351005.content: No, it's just a bookstore. An actual bookstore.

319351006.speaker: 托特
319351006.content: But I suppose you can think of it as a safehouse, too. I mean, I do own this place.

319351007.content: Thoth turns back at Ver, flashes her a sly smile and shakes the key in her hand, then pulls Ver into the bookstore.

319351008.content: Matching the vintage look of the door lock, the interior of the bookstore, which is filled with physical books, doesn't appear very high-tech at all. There's a faint, musty smell in the air, too. The store appears to have been around for quite some time.

319351009.content: The bookshelves are all made of solid wood, and the terminal used at the cashier's desk is dated to the previous century. There's even a quill pen on the desk, though it's not quite clear if it's there simply as decoration...

319351010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319351010.content: I didn't know there was a bookstore like this in Molander...

319351011.speaker: 托特
319351011.content: That's because I also have a job at CORG. The bookstore isn't open very often, and very few people know about this place.

319351012.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319351012.content: Oh? Aren't you losing money, then? Why don't you hire someone to look after the store?

319351013.speaker: 托特
319351013.content: I'm not able to rest easy unless I'm here myself... This bookstore used to belong to a friend of mine.

319351014.speaker: 托特
319351014.content:
If I lose money, so be it. At least I know that in 2315, it hasn't closed down yet.
Let's turn off that alarm first.

319351015.content: Ver doesn't understand what Thoth is saying. Thoth, unsurprised, takes Ver's right hand and raises it between the two of them.

319351017.speaker: 手表
319351017.content:
Verifying... User verified.
Commander T.T is now in charge.

319351019.speaker: 托特
319351019.content: Command: I-one-zero, manual. Parallel operation: C-zero-five-X, remove proxy.

319351020.content: The beeping from the watch finally stops. At the same time, it automatically connects to Ver's terminal, and out pops an instruction manual with detailed images and text.

319351021.speaker: 托特
319351021.content: You can refer to the manual for how to operate the watch. I've already shown you some commands by saying them out loud, but once you're familiar with the instructions, you can just say them in your mind.

319351022.speaker: 托特
319351022.content: Also, be careful when you're in a fight, and don't you use the watch as protective gear. This is CORG property. It may not cost you anything, but it'll still be a terrible bother if it's damaged.

319351023.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319351023.content: In a fight? Where are the Visbanes?

319351024.speaker: 托特
319351024.content: Not Visbanes... (Sighs) Just what was Paracaesar thinking? Why did he okay the participation of a layman in the experiment?

319351025.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319351025.content: Um, hello, I'm a Modifier. Calling me a "layman" is a bit harsh...

319351026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319351026.content: If it's not Visbanes... Don't tell me it's something that even Divine Power can't handle? Just what can that be?

319351029.content: Thoth doesn't explain further. Instead, she changes from civilian clothes into her combat uniform, which matches her Access Key. Then she locks the door of the bookstore, closes the curtains, and checks the time.

319351030.speaker: 托特
319351030.content: Alright, give it to me straight: On a scale of one to 100, with a hundred being your usual strength level, where are you now, do you think?

319351034.speaker: 托特
319351034.content: I know you want things to happen really badly, but... that's not enough, you know. You wouldn't have nearly gone out of control over by the Photon Rail track just now otherwise.

319351035.speaker: 托特
319351035.content: So don't force yourself to do anything. Just stay behind me if you feel you can't hang in there any more.

319351037.speaker: 托特
319351037.content:
Good. Let's get going, then.
Remember this command, as you may use it often.

319351039.content: Everything starts spinning around Ver, as if gravity and the ground beneath her feet have both begun to rotate. The bookstore is being stretched into three-dimensional lines in a four-dimensional view, shaking her so hard that she can't even open her eyes.

319351040.content: Thankfully, this strange change in gravity soon stops, and Ver's senses return to normal. Thoth starts walking toward the door as if nothing has happened, and a giddy Ver tags along while rubbing her eyes.

319351041.content: The watch on her wrist has lit up in response to one thing or another, and a phrase in orange flashes on the screen, as though providing its wearer some kind of warning.

319351043.speaker: 托特
319351043.content: You could also call it the "frontline."

319351044.content: With her Access Key ready for action, Thoth opens the door.

319351045.content: It feels like the two of them have walked out of a fire-warmed hut after a heavy snowstorm—all they see is a screen of pure gray and white stretching from the front steps to the sky.

319351046.content: There is no warmth or color to speak of. Neither is there any trace of time, nor life or death.

319351047.content: There appears to be light but also no light at the same time. Throughout their entire field of vision, there is an inexplicable mix of darkness and light.

319361001.speaker: 托特
319361001.content: ... The Data Plane Layer is Gaea's "base model," so to speak. The "world" as we know it, or rather, the various Sephirah Zones that we live in, were all built in this space.

319361002.speaker: 托特
319361002.content: There are neither humans nor Visbanes here. Had Red Fox not given us OPRIC-level permissions, we Modifiers wouldn't be able to access this place. So, at the very least, this is a rare peek behind the curtain for us.

319361003.speaker: 托特
319361003.content: The city that you see before you, its buildings and streets... that's the foundation of Molander City. Apart from the humans, everything in hyperspace is a reflection of what is here.

319361004.speaker: 托特
319361004.content: Therefore, Gaea's rejection of hyperspace must start here. After all, this place is far away from humans, but very close to Gaea. Which means whoever attempts sabotage here has a much lower chance of being thwarted.

319361005.speaker: 托特
319361005.content: What we have to do is to stop Gaea's "cleaners" so that hyperspace can be maintained until all parties get what they want... Photography is forbidden here. Delete your photos.

319361006.content: Thoth turns back to see Ver holding up her terminal and looking around like a curious child. She rubs her temple in vexation, then stops to wait for Ver.

319361007.speaker: 托特
319361007.content: Did you hear what I said just now?

319361008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361008.content: Yeah, yeah. I'll stop taking pictures.

319361009.speaker: 托特
319361009.content: No... I mean the stuff before that.

319361010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361010.content: More or less, I think... In short, this is a place we have to protect, as it's very important.

319361011.speaker: 托特
319361011.content:
That's good enough.
Why the long face? Any other questions?

319361012.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361012.content: About those "cleaners" you mentioned—they sound like they're doing Gaea a favor, no? Could they be Modifiers too? Wouldn't that make us the bad guys?

319361013.speaker: 托特
319361013.content: You're overthinking this... Those things are called "Realm Cleansers." Just think of them as AGI Mechas.

319361014.speaker: 托特
319361014.content: The first group will arrive on those streets over there in ten minutes. I promise you won't have any more concerns once you see them.

319361015.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361015.content: Hmm, I have fought quite a few AGI Mechas before... But are you sure this is alright? And doesn't contravene Gaea's rules in any way?

319361016.speaker: 托特
319361016.content: I know what you're worried about. We Modifiers have our roles to play, and Gaea has never put down clear rules about this either. So that's not for us to ponder anyway.

319361018.content: Ver continues to follow Thoth for some time and decides to examine her surroundings along the way. Although everything seems to made up of large bricks, Ver keeps talking to herself in a low voice, like an awed tourist.

319361020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361020.content: That area right over there is the middle school I went to. It looks exactly the same. Amazing.

319361021.speaker: 托特
319361021.content: I can't believe that you IDed it... Hold on. "Middle school"? Are you from Molander too?

319361022.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361022.content: I am... Huh? I thought this fact was known to CORG.

319361023.speaker: 托特
319361023.content: Why would CORG concern itself with the time before you Awakened...? So back in the year 2305, were you living here in Molander?

319361024.speaker: 托特
319361024.content: Have you run into the version of yourself from ten years ago yet?

319361025.content: Ver's jaw drops. A brief moment later, she slaps herself on the head hard, as if she's chastising herself for being so slow to grasp the situation.

319361026.content: Since she's already met two Thoths, naturally, there would be another version of herself running around as well.

319361027.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361027.content: Hold on, hold on... Let me think. I think it's September 8th, 2305, today. In September 2305, I would have been—

319361028.content: Ver's enthusiasm quickly flags, and she stops herself mid-sentence. The excitement in her eyes is soon shrouded in confusion.

319361029.speaker: 托特
319361029.content: ... If it's something unpleasant, you don't have to say it.

319361031.content: Ver collects herself, smiles, and waves her hands. Her tone of voice is calm, thought she seems to be even more thoughtful than usual.

319361032.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361032.content:
I think it's better described as the most important part of my life.
Capt— Um, Thoth, have you heard of the Saint Sophia Medical Center?

319361033.speaker: 托特
319361033.content: Yes. It's in the southern part of the city, in the new residential zone, isn't it? It closed down after just a few years of operation.

319361034.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361034.content:
Yeah, that's the one.
I must have been there at the time.

319361035.speaker: 托特
319361035.content: Were you in the hospital? What were you ill with?

319361036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361036.content: I don't remember much, as I was still a young child then. I think there was something wrong with my heart.

319361037.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361037.content: At that time I was really ill, and all the doctors said I couldn't be cured. Even I had given up... And then I underwent a surgery and miraculously recovered after that.

319361038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361038.content: It was there that I made my first and second friends, and I learned many things from them. I was adopted by my parents after I was discharged from the hospital, and they were always really good to me...

319361039.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361039.content: The only thing is, I have no idea who sent me to Saint Sophia in the first place. I used to think that it was my biological parents, but then I learned that we Modifiers do not have biological parents. Which means it must have been a kindhearted stranger.

319361040.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361040.content: If I ever meet that person, I must thank them properly.

319361041.speaker: 托特
319361041.content: That's odd. I rarely hear of Modifiers who were that ill when they were younger. It's unfortunate you drew the short straw there.

319361042.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361042.content: Heh. The pain of the attacks aside, I did enjoy the few months I was in the hospital.

319361043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361043.content: Now that you mention it, it'd be nice to see myself as a child... I suppose that's permitted?

319361044.speaker: 托特
319361044.content: Yes, it is. But you mustn't change too much of her life trajectory. It'd be best if you don't tell her your true name.

319361045.speaker: 托特
319361045.content: The butterfly effect is unpredictable. If this encounter leads to drastic changes in the World Line, I'd have no choice but to take you to the Data Plane Layer for overtime every day.

319361046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361046.content: That won't happen, I promise. I just want to see her and Tarina. I swear I'll be good.

319361048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361048.content: Tarina was my first friend. She was really ill too, and her bed was right next to mine. I learned soon after my surgery that she had passed away.

319361049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319361049.content: She was such a lovely girl, as bright as the sun. I wish she could have been cured as well. Do you think we can—

319361052.speaker: 托特
319361052.content: ... I really hope you know exactly why I said that.

319361053.content: Seeing Ver's undisguised disappointment, Thoth lets out a quiet sigh. The words displayed on the watch's screen have turned a dazzling red, and she looks up at the sky.

319361054.speaker: 托特
319361054.content: Gaea will never acknowledge the existence of the hyperspace. To Gaea, everything here is just redundant data that shouldn't exist.

319361055.speaker: 托特
319361055.content: The Visbanes can tear us apart and completely corrode us, but like a god, Gaea will simply continue to watch us dispassionately. It will continue to watch the lives that it deems "meaningful."

319361056.speaker: 托特
319361056.content: And that's the best you can ask for from something with no emotions.

319361058.speaker: 托特
319361058.content: ... Does a bird like to be locked in a cage?

319361059.content: Without caring if Ver has understood what she just said, Thoth squints slightly to look at spots of light that are falling from far away and toward them like meteorites, then unsheathes her blade.

319361060.speaker: 托特
319361060.content: Instead of thinking about things that don't matter, why not spend your time thinking about how things can be improved instead? And also...

319361061.speaker: 托特
319361061.content: Looking out for any trouble that might be ahead of us.

319371001.content: Back at the bookstore, Thoth takes out a key again. Although the interior of the bookstore looks exactly the same in the Plane Layer, the door has not stayed closed in hyperspace.

319371002.content: Thoth still doesn't seem to have any intention of opening the store. She changes back into civilian clothing, then sees Ver staring at the old clock on the wall in a daze.

319371003.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371003.content: ... Has it only been two hours? It felt a lot longer than that.

319371004.speaker: 托特
319371004.content: You might still be getting used to things. After all, you've only just arrived in an unfamiliar environment.

319371005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371005.content: But I think I'm actually doing okay here...

319371006.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371006.content: I wonder how the Admin is doing in Sasanami. Field missions are always so treacherous.

319371007.speaker: 托特
319371007.content: CORG picked some of its best people for the excursion, and Aether Gazer sent out the Pheasant Squad as well. Besides, there are the Modifiers based in Sasanami, too... And in your current state, it's unlikely you'd be able to help much, anyway.

319371008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371008.content: I'm just concerned that something similar to what happened in Xu Heng is happening there...

319371009.speaker: 托特
319371009.content: You can't be the only one thinking that. Do you imagine that #{nickname}# would have allowed you to go if they knew you weren't fully recovered?

319371011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371011.content: Hmm, do you know the Admin? Why does it sound like you know them very well?

319371012.speaker: 托特
319371012.content: ... I've met them a few times.

319371013.speaker: 托特
319371013.content: Don't overthink things, and get some rest. Today is only Day 1. We may be here for weeks.

319371014.speaker: 托特
319371014.content: You can stay here from now on. You'll find a bedroom behind that door. Make yourself at home.

319371015.content: Ver is dumbfounded for a moment by the sudden realization that she really has nowhere to go in the Molander of 2305. After all, not a single soul here knows who she is.

319371016.speaker: 托特
319371016.content: The bookstore can function as a safehouse for you. Our techs have reinforced the data here, so this should be the safest place in the hyperspace.

319371017.speaker: 托特
319371017.content: Should we run into trouble, such as data damage, hyperspace disintegration, Gaea suddenly gearing up its counteraction, Quakes, or anything else—we can shift directly from the bookstore back to the Axis World...

319371019.speaker: 托特
319371019.content: While we do not have any records of Quakes in the year 2305, the hyperspace does not adhere exactly to history.

319371020.speaker: 托特
319371020.content: As there are traces of Visbane activity nearby, we shouldn't discount the possibility of Quakes. Otherwise, the me of this era wouldn't have been at Nordburg.

319371021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371021.content: The north side, huh... You know, when she and I... I mean, when you and I went our separate ways, I heard you say something about a "crack." It sounded like you were anxious to find something in the Source Layer.

319371022.speaker: 托特
319371022.content: How did you know about the Source Layer? Who told you?

319371023.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371023.content: I ran into her there, and I made it out of the Source Layer by following her.

319371024.content: Thoth slowly puts down the tea she'd just raised to her mouth, as though she's heard something she didn't expect at all. Her expression is grave.

319371025.content: She questions Ver further, and the latter recounts everything that happened to her in that strange space.

319371027.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371027.content: You have to believe me. Although I don't quite understand what's going on, I'm fairly sure it was all real... I've really had too many dreams and hallucinations lately.

319371028.speaker: 托特
319371028.content: I wasn't saying I doubt you. In fact, you may have just helped me a great deal.

319371029.content: As Thoth speaks, she hands her cup of tea to Ver, turns around, and heads for the door.

319371030.speaker: 托特
319371030.content: There's something I have to attend to. Stay inside the store and don't go anywhere, and don't open the door if a customer comes knocking. Make sure to stay out of trouble, understand?

319371031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371031.content: Okay.But what do I do for lunch?

319371032.content: Thoth pauses mid-stride. She places the key to the bookstore on the table, opens the door, and then looks back at Ver with an expression of worry on her face.

319371033.speaker: 托特
319371033.content: There's no way you can get lost, since you grew up here...

319371034.speaker: 托特
319371034.content: There are a number of small dining places in the area. Come back here right after your meal, and remember to lock the door.

319371036.content: With its door and windows shut, the bookstore feels like a delicate cage, an odd embellishment on this deserted street corner. Small particles of dust dance in the morning light, the bookshelves shrouded in the shadows cast by the windows. The scent of ink and paper is thick in the air.

319371037.content: As the clock ticks away rhythmically, the silent spots of light move slowly and evenly, and in a blink of an eye, they've moved to Ver, who is sitting in a daze by a bookshelf.

319371038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319371038.content: It's been two hours and she still isn't back yet...

319371039.content: Ver stands up once again, then walks around the somewhat narrow passages of the bookstore a few times.

319371040.content: She's just mere steps away from door, and it's as if she's been gripped by some kind of magic that simply doesn't allow her to look away from the door handle.

319371041.content: Many distant, fuzzy images have been filling her mind. In these two hours of quiet and solitude, the voices in those scenes have gradually grown clearer. They seem to be calling to her from outside the door. It's getting harder to heed Thoth's instructions and not go anywhere...

319371043.content: Ver rubs her stomach, then presses down on it forcefully. Then she picks up the key Thoth left for her and, without any hesitation, opens the door.

319381002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381002.content: Then... where can I get a pass?

319381004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381004.content: Would you please just let me see Doctor Gloria? Just for a little while?

319381006.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381006.content: ... I'll go get myself something to eat, then.

319381009.content: But of course, she didn't head out the door for a meal.

319381011.content: Despite the rather imposing marble sign at the entrance to the park, there are very few people around. The only similarity the Land of Moons shares with Saint Sophia is how quiet it is.

319381012.content: Ver looks in exasperation at the AGI Mecha that is probably not programmed to say anything else. She bites her lip and retreats outside of its range of detection. As her eyes wander around the park's perimeter wall, she starts to think...

319381013.speaker: ？？？
319381013.content: You, too, find this place odd don't you?

319381014.content: Ver suddenly hears a strange yet familiar voice coming from behind her. She turns around and is almost poked in the nose by a lock of light green hair. This startles her so much that she immediately pulls back and turns around at the same time, then takes several steps away.

319381018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381018.content: Of course. Back in May, when I was having my checkup at the Medical Center—

319381019.content: Ver stops herself mid-sentence by hurriedly covering her mouth, then takes a quick glance at Ningishzida's wrist. Sure enough, she isn't wearing a watch.

319381020.content: The Aether Gazer Medical Center logo on Ningishzida's shirt tells Ver that she's got the right person. The problem is, the Aether Gazer of 2305 does not yet have a member named Verthandi.

319381021.content: Ver stares at Ningishzida as she breaks out in a cold sweat. After a brief silence, Ver slowly starts to calm down.

319381022.speaker: 宁希达
319381022.content: ... In May? Hmm... I don't recall, sorry. Did something happen then?

319381023.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381023.content: No, nothing! I just happened to see that you were on duty while I was passing by the Medical Center!

319381024.speaker: 宁希达
319381024.content: Oh? You must have a really good memory. I mean, that was, like, four months ago.

319381025.speaker: 宁希达
319381025.content: It's not something I'd remember, heh.

319381027.content: The only person who could be said to rival Verthandi in blitheness is Ningishzida.

319381028.speaker: 宁希达
319381028.content:
I'll skip the self-introduction, then.
And you? Are you one of the Modifiers with CORG?

319381030.speaker: 宁希达
319381030.content: I didn't see you behind the blockade. Were you on another mission?

319381031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381031.content: Um... You could say that, yeah...

319381032.speaker: 宁希达
319381032.content: Ah. I guess I should stop asking questions, then.

319381033.speaker: 宁希达
319381033.content: Um, hold on, just one more: What's your name?

319381035.speaker: 托特
319381035.content: Yes, it is. But you mustn't change too much of her life trajectory. It'd be best if you don't tell her your true name.

319381036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381036.content: That won't happen, I promise. I just want to see her and Tarina. I swear I'll be good.

319381038.speaker: 宁希达
319381038.content: Norn... Norn... Okay, I've committed that to memory.

319381039.content: Ningishzida walks around Ver, one hand on her hip and the other on her chin. She looks at this luxurious, but deserted, medical center with great seriousness.

319381040.speaker: 宁希达
319381040.content: Are the AGI Mechas still at their post? I can't get in unless they leave.

319381041.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381041.content: Why would the mechas leave their post, though?

319381042.speaker: 宁希达
319381042.content: You know—maybe they're low on battery, malfunctioning, due for scheduled maintenance, etc.... They surely have to leave at some point, no?

319381043.speaker: 宁希达
319381043.content: I've been here all morning. Maybe I should come back in the evening... But then there's the night curfew...

319381044.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381044.content: Um... do you know someone at this hospital?

319381046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381046.content: Why do you want to go in, then?

319381047.speaker: 宁希达
319381047.content: To ask the person in charge for help, of course.

319381048.content: Ningishzida pouts and turns to look at the streets. The atmosphere of those seemingly quiet and peaceful roads feels different than usual.

319381049.speaker: 宁希达
319381049.content: Well, Nordburg is sealed off now, and just about everyone has moved here to Sudburg, including long-term hospital patients and those with injuries. So naturally, all of the healthcare organizations here must work together to help out.

319381050.speaker: 宁希达
319381050.content: I've already gotten in touch with all of the other hospitals in Sudburg, and everyone has responded positively. This is the only one I couldn't even get contact details for. And they just wouldn't let me in.

319381051.speaker: 宁希达
319381051.content: But why would you want to go inside? Don't tell me there's some nefarious plot going on in there that CORG has to investigate?!

319381054.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381054.content: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to raise my voice at you.

319381055.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381055.content: It's just that... I know someone inside. I want to visit her.

319381056.speaker: 宁希达
319381056.content: You know someone inside... Do you think you can get her to bring us in?

319381057.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381057.content: Um, I'm not sure about that... She's rather unwell and isn't allowed to leave her ward most of the time.

319381058.speaker: 宁希达
319381058.content: Oh, she must be really ill, then? And you're okay with leaving her here? Wouldn't it be better to transfer her to the CORG hospital?

319381059.speaker: 宁希达
319381059.content: Or you could send her to us at Aether Gazer. I know a few doctors in Division Seven who are really good. I'm sure they could figure out some way to help her.

319381060.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381060.content: ... You're right. There must be something that would work for her.

319381061.content: The confidence in Ningishzida's face and tone of voice are oddly contagious. Her smiling eyes are like bright and colorful rainbows, brilliant enough to make people forget they're in the middle of a gray and dreary storm.

319381062.content: The idea Ver had, the one that was flatly rejected by Thoth, comes back to mind. The memories just keep on coming, pushing her in the direction of impulse and possibility.

319381063.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381063.content: Maybe Captain Thoth wasn't talking about that...

319381065.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319381065.content: Nothing. Let's try asking again and see if we can get in this time.

319381066.speaker: 宁希达
319381066.content: But the mecha only knows that one line! So how are we going to— Hmm. Just a moment.

319381067.content: Once again, they are stopped at the entrance by the security mecha. But this time, Ver has no intention of backing off.

319381068.content: The mecha drones its one and only line repeatedly as it raises its weapon at her. Ningishzida hurriedly steps in front of Ver.

319381069.speaker: 宁希达
319381069.content: Hey, don't be rash! What if the police arrest you for trespassing?!

319381071.content: The mecha stops abruptly at Ver's command, which she conveyed with a forced calmness. It points its sensor at her watch, and lines of code begin to scroll rapidly across the screen.

319381072.speaker: 宁希达
319381072.content: ... Huh? Why has it stopped moving? And what in the world is OPRIC?

319381074.speaker: 安保智械
319381074.content: User verified. Welcome to the Saint Sophia Medical Center. Please proceed to Visitor Reception in the main building.

319391001.speaker: 宁希达
319391001.content: ... How much longer do we have to wait?

319391002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391002.content: We've only been here five minutes. Since it's working hours now, I'm sure everyone is busy.

319391003.speaker: 宁希达
319391003.content: Busy? But I don't see a single patient here...

319391004.content: The conversation between the two girls becomes louder and more unguarded as time goes on, just like it would if they were in an unsupervised self-study session.

319391005.content: It isn't until they find someone standing outside the back door of the "classroom" that the two of them stop speaking and sit up straight, as though they've been caught for something.

319391008.content: Standing before them is a lady who looks like the very definition of dignity, from her dress and manners, to the way she respects personal space, to how she articulates words precisely and at just the right speed and cadence...

319391009.content: Ningishzida awkwardly fiddles with the ends of her hair, full of complaints that she's unable to air. She secretly glances at Ver beside her, only to see the corners of the latter's lips curl up in excitement.

319391011.speaker: ？？？
319391011.content:
I'm alright.
Take good care of her, Gloria.

319391013.speaker: 格罗娅
319391013.content: Oh, are you awake? You were curled into a ball the entire night. Sleeping like that is quite bad for your back... Wait, what am I saying?

319391014.speaker: 格罗娅
319391014.content: You don't have to be afraid anymore, Verthandi. If you'd like, you are free to treat this place as your home.

319391015.speaker: 格罗娅
319391015.content: ... Home? What is home? Hmm... Home is a place where people who care about each other can lean on one another. It's a place where they don't have to think about their troubles, and where they can sleep well every night.

319391016.speaker: 格罗娅
319391016.content: If you aren't sleeping well, perhaps I should buy you some stuffed animals. Having them could help shake you of that habit...

319391017.speaker: 格罗娅
319391017.content: Why are you sitting in the courtyard again? Are you hungry? It's time for lunch.

319391018.speaker: 格罗娅
319391018.content: Outside. Of course, I know that you're curious and want to do things. But in your current condition, it's not advisable for you to be outside.

319391019.speaker: 格罗娅
319391019.content: You may do whatever you wish when you're well again... I'll find a cure for you. I promise.

319391020.speaker: 格罗娅
319391020.content: Verthandi, say hello to the two of them.

319391021.speaker: 格罗娅
319391021.content: They will be your legal guardians from this day on. In other words, they are now your parents.

319391022.speaker: 格罗娅
319391022.content: What a wonderful development... From now on, you'll have a real home.

319391024.speaker: 格罗娅
319391024.content: What's that? I'm sorry, I didn't hear what you said just now.

319391025.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391025.content: It was nothing. Please don't mind me...

319391026.content: Gloria carefully studies the two girls in front of her, her gaze careful and polite. For some reason, her eyes linger on Ver for just a moment longer.

319391027.speaker: 格罗娅
319391027.content: I'm Gloria, the person in charge of the Saint Sophia Medical Center. I apologize for doing this here, but we generally don't entertain visitors.

319391028.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391028.content: That's alright, Doctor Gloria. We can stay here.

319391029.speaker: 格罗娅
319391029.content: Doctor... So you're from CORG... Sergeant OB2024.

319391030.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391030.content: You can just call me Norn. And I'm not here on business.

319391031.speaker: 格罗娅
319391031.content: I understand. So, Miss Norn, how can Saint Sophia help you today?

319391032.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391032.content: I just need a small favor—I want to visit a couple of patients here. But if you'd like to help... Ningishzida?

319391033.speaker: 宁希达
319391033.content: Huh? What? Is it my turn to speak now?

319391035.speaker: 宁希达
319391035.content: (Cough) I, um, my name is Ningishzida. I'm a medical consultant with Aether Gazer.

319391036.speaker: 格罗娅
319391036.content: Aether Gazer? So you're working with CORG?

319391037.speaker: 宁希达
319391037.content: Well, you know I can't tell you too much about CORG... (Cough) Oh, right. I should tell you why I'm here.

319391038.speaker: 宁希达
319391038.content: Doctor Gloria, there's currently an extremely high demand for healthcare resources in Molander City. I was wondering if Saint Sophia has any medication, personnel, or equipment they can spare...

319391039.content: Ningishzida is glancing down the hallway as she speaks. But all she sees are a handful of medical mechas coming out of the wards. There's not a single doctor in sight.

319391040.speaker: 格罗娅
319391040.content: I'm so sorry, Miss Ningishzida. We only have authorization from local authorities to provide private medical services.

319391042.speaker: 格罗娅
319391042.content: From the Department of Public Health Services. We're not authorized to allocate our supplies outside of the scope of our business. All of the people working here are considered physicians in the private sector, and we're not allowed to open our premises to the public.

319391043.speaker: 格罗娅
319391043.content: The recent events in Nordburg are, of course, highly regrettable.

319391045.speaker: 格罗娅
319391045.content: Looks like we've reached an understanding. So, Miss Norn, who is it you wish to see?

319391047.content: Although Ver is surprised by how quickly Ningishzida's proposal was rejected by Gloria, when she sees that Ningishzida appears to have accepted the doctor's explanation, Ver ultimately chooses not to intervene. After all, this is an issue she doesn't fully understand.

319391048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391048.content: I've hear there are two patients staying here. One of them is named Verthandi, and the other is Tarina.

319391051.content: Ver is taken aback by Gloria's interjection, which has come from out of the blue and in a tone of voice she's never, ever heard from the doctor before.

319391052.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391052.content: I'm sorry—did I say something to offend you? I assure you I didn't mean to... I just want to look in on them.

319391053.speaker: 格罗娅
319391053.content: There's no one you would know here.

319391054.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391054.content: Um—but I distinctly remember that they're in the intensive care unit...

319391056.speaker: 格罗娅
319391056.content: I don't know what you think you know about Saint Sophia, but no one is allowed into the intensive care unit without the express permission of our president. Even if you are OPRIC.

319391057.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391057.content: President? Aren't you the head of this center?

319391058.speaker: 格罗娅
319391058.content: It's interesting that you were able to learn the names of our patients, but you don't know the identity of the person in charge.

319391059.content: Ver stands there, mouth agape. She's at a loss as to how she should explain herself. She'd never met a "president" during her time at Saint Sophia. In fact, she doesn't remember seeing a single adult other than Gloria there.

319391060.speaker: 格罗娅
319391060.content: In short, I'm unable to let you in there. You should speak with your superiors if you have an issue with that.

319391061.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391061.content: I just want to see how they're doing...

319391064.content: Ver looks down at the ground helplessly and presses her fingers together hard. She's so close, but so far away.

319391065.content: Gloria looks at Ver and is silent for a moment. Then she gestures for the two of them to leave.

319391067.speaker: 宁希达
319391067.content: I think we should get out now, Norn.

319391068.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391068.content: But... it was so hard for me to come back here. Why do I have to stop now? It's like we're total strangers.

319391069.speaker: 宁希达
319391069.content: Did you used to live in Molander?

319391071.content: If only I could tell them my true name! The inability to say what she's really thinking and feeling is suffocating Ver.

319391072.content: But she grits her teeth and deals with it. After all, she's no longer her impulsive younger self, and she still remembers Thoth's admonishments and her own promise to not get in trouble.

319391073.content: Then, at that very moment, Ver's watch suddenly makes a sound. It startles her a little, and she stops speaking. Then she bows slightly to Gloria.

319391074.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391074.content: It—looks like I have something to attend to now. Thank you for seeing me, Doctor Gloria. I'll be off.

319391075.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319391075.content: But I'd ask that you give Ningishzida's proposal a little more thought. After all, helping other people is never the wrong choice...

319391076.content: Ver nods to Ningishzida and walks quickly to the door. Just as she takes a step outside, however, she hears Gloria say something to her very clearly.

319391079.speaker: 格罗娅
319391079.content: Their condition is stable for now.

319391080.speaker: 格罗娅
