319391080.content: I promise you, as a physician, that I'll do everything in my power to cure them.

319401001.content: After fumbling with the unfamiliar mechanism that is an old-school analog key for a while, Ver finally manages to scurry into the bookstore.

319401002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319401002.content: Thoth? Captain Thoth? Are you there?

319401003.content: There is no answer. Ver isn't quite sure what to do now. The joy of confirming that her childhood self is safe fizzles out all of a sudden.

319401004.content: Although Ver thinks it'd be wiser to wait for Thoth to return for now, her watch keeps on beeping. The thought of those Realm Cleansers destroying everything in the Data Plane Layer is gnawing at her.

319401005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319401005.content: I should be able to deal with them by myself, no? I just need to be careful.

319401006.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319401006.content: Okay, I think I was supposed to draw the curtains... Done.

319401007.content: Just as Thoth did before they traveled to the Data Plane Layer, Ver pulls the curtains shut one by one, then reads out the commands in what seems like a reasonable imitation of Thoth.

319401008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319401008.content: "Command: Framework—Plane Layer"... "Initiate transport"? Was that it? Or was it "Switch"...?

319401010.content: Right as Ver sees the alert on her watch saying that travel has been initiated, she hears a voice behind her. Her eyes widen and she turns around. Oh no.

319401012.speaker: 宁希达
319401012.content: You left in such a hurry, I thought you might be in trouble, so I followed you... Should I have not come in?

319401014.content: There's that familiar feeling again: Gravity and the ground have started to spin, and spin, and spin. Ver breaks out in a cold sweat and frantically looks around. Fortunately, she quickly spots a few watches lying in the corner of a bookshelf.

319401015.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319401015.content: So many of them? Please tell me they aren't fakes.

319401016.content: But there's no time to worry about that. Hearing Thoth's admonishment to never take the watch off in her mind, Ver picks one up and puts it on Ningishzida's wrist.

319401017.content: A look of joy appears on Ningishzida's face, the kind you see on someone who's just received a gift. But before she can say anything, the dizzying changes to their surroundings catch up to her and everything goes black.

319411002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319411002.content: Over there... I think she's a little freaked out.

319411003.speaker: 托特
319411003.content: Aren't Modifiers required to undergo combat training at Aether Gazer?

319411004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319411004.content: You know, I'm not sure... I'll have to ask the Admin... No, wait, the Admin doesn't exist in this time, so I'll have to ask Miss Shu.

319411005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319411005.content: I think they must have some combat training. But Ningishzida is part of the medical team and doesn't really go on field missions. So maybe she's not required to undergo as much training.

319411006.speaker: 托特
319411006.content: If she's new to combat, I guess that would explain things.

319411007.content: The battlefield is cleared and the alarm, silenced. Thoth and Ver walk over to the petrified Ningishzida, who's cowering in the corner with her head in her hands, and they help her to her feet.

319411008.speaker: 托特
319411008.content: Come on, time to get up. Or do you plan on sleeping here tonight?

319411010.speaker: 托特
319411010.content: It's time for us to go back.

319411012.content: Thoth does a double take at this apparently nonsensical utterance from Ningishzida. Then she remembers the earlier joke about "surviving" and finally understands why Ningishzida hid in this spot.

319411013.speaker: 宁希达
319411013.content: Is now the time you wipe my memory? I've heard that you can do that with just a click of your flash gun... so I shouldn't feel anything.

319411014.speaker: 宁希达
319411014.content: But how does it feel to be missing a piece of your memory? Will it be very unsettling? Like, will I feel like I'm about to remember something but just can't in the end, and then wind up having hallucinations and going insane...?

319411015.speaker: 托特
319411015.content: You're the doctor. Do you think there's anything wrong with your brain's functioning?

319411016.speaker: 宁希达
319411016.content: No... Are you calling me stupid? Like how people like to say "use your brain"???

319411017.speaker: 托特
319411017.content: What in the world are you talking about? What I'm trying to say is, as long as there's nothing wrong with your brain, there is no risk in using the memory wipe device.

319411018.speaker: 宁希达
319411018.content: So you still want to wipe my memory.

319411019.speaker: 托特
319411019.content: Unless you agree to work with us.

319411020.speaker: 宁希达
319411020.content: By "work with you," do you mean I'll have to come to the Plane Layer for jobs like this?

319411021.speaker: 托特
319411021.content: Not exactly. First, you should know that Norn and I come from the future. Ten years from now, to be exact. And the world you're in... is going to collapse in less than half a year.

319411024.content: Ver stares at Thoth in shock when the latter reveals something Ver has been trying to conceal. But there's a small difference in Thoth's telling—she's left out the part about the World Line branch-off.

319411025.speaker: 托特
319411025.content: If that's too much for you, there's no need for concern. I can wipe that memory along with the other ones.

319411026.speaker: 宁希达
319411026.content: Hold on, hold on... By "collapse," you mean...

319411027.speaker: 托特
319411027.content: It's what it sounds like. Destruction? Disappearance? Disintegration? ...Something like that.

319411028.speaker: 托特
319411028.content: See that meter on your watch? Once it fills up, the world will collapse. So... now you know what we're trying to prevent.

319411029.speaker: 托特
319411029.content: I don't want news of this to spread and cause panic. However, I have to admit that we do need all the help we can get. Now that you're here, I can offer the opportunity to you.

319411030.speaker: 托特
319411030.content: But I don't wish to force you into something you don't want to do, and I assure you that you won't lose anything if you choose to have your memory wiped. In fact, that would allow you to be carefree to the end like everyone else.

319411032.speaker: 宁希达
319411032.content: I don't understand what's going on... with the destruction of the world...

319411033.speaker: 托特
319411033.content: Those of us who are still alive ten years later regret not having noticed the disaster sooner. By the time we realized what was happening, it had already occurred.

319411034.speaker: 托特
319411034.content: Yes—the world will collapse in six months, and we will spend the ten years after that struggling to survive in its ruins, surrounded by Visbanes left, right, and center. We risked the future of all humankind to return to this point and try to save it all.

319411035.speaker: 托特
319411035.content: I'm not trying to scare you. But what did you think that space rift in Nordburg is? And what did you think those things that attacked the Plane Layer just now are?

319411036.speaker: 托特
319411036.content: No matter what you think, facts are facts. But whether or not knowing them will change you—the choice is up to you.

319411037.content: Ver stares at Thoth blankly. Did she have this speech prepared beforehand, or was that a brilliant piece of improvisation? But even if there was a crueler piece of reality she hasn't yet divulged, the knowledge that the world is slated for destruction is already hard to accept.

319411038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319411038.content: It's alright if you don't want to join us, Ningishzida.

319411040.content: Surprisingly (to Ver), Ningishzida slowly shakes her head while fidgeting with her hair. Although she doesn't exactly look excited, she seems to have conquered her fear just enough.

319411041.speaker: 宁希达
319411041.content: It's not like I haven't experienced my own fair share of strange occurrences. I'm a Modifier as well, after all.

319411042.speaker: 宁希达
319411042.content: So, Captain Thoth... what more can we do to stop the destruction of the world?

319411043.speaker: 托特
319411043.content: We need to find the answer.

319411044.content: Thoth pauses for a moment, then continues when she sees Ver's bewildered expression.

319411045.speaker: 托特
319411045.content: CORG has long known that time is running out for Gaea.

319411046.speaker: 托特
319411046.content: The Prime Modifiers feel the same way. No... "feel" isn't the right word to use here... After all, they've seen for themselves the many changes that have occurred in Gaea over the years. I think they're actually in the best position to judge.

319411047.speaker: 托特
319411047.content:
It's very simple: The Visbanes are getting stronger while the Modifiers are getting weaker.
When we no longer have the wherewithal to do anything besides deal with the Visbanes, it will only be a matter of time before Gaea is destroyed.

319411048.speaker: 宁希达
319411048.content: I've never heard Odin mention this before...

319411049.speaker: 托特
319411049.content: That's because to know is to bear the burden. This is her way of protecting you all.

319411050.speaker: 托特
319411050.content: But now, if you're going to be part of the plan, you must be prepared to bear that burden too...

319411051.speaker: 托特
319411051.content:
What CORG is trying to do is find information about where Visbanes originated from.
Once we find this source, we can eliminate it, and Gaea will never have to face the threat of collapse again.

319411052.content: Thoth's words have left both Ver and Ningishzida stunned. They couldn't have been more surprised if someone had announced there would be two suns in the sky the following day.

319411053.content: Although Ver and Ningishzida have always looked forward to the prospect of a peaceful Gaea unplagued by Visbanes, they've just realized that they never truly entertained the possibility of annihilating Visbanes for good.

319411054.speaker: 宁希达
319411054.content: Eliminate the source... Do you really think it's possible?

319411055.speaker: 托特
319411055.content: Traveling through time had already exhausted what remaining energy we had at the time. We weren't going to waste our limited resources on something we weren't sure about.

319411056.speaker: 托特
319411056.content: What we can be sure of for now is that there's something connected to the origin of Visbanes in Molander City during this time period.

319411057.speaker: 托特
319411057.content: The other agents will look for this thing. Meanwhile, our job is to ensure the stability of the Plane Layer to buy everyone and Gaea a little more time.

319411058.content: The meter counting down the time until the hyperspace's collapse moves forward a little. Thoth frowns almost imperceptibly, then looks at Ver and Ningishzida gravely.

319421001.speaker: 托特
319421001.content: Let's go over everything one more time.

319421002.speaker: 宁希达
319421002.content:
I mustn't breathe a single word of this to anyone else.
I have to make sure that no one is spying or eavesdropping on me during calls.
And I won't come to you unless and until you tell me to.

319421004.speaker: 托特
319421004.content: What I actually said was maintain absolute secrecy, keep our communications secret, and stand by for further orders.... But you aren't wrong either.

319421005.speaker: 宁希达
319421005.content: Then it's all good. I can't remember it the way you put it. I have my own "Ningishzida language" that I auto-translate everything to, beep beep...

319421006.content: Ningishzida is moving her head like a child imitating a robot, and Thoth looks at her tenderly. For a moment, Thoth seems to drop her act of being strong and put her worries aside for a while.

319421007.content: Recognizing that she's acting a bit oddly, Ningishzida purses her lips and slowly lowers her hands.

319421008.speaker: 宁希达
319421008.content: So, I'm really not allowed to tell anyone? But if we can get a Prime Modifier to help...

319421009.speaker: 托特
319421009.content: The more we interfere with this time, the stronger the counteraction from Idealbild will be. Norn and I can't even leave Molander City. That's the price we're paying.

319421010.speaker: 托特
319421010.content: And sheer power may not be the answer to this problem. If it were, this situation in Gaea would not have reached this point.

319421011.speaker: 宁希达
319421011.content: Alright, then... Then can you at least tell me what happens to me in the future?

319421012.content: Thoth is momentarily startled by Ningishzida's query. Then she looks at the expectant girl, lets out a little laugh, and pats her on her shoulder.

319421013.speaker: 托特
319421013.content: You'll be alright. That's why we've chosen to talk to you.

319421014.speaker: 托特
319421014.content: Ten years from now, you'll have performed a number of rescues and saved many, many lives, both on the frontline and off it.

319421016.speaker: 托特
319421016.content: Yes. By that time, you'll be an outstanding doctor.

319421017.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319421017.content: I... can attest to it too!

319421018.content: The reassurance seems to put a spring back into Ningishzida's step. Thoth sees her off, then closes the door of the bookstore. When she turns around, she finds Ver sitting in a corner like a student who knows she's done something wrong.

319421019.speaker: 托特
319421019.content: ... What do you want to say?

319421020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319421020.content: I don't think you should have told Ningishzida all that. Though I know I was the one who brought her there...

319421021.speaker: 托特
319421021.content: You have it the wrong way around. I didn't ask for her help because I encountered in her the Data Plane Layer—she just happened to be in the Plane Layer when I asked for her help.

319421023.speaker: 托特
319421023.content: The difference is that I'd planned to ask her for assistance from the beginning, so I had an extra watch prepared. It just didn't happen the way I planned.

319421024.speaker: 托特
319421024.content: The effects of her entering the Data Plane Layer are irreversible. It made more sense to use the opportunity and limit the damage immediately, instead of erasing her memories.

319421025.speaker: 托特
319421025.content: I checked the Operation Record for what she was doing during this time and saw nothing of interest. All I know is that she disappeared one day...

319421026.speaker: 托特
319421026.content: As long as she doesn't do anything odd and works alongside us, it shouldn't affect the World Line too much.

319421027.content: Thoth looks down at her watch—the numbers are about to break into double digits. She sighs, leans against the counter, and opens a can of soda.

319421028.speaker: 托特
319421028.content: If she'd been wearing a watch when she entered the Plane Layer, Gaea wouldn't have become aware of her so soon...

319421029.speaker: 托特
319421029.content: I believe I told you to stay in the shop. Did you find who you were looking for in the medical center?

319421030.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319421030.content: How did you— Is there a tracker in this watch?

319421031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319421031.content: I guess I should have thought of that earlier... No, I didn't. Doctor Gloria wouldn't let me inside.

319421032.content: Ver tells Thoth about meeting Ningishzida and entering the medical center with her.

319421035.speaker: 托特
319421035.content: How could a place as big as Saint Sophia have so few people? Do you remember who else you saw there as a child?

319421036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319421036.content: There were people... but I can't remember them. I was terrified of strangers at the time—I don't have any memories of anyone I only met occasionally.

319421037.content: Thoth nods, fiddling with the soda can in her hand. After some time passes, she seems to have a realization. She leans over to throw out the can, then goes to her room to change into suit.

319421039.speaker: 托特
319421039.content: ...Other agents are under my command at the moment. I need to go check on how they're doing.

319421040.speaker: 托特
319421040.content: You can hang on to the key I gave you.

319421041.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319421041.content: Does that mean I can go out, too?

319421042.speaker: 托特
319421042.content: As long as you don't bring anyone else into the Plane Layer.And as soon as I contact you, no matter what you're doing, please come straight back here.

319431002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431002.content: I know—I'm not going in... Fine, fine, I'll stand somewhere else.

319431003.content: As she passes the entrance to Saint Sophia, Ver can't stop herself from approaching the gate and peering in—but she's admonished by the AGI Mecha as soon as she does. Pouting, she walks a short distance away.

319431004.content: After leaving the front door behind her, she follows a fence until she reaches a grove in a small park.

319431005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431005.content: I remember this place. The Admin brought me here...

319431006.content: Ver makes her way into the depths of the grove, crossing over dirt and fallen leaves. She pushes aside some branches, revealing a low wall with a railing atop it.

319431007.content: Beyond the railing lies the medical center's back garden. There is debris piled up in a corner, like a tiny fortress—but the person who usually hides within it isn't there now.

319431008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431008.content: I usually only came here at night...

319431009.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431009.content: Is this how the Admin felt, seeing me from the outside?

319431010.content: Ver leans over the railing and watches the back garden for a while, but she doesn't see anyone. Pulling pen and paper from her pocket, she writes a small note and places it on the wall near the debris pile.

319431011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431011.content: I should use weigh it down with a rock... There. Hopefully, she finds it.

319431014.content: Ver jumps, like she's suddenly been roused from a daydream by being called on in class, and hurriedly stuffs the note into her pocket. But there's something familiar about the voice coming from behind her.

319431015.speaker: ？？？
319431015.content: This is private property. I can report any suspicious activity I see here.

319431016.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431016.content: I'm not doing anything suspicious! I'm just...

319431017.content: Ver struggles to compose herself as she turns around, but the moment she sees who is behind her, she finds herself at a loss for words.

319431018.speaker: ？？？
319431018.content: Why are you making that face?

319431019.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431019.content: ...Oh, sorry. I got lost in thought for a moment. It's just ... you look a lot like someone I know.

319431020.speaker: ？？？
319431020.content: The last century called—it wants its icebreaker back.

319431021.speaker: ？？？
319431021.content: So, who's this person who looks a lot like me?

319431023.content: Having learned her lesson with Ningishzida, Ver realizes that if she continues down this line of conversation, the cat could get let out of the bag real quick.

319431024.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431024.content: If I may ask... what's your name?

319431026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431026.content: Well, that is the right name...

319431028.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431028.content:
Oh, nothing. I'm just talking to myself.
So what are you doing in the park?

319431029.speaker: ？？？
319431029.content: I came to... Wait, I nearly fell for that. You still haven't answered my question. What were you doing just now?

319431030.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431030.content: I know someone in this medical center. I'd like to go in and see her, but the doctor won't let me.

319431031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431031.content: The person I know... often comes to the back garden by herself. I thought I'd try and see if I could find her here.

319431034.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431034.content: It's your turn to answer one of my questions. What are you doing here? Do you go to school nearby?

319431035.speaker: ？？？
319431035.content:
School... I haven't thought about school in a while.
That's not why I'm here. I wasn't kidding when I said I could report you, you know.

319431036.speaker: ？？？
319431036.content: Because this is my medical center.

319431037.content: Ver's eyebrows fly up and she slowly tilts her head to one side, unsure if she heard correctly.

319431038.speaker: ？？？
319431038.content:
According to Gloria, Norn, you're a CORG agent.
Just so we're clear, I prefer to have zero contact with CORG.

319431039.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431039.content: Do you have something against them?

319431040.speaker: ？？？
319431040.content: Would you rather I said something positive or negative in your earshot?

319431041.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431041.content: I'm not actually... Oh, never mind. You don't have to talk about it if you don't want.

319431042.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431042.content: So you're the president Doctor Gloria mentioned, then? She said I could go in if the president gave me permission.

319431043.speaker: ？？？
319431043.content: I am not. The president has gone out.

319431045.speaker: ？？？
319431045.content: Even if you do see her, you won't get her permission... unless you tell me how you know the name of one of our patients.

319431046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431046.content: So... we're trading questions, are we? You answer first this time.

319431048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431048.content: Do you have any friends or family in Ain Soph? Or places you usually go to besides the medical center, or people who know you?

319431049.content: Ver phrases her questions very carefully to avoid sounding too direct. She forgets, however, that her current alter ego makes questions like these sound like they're implying something else entirely.

319431052.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319431052.content: (What do I do, Admin? Why doesn't kid-you act like a kid at all?!)

319431053.content: Right as Ver is thinking she'll be dismissed after this awkward silence, the young person beckons to her, then deftly steps over the railing.

319431054.speaker: ？？？
319431054.content: It's a long story. Come in and we'll talk.

319441003.content: This Admin from ten years past greets Gloria—or rather, announces a verdict that clearly isn't up for discussion—then leads Ver straight through the lobby.

319441004.content: Ver doesn't see anyone else until they reach the patient care area, though even there, there are hardly any people to speak of. They look like care workers based on their attire, and they regard Ver and the young person with indifference.

319441005.content: There's something eerie about this silence with other people about, even eerier than the silence with just the AGI Mecha from earlier. Hesitant to attempt any chitchat with them, Ver follows closely behind her guide.

319441006.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319441006.content: Why did Doctor Gloria call you "Prez" just now?

319441007.speaker: 小院长
319441007.content: My older sister is the president.

319441010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319441010.content: Uh, no, it's perfectly normal... So, your older sister... What's her name?

319441011.speaker: 小院长
319441011.content: Here we are. This room's empty—we can talk in here.

319441012.content: Ver wasn't expecting their destination to be an office. Antique analog clocks and hardcover books line the built-in shelves. These furnishings don't look like those of a young person.

319441013.content: Other parts of the office give off a different impression, though. There's a coffee machine to the left of the desk, reminding Ver of Shu's office. Meanwhile, in a corner to the right, a snack box stands a meter high, reminding Ver of her own room...

319441016.content: The "Prez" closes the door, but remains standing in front of the entrance without inviting Ver to sit.

319441017.speaker: 小院长
319441017.content: Her name is Norvi. Have you heard of her?

319441018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319441018.content: No. Wait, the name does sound a little familiar... Hmm. Actually, maybe not.

319441019.speaker: 小院长
319441019.content: This is her office. According to Gloria, she hasn't been back for some time.

319441020.speaker: 小院长
319441020.content: I've been looking into her whereabouts recently but have come up with nothing, unfortunately. She hasn't been found in any of the Sephirah Zones.

319441021.speaker: 小院长
319441021.content: ...All I know is that her last recorded trip was to CORG. And now here are you, telling me you don't know her?

319441022.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319441022.content: I don't know her, honest. She's missing?

319441023.speaker: 小院长
319441023.content: Take a look at the photo on the desk.

319441024.content: Glancing over her shoulder at the framed photo on the desk, Ver goes to take a look at it. Not believing her eyes at first, she picks it up and examines it more closely, surprise on her face.

319441025.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319441025.content: I still don't recognize her, but... don't you think she looks a bit like me?

319441026.speaker: 小院长
319441026.content: That's one of the reasons I brought you here.

319441027.content: The Prez walks over, takes the photo from Ver's hands, and places it back on the desk. Then they step back from Ver, their expression growing increasingly frosty.

319441029.speaker: 小院长
319441029.content: If you have nothing to say, I see no reason to keep playing this game with you.

319441030.content: The Prez reaches into a pocket, and the corners of the room suddenly light up. Fine streams of data weave into a curtain of light against the wall, then envelop the entire room in the blink of an eye.

319441031.content: Ver senses that her connection to something has been severed. Her Divine Power rapidly recedes from her body, but it doesn't feel like it does when she expends it in combat—there's no sign of it returning.

319441033.speaker: 小院长
319441033.content: I know you're a Modifier, but you can't just barge in here.

319441034.speaker: 小院长
319441034.content: Speak. How do you know Norvi? Where is she? Who sent you to investigate me?

319441036.speaker: 小院长
319441036.content: Who is this "Admin"? Don't even think about calling for help—I've blocked data from entering or leaving this room. Not just Divine Grace, but comms as well.

319441037.speaker: 小院长
319441037.content: OPRIC, I don't think that Red Fox guy could be behind something like this. Was it the Observators? What exactly were your orders?

319441038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319441038.content: ...Ow... I swear, I'm not who you think I...

319441039.content: Her Divine Power nearly depleted, a wave of dizziness overwhelms Ver. She's no longer able to parse the words being said to her. Everything is becoming a blur.

319441040.content: A familiar heat fills her chest. It feels exactly like something she experienced during her fight with Gremory. She looks down. In her stupor, she just barely manages to make out the sight of a red line spreading over her skin.

319441041.speaker: 小院长
319441041.content: Bane Energy?! Are you kidding me?

319441042.speaker: 小院长
319441042.content: This reaction... How is it even possible...?

319441044.speaker: 小院长
319441044.content: What the... Hey! Hey! Stay with me—

319441045.content: Ver can just make out the words with what's left of her consciousness, but can't understand what they mean. She feels nothing but her senses fading away, little by little, until she can't even tell if she's standing or lying down.

319451002.content: Ver rises from the hospital bed with a start. The redness slowly fades from her eyes and her vision becomes clear again.

319451003.content: The room looks like a tornado has rolled through it. A few security AGI Mecha took the brunt of the damage. Outside of their fractured outer casings, which are just barely recognizable, their parts have been almost completely destroyed.

319451006.content: Ver blearily turns her head to look out the window. It's already gone from afternoon to morning. According to the clock on the wall, Ver was out for almost 16 hours. "Sleepyhead" doesn't even begin to cover it.

319451007.content: The Prez and Gloria stand a short distance away from the bed. Neither they nor the walls took any damage. Gloria looks as aloof as ever. The Prez's expression is dark, but without any sign of fear or panic.

319451009.speaker: 小院长
319451009.content: I told you she wouldn't remember. She kept screaming about some "Admin" and "Miss Shu." She was obviously having a nightmare.

319451011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451011.content: I was... sleepwalking and sleep talking?!

319451012.speaker: 小院长
319451012.content: You think so? It doesn't seem like she's faking it.

319451014.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451014.content: I dreamed about some people I know—only, they were acting really strangely...

319451015.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451015.content: I also dreamed that I was fighting AGI Mecha. Not these AGI Mecha, of course... Was I the one who busted them up?

319451016.speaker: 格罗娅
319451016.content: You seemed to be under the mistaken impression that they meant you harm. But not to worry, Miss Norn. We won't require compensation for the damages.

319451017.speaker: 小院长
319451017.content: It's just me being real suspicious. Never mind the AGI Mechas, I'm just glad you're fine.

319451018.speaker: 小院长
319451018.content: I'll admit to being a bit prickly yesterday, and I apologize for any offense I might have caused you.

319451020.speaker: 格罗娅
319451020.content: Are you feeling unwell at all?

319451021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451021.content: No, not even slightly. Did you treat me? What happened to me?

319451022.content: Ver looks down at her chest as she speaks. The lines are gone, as though the things she saw before she lost consciousness were part of an illusion.

319451023.speaker: 小院长
319451023.content: We were hoping to ask you that, too... Looks like none of us will be getting any answers. Let's get some rest.

319451024.speaker: 小院长
319451024.content: Gloria, for caution's sake, let's perform a full-body examination on her.

319451026.content: Ver stares blankly at the Prez, certain that she misheard. It's like a completely different person from the one in the president's office is speaking to her.

319451027.content: Not only that, but Ver can't remember anything that could have gotten her into the Prez's good graces. On the contrary, she made a mess of the hospital room... But then again, how did the Prez, Gloria, and the walls end up unharmed?

319451029.speaker: 小院长
319451029.content: Why are you calling me that now, too...

319451030.speaker: 小院长
319451030.content: Whatever, it's fine. What is it?

319451031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451031.content: When we were in the president's office before, did you say... uh...

319451034.speaker: 小院长
319451034.content: You're not the only ones who know about these things. CORG can't control everything that happens in Gaea.

319451035.speaker: 格罗娅
319451035.content:
Lift up your hand and place it in here.
Turn it just a little bit... Good.

319451036.content: Gloria brings a set of medical instruments from the adjacent patient room and has Ver adjust her posture several times. Though she called it an examination, it's actually more like a fully automated scan that causes no discomfort whatsoever.

319451038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451038.content: You're not the first person to ask me that... I guess so.

319451039.speaker: 小院长
319451039.content: I see. To be honest, I've never met any of you before. I suppose I made an assumption.

319451040.speaker: 小院长
319451040.content: We were "trading questions." I told you about Norvi. Now it's your turn.

319451042.speaker: 小院长
319451042.content: Didn't you want to see Verthandi and Tarina? They're my patients. At the very least, I have to ensure that anyone who wants to visit them can be trusted.

319451043.speaker: 小院长
319451043.content: So tell me... how do you know them?

319451046.content: The examination instrument whirs smoothly as an indicator light signals Ver to breath slowly. She falls silent for a while, but she doesn't feel nervous.

319451047.content: Having agreed to this exchange of questions with the Prez, Ver begins to consider how she should answer. To her surprise, her response is well-put-together and convincing.

319451048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451048.content: ...You could say that Ver and I are sisters. We used to live in the same orphanage when she was very young.

319451049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451049.content: I think there was some kind of accident at the orphanage, and I... was taken away by CORG. I only recently learned that Ver was staying here.

319451050.speaker: 小院长
319451050.content: What sort of orphanage was it?

319451051.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451051.content: I'm not sure. Maybe "orphanage" isn't even the right word... All I can remember is that it was very dark, and we had to take lots of medicine every day...

319451052.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451052.content: Sorry, I don't think about that time in my life very much.

319451053.content: The Prez frowns and looks over at Gloria, who gives a slight nod.

319451056.speaker: ？？？
319451056.content: Have you gone outside before, Tarina?

319451058.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451058.content: The things I've told you about, like shops, amusement parks, fields, the ocean... I didn't make any of them up.

319451059.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451059.content: They're all out there, in the boundless world outside, and each place looks utterly unique.

319451060.speaker: ？？？
319451060.content: Have you... been to all of those places?

319451061.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451061.content: You got straight to the sad part... I haven't to most of these places, to be honest.

319451062.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451062.content: I was hospitalized when I was very young. I used to be in a hospital in Init—I told you last time that Init is in west Molander.

319451063.speaker: ？？？
319451063.content: I remember. You can get there in 15 minutes by maglev train.

319451064.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451064.content: Hehe, I can see you're excited about that.

319451065.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451065.content: The doctors rarely let me go outside back then, so I saw all of those things on the TV and in books.

319451066.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451066.content: My condition has never gotten better. One renowned Ain Soph doctor after another came to see me, and all of them said there was nothing they could do. Once word got out, even news agencies came to report on my illness.

319451067.speaker: 塔琳娜
319451067.content: I had a lot of visitors after that. Some would bring me little gifts from other places and tell me stories. The stories I've told you were actually the ones I heard back then.

319451068.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451068.content: ...That's pretty much it. I went to the hospital to see her many times. She's always meant a great deal to me.

319451069.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451069.content: Later, I heard that she was transferred, but I didn't know where to. While I was searching for Ver, I happened to learn that Tarina was here as well.

319451072.content: Like an expert machine operator, Gloria immediately removes the auxiliary monitoring devices from Ver's body once the examination wraps up. She then rapidly skims through the report.

319451073.speaker: 格罗娅
319451073.content: ...All indicators are normal. You're perfectly healthy.

319451074.speaker: 小院长
319451074.content: You're certain there are no issues?

319451075.speaker: 格罗娅
319451075.content: I'll ask you to trust in my medical expertise, Prez.

319451076.speaker: 格罗娅
319451076.content: You said that there was Bane Energy present in Miss Norn's body. However, it's a well-known fact that Bane Energy and Divine Grace will clash within a Modifier's body, until only one force remains.

319451077.speaker: 格罗娅
319451077.content:
I didn't discover any such activity in Miss Norn's body.
Perhaps what you saw was only momentary corrosion.

319451078.speaker: 小院长
319451078.content: Have you fought any Visbanes recently?

319451081.content: Ver shakes her head. But then suddenly remembering Gremory—who seems like a distant memory—she quickly nods instead.

319451082.speaker: 小院长
319451082.content: You... You're experiencing Bane Energy corrosion, yet you're still running about freely? Didn't CORG have anything to say about this?

319451083.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451083.content: You could say I'm in recovery. A colleague also said I'm experiencing Bane Energy corrosion, but I really don't feel a thing.

319451084.speaker: 小院长
319451084.content: A colleague? You mean the one you were with earlier?

319451085.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451085.content: No, no, Ningishzida is an Aether Gazer...

319451086.content: Ver doesn't continue, having suddenly found herself in hot water again. The two people before her know even more about Divine Grace and Bane Energy than she does, so they must be important people. It would stand to reason that they also know the name "Thoth."

319451087.content: The issue right now, however, is that there are two Thoths. If Ver were to give the captain's name now, there's no telling what effect it could have on the hyperspace experiment.

319451088.speaker: 格罗娅
319451088.content: Prez, someone has entered the building.

319451089.speaker: 小院长
319451089.content: Where are all these visitors coming from...? Who is it this time?

319451090.speaker: 格罗娅
319451090.content: It's another OPRIC. She says she's looking for Norn. Her name is Thoth.

319451091.content: A terrible realization hits Ver. She hurriedly opens her terminal, breaking into a cold sweat when she sees line after line of missed comms requests from Thoth.

319451092.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451092.content: Um...! There's something I need to do. I'd better be on my way.

319451095.speaker: 小院长
319451095.content: Consider it an apology... I didn't realize you were injured. I'm sorry.

319451096.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451096.content: You don't have to apologize again. It's not your fault anyway, I was the one who didn't explain myself properly... Your permission to see them is all I could ever ask for!

319451097.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319451097.content: But I think it'll have to wait until next time. Thoth told me to look out for messages from her... She's probably gonna kill me.

319451098.content: Scrambling out of the bed, Ver politely waves goodbye to the Prez and Gloria, then turns and sprints out of the room.

319451100.content: Suddenly noticing a slip of paper beside the bed, which must have fallen from Ver's pocket, the Prez shouts into the corridor. But Ver is already long gone.

319451101.speaker: 格罗娅
319451101.content: Letting her leave is a risk.

319451102.speaker: 小院长
319451102.content: We can't make her stay. Let's just forget it.

319451103.speaker: 格罗娅
319451103.content: Her symptoms are very similar to Tarina's. I think we should have asked her about the cause of her illness and treatment history before letting her go.

319451104.speaker: 小院长
319451104.content: We'll have plenty more opportunities to ask. She'll be back.

319451105.speaker: 小院长
319451105.content: You may not understand, but even though she told a heap of lies, I still believe she can be trusted.

319451107.speaker: 小院长
319451107.content: Not at all. Her truths and lies were written all over her face. So, at the very least, we can believe the true things she said, don't you think?

319451108.speaker: 小院长
319451108.content: If that's not proof enough for you...

319451109.content: The Prez bends down to pick the note off the ground, glances at what it says, and then bursts out laughing, head shaking.

319461001.speaker: 工程师
319461001.content: Don't rush to seal up the top floor! For the love of... Double-check the function and bearing structures of the other units. I don't want this old thing collapsing again!

319461002.speaker: 工程师
319461002.content: Bring the shear wall another 35 millimeters to the left... Millimeters, not centimeters! Good, right there, whiz kid.

319461004.speaker: 工程师
319461004.content: How would I know? This house is older than you are. Maybe it was the years of neglect, or maybe whoever was living here was messing around with it.

319461005.speaker: 路人B
319461005.content: What about shoddy workmanship and cutting corners? I hear a lot of design firms are a mess.

319461006.speaker: 工程师
319461006.content: ...Is that so? Why do you think I'm here, supervising the repairs?

319461007.speaker: 路人B
319461007.content: ...You weren't the one who designed this, were you?

319461008.speaker: 工程师
319461008.content: Hmph, sure was. Kids these days just say whatever pops into their heads. Professional ethics are something I've upheld my whole life.

319461010.speaker: 工程师
319461010.content: It's some seriously bad luck that causes a freak accident like this...

319461011.content: The clamor of the construction site fades into the distance, until even the house missing its top floor is blocked from view by its two neighboring buildings.

319461012.content: Ver turns around to see Thoth walking up ahead like nothing's happened. Ver quickens her pace to catch up.

319461013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461013.content: Wasn't that building the one from the Plane Layer yesterday...?

319461014.speaker: 托特
319461014.content: Yes. The Realm Cleanser's laser beam took the roof off after Ningishzida deflected it with her shield.

319461015.speaker: 托特
319461015.content:
Ignore it—we're just passing through. That isn't why I brought you here.
That drink shop up ahead—go in and sit down.

319461016.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461016.content: Um... aren't you angry that I didn't take your calls?

319461017.speaker: 托特
319461017.content:
Yes. You can think over how you're going to explain yourself.
Go and order what you'd like to drink.

319461018.content: Several outdoor tables and chairs are set up in front of a popular drink shop chain. There are hardly any customers—perhaps due to how early it is in the day, or maybe it's the proximity to CORG's huge curtain of light separating the northern and southern cities.

319461019.content: Thoth picks a spot by the street and pulls Ver over to a table. A server comes out to greet them—a rare occurrence in Ain Soph.

319461020.speaker: 店员
319461020.content: Welcome! What can I get you two to drink?

319461023.speaker: 店员
319461023.content: Jasmine tea and apple juice, got it. And how much sugar would you like in those?

319461026.speaker: 店员
319461026.content: Okay! All of our drinks are freshly squeezed and made to order, so it'll just be a few minutes.

319461027.content: "It'll just be a few minutes" usually means "It'll take a while." Luckily for Thoth and Ver, they have no shortage of conversation to pass the time.

319461028.speaker: 托特
319461028.content: You said that you lost consciousness in Saint Sophia. What happened?

319461029.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461029.content:
Funny you should mention that.
Thoth, did you know that the Admin has amnesia?

319461031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461031.content: No one's known anything about the Admin's life before now. I had no idea I'd find clues here.

319461032.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461032.content: At this point in time, the Admin is about 14 or 15 years old and the head of Saint Sophia. No wonder they could sneak me out.

319461033.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461033.content: Also, the Admin and Doctor Gloria both know about Modifiers and Visbanes... Maybe they're part of a secret organization? Like Ruomu Palace in Xu Heng.

319461034.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461034.content: I also learned that the Admin has an older sister named Norvi... Thoth? Somehow, you don't seem the least bit surprised.

319461035.speaker: 托特
319461035.content: ...I was waiting to hear what this has to do with you losing consciousness.

319461036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461036.content: Oh, right... Well, the Admin thought I was investigating Saint Sophia and locked me in an office...

319461037.content: Ver summarizes what happened next. Thoth's expression slowly morphs from mildly surprised to solemn. She nods when Ver finishes speaking.

319461038.speaker: 托特
319461038.content: So Doctor Gloria wasn't able to determine the cause of your illness, either.

319461039.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461039.content: I guess not. I'll ask her when I get a chance to go back.

319461040.speaker: 托特
319461040.content: Do you believe the CORG of 2315, or a dubious medical center in 2305?

319461041.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461041.content: I... To be honest, I'd rather believe Doctor Gloria and the Admin.

319461042.speaker: 托特
319461042.content: ...After being bombarded by a series of personal questions, the Admin is likely already suspicious of you.

319461043.speaker: 托特
319461043.content: If it were me, I'd also feel like you were investigating me.

319461044.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461044.content: But if I ask the right questions, couldn't it help the Admin remember something? That's definitely more important than how suspicious they might find me.

319461046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461046.content: I do. I get the feeling that Miss Shu and Odin care a lot about the Admin, too. I'm sure they weren't let into Division Nine just because of the mark.

319461047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461047.content: It's like you said—there's a lot they're not telling me the truth about because they want to protect me. That, I can understand...

319461048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461048.content: But if those secrets force the Admin to go somewhere far away and into great danger one day, I don't want to be so out of the loop, I can't do anything to help.

319461049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461049.content: That's why I want to learn more about everything that has to do with the Admin.

319461050.speaker: 托特
319461050.content: You're rather clever when it comes to matters concerning the Admin... These drinks are taking a while, aren't they?

319461051.content: Saying nothing more on the matter, Thoth turns to look at the nearly empty drink shop just in time to see the flustered server rushing over to them with drinks in hand.

319461052.speaker: 店员
319461052.content: So sorry to have kept you waiting! There was a little problem with the machine.

319461054.speaker: 店员
319461054.content: You're welcome! Enjoy. If you'd like anything added to the drinks, it's on the house.

319461055.content: After the server leaves, Thoth and Ver happen to glance at the conspicuous, oppressive curtain of light at the same time. CORG's blockade is far from this street, but its effect is impossible to miss.

319461056.content: In synchronized movements, they pick up their drinks, plunge their straws through the lids, and take a sip before exchanging quizzical looks.

319461057.speaker: 托特
319461057.content: The green one is green apple juice... Does that make the red one jasmine tea, then?

319461058.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461058.content: Did I grab the wrong one?

319461059.content: Ver scratches her head and looks with frustration at the jasmine tea she's holding.

319461060.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461060.content: Um... You can have the apple juice, then.

319461061.speaker: 托特
319461061.content: Only a child could drink something this sweet.

319461063.content: Thoth takes the straw from the apple juice, sticks it into Ver's mouth, and retrieves her jasmine tea.

319461064.content: She takes a sip, letting the slightly astringent tea swirl in her mouth. Smiling, Thoth watches Verthandi sip on her apple juice while the fragrance of jasmine fills her nostrils.

319461066.content: Watching the hustle and bustle of morning from the side of the road while sipping drinks reminds Ver of her fondest memories of her hometown. For the first time since waking up here, Ver feels relaxed.

319461067.content: Anxiety, confusion, tension, fear... So much has happened in just one short day—gradual understanding, acceptance, and compromise...

319461068.content: But it seems like she can briefly forget about all that for now. Apart from her unpredictable powers, everything seems to be on track. Even the Prez has loosened up a little bit. Maybe she really will get the chance to see those girls from ten years ago.

319461069.speaker: 托特
319461069.content: Init, a strange, incurable illness... I seem to recall hearing about those.

319461070.speaker: 托特
319461070.content: CORG was planning to send people to investigate. But when we heard that the child had been transferred, that was the end of it.

319461071.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461071.content: You could come with me. We could get Ningishzida and all go see illness Tarina has.

319461072.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461072.content: I'm not saying we have to cure her. I know that could destabilize the hyperspace... I just want answers.

319461073.speaker: 托特
319461073.content: If you want to cure her, we can try.

319461075.content: Nearly dropping her drink on the ground, Ver's eyes open wide in shock. She leans in to examine Thoth's face.

319461076.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461076.content: Thoth... is there something different about you today?

319461078.speaker: 托特
319461078.content: There's no point in avoiding something you care so much about. We might as well try before it's too late.

319461079.content: Thoth expressionlessly pushes Ver aside, but this only makes Ver smile even wider.

319461080.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461080.content: I knew you wouldn't have saved me if you were really so cold!

319461081.speaker: 托特
319461081.content: I'm not agreeing to this just to satisfy your wishes... There are two matters from Molander in 2305 that CORG could never get to the bottom of.

319461082.speaker: 托特
319461082.content: The first is that space rift in Nordburg—how was it formed? Where does it lead to? Why did it disappear? All of this remains unknown.

319461083.speaker: 托特
319461083.content: CORG has no record of the space you said you saw when you woke up. I'll need you to join my squad in a few days so that we can return to the Source Layer and find it.

319461084.speaker: 托特
319461084.content: There's another abandoned CORG research facility in Nordburg that contains some relevant missing data. I may also need your help to bring some of it out.

319461085.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461085.content:
You scratch my back, I scratch yours, right? Of course, no problem.
What's the second matter?

319461086.speaker: 托特
319461086.content: There was a high energy source of unknown origin near Saint Sophia. Saint Sophia was put up for sale not even a few days later.

319461087.speaker: 托特
319461087.content: But CORG didn't think there was a direct connection between the high energy source and Saint Sophia. That night, someone saw something resembling lightning, which affected the entire neighborhood.

319461088.speaker: 托特
319461088.content: But if there is a secret hiding in that medical center, then it would be logical to assume that there is, in fact, a connection.

319461089.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461089.content: Lightning? I didn't know about that... What are we going to do, then?

319461090.speaker: 托特
319461090.content: Make more visits to Saint Sophia until we can unearth that secret. We'll know whether or not there's a connection later.

319461092.content: Thoth hands Ver two devices that look like fitness trackers. Without any text on their screens, they look very old.

319461093.speaker: 托特
319461093.content: When you see your younger self or Tarina, use these to conduct a full-body scan on them. They're linked to your terminal. You can find the manual there.

319461094.content: As if she's receiving precious trinkets, Ver takes the bracelets with both hands and puts them into her pocket.

319461095.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319461095.content: Okay. I thought you were taking me there now.

319461096.speaker: 托特
319461096.content: We still have other work to do, and it won't be any easier than the other two matters I mentioned.

319461097.content: Thoth puts down her empty cup, then stands up. Staring at a person at the end of the street, she pulls Ver to her feet as the latter sucks up the last bit of apple juice from her cup.

319461098.speaker: 托特
319461098.content: This is the appeal of history. You'll always discover plenty of interesting things when you use the future to answer the questions of the past.

319461099.speaker: 托特
319461099.content: You're familiar with that person, aren't you?

319461101.content: Ver follows Thoth's gaze, then freezes, not even noticing when her straw falls from her mouth.

319461102.speaker: 托特
319461102.content: You two are acquainted, aren't you? Shall we go over and say hello?

319471001.content: The comfort brought by the apple juice and morning breeze instantly dissipates. Ver's pace quickens so much that she even overtakes Thoth.

319471003.speaker: 托特
319471003.content: That's the question we're here to answer today.

319471004.speaker: 托特
319471004.content: Once the Quad and Tian Lu Traders confirmed Gremory's identity, CORG entered her details into the archive.

319471005.speaker: 托特
319471005.content: I cross-checked the entire video log and discovered that she would be in Molander at this time.

319471007.speaker: 托特
319471007.content: Indeed—almost too much of a coincidence.

319471008.speaker: 托特
319471008.content:
Ideally, her presence would be connected to those two matters.
If not, then it's just one more problem for us.

319471009.speaker: 托特
319471009.content: Be careful. We'll just follow her. You and I aren't Mengzhang and Jianbing—we may not be able to defeat her in a direct confrontation.

319471010.content: In the distance, the burgundy shadow saunters on—she doesn't seem to have noticed that she's being followed.

319471011.content: Not knowing what her destination is, Ver and Thoth can only follow her from a distance. Expecting to be led to some secluded and clandestine base, they're surprised when she walks into a small restaurant like an ordinary customer.

319471013.speaker: 托特
319471013.content: In the logs for this month, she's only here one time—there's no way she's just come for a meal.

319471014.speaker: 托特
319471014.content: ...She doesn't know us at this point in time. We'll go in and take a look, but don't alert her.

319471015.content: The modest restaurant is pretty busy—nearly all the seats are taken and there's a steady flow of people coming and going. Through the glass panes of the door, it's impossible to see where Gremory went.

319471016.content: Ver and Thoth look at each other, nod, push open the door, and enter.

319471018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319471018.content: Yes... Uh, I mean no, we're not here to eat—

319471019.content: Like Thoth, Ver begins scanning the tables as soon as she walks in, quickly noticing the most conspicuous one.

319471020.content: At a four-top table with two free seats, someone straightens up and waves furiously at them. Coincidentally, they know this person as well—but this is far from good news.

319471021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319471021.content: Ningishzida? What's she doing with Gremory?

319471022.speaker: 托特
319471022.content: ...I think I know what Gremory is up to now.

319471023.speaker: 托特
319471023.content: Go sit by Ningishzida and tell her about Gremory. And tell her don't to make a fuss about it since we're in public.

319471024.content: A sign reading "Please watch the volume" hangs on the wall. The whispers from each table aren't loud enough to drown out the sound of Ver and Thoth's footsteps.

319471025.speaker: 宁希达
319471025.content: Sorry, these are friends of mine. Could they squeeze in?

319471026.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471026.content: Of course—this is a four-person table, after all.

319471029.speaker: 宁希达
319471029.content: Hey, why so quiet, you two? Are you mad at me for going out to eat and not inviting you?

319471030.speaker: 宁希达
319471030.content: Sorry! I did go to the bookstore to get you, but you weren't there... How about this—the meal's on me today. Order whatever you'd like.

319471031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319471031.content: We're not here to eat, Ningishzida. She's—

319471032.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471032.content: Is it okay for us to get down to business, with this many people here?

319471033.content: Sitting directly opposite Gremory, Ver clearly hears the faint threat in her words. She knows just how powerful Gremory is—if they're forced into an altercation, the only survivors in the restaurant would be the three Modifiers.

319471034.content: Ver casts a pleading look to Thoth, who's sitting beside Gremory, but Thoth just flips through the holographic menu, as if she really is here to eat.

319471035.speaker: 宁希达
319471035.content: You're all friends? How fortunate you all happened to be here.

319471036.speaker: 托特
319471036.content: We've met a few times, but we're not exactly "friends."

319471037.speaker: 宁希达
319471037.content: I see... No worries. We'll all be friends after a good meal.

319471038.speaker: 宁希达
319471038.content: I'll start ordering, then! Let's see... Charcoal-grilled salmon, shrimp skewers, cod soup, reindeer stew... What would you like to eat, Norn?

319471039.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319471039.content: Isn't that a lot of seafood...? Wait, no, there's something else I need to talk to you about...

319471040.content: They've reached the end of the menu, but all that's been ordered is a glass of carrot juice. Watching Ver and Ningishzida whispering in their seats across from her, Thoth rubs her aching temple. She then leans over to Gremory.

319471043.speaker: 托特
319471043.content: Ms. Gremory, since we're all here, we might as well share a meal together. Do you have any dietary restrictions?

319471044.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471044.content: I don't like anything that's overly sweet.

319471045.speaker: 托特
319471045.content: ...That's unfortunate, I hear the desserts here are quite nice. If you don't like sweet food, perhaps we're at the wrong place.

319471046.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471046.content: Thank you.But food is simply fuel. As long as they serve a proper meal, any place will do.

319471047.speaker: 托特
319471047.content: Is that so? I think that the purpose of eating out is to enjoy the atmosphere. Without the proper atmosphere, the flavor suffers.

319471048.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471048.content: This restaurant is a little crowded, but the atmosphere with four people should still be fine, don't you think?

319471050.content: The cry of alarm dispels the mounting tension, and the restaurant falls quiet. All the diners fix their eyes on the mortified-looking Ningishzida.

319471051.speaker: 服务员
319471051.content: Hi there... Loud noises aren't allowed in the restaurant.

319471054.speaker: 宁希达
319471054.content: Huh? Oh, uh... It's just... I didn't realize that you don't like sweets.

319471055.speaker: 宁希达
319471055.content: I just ordered you a small cake. Let me go take that off.

319471056.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471056.content:
I appreciate it.
I still don't know your names.

319471057.speaker: 托特
319471057.content:
I'm Thoth. I run a bookstore.
This is my employee, Norn.
Ningishzida here is our doctor friend.

319471058.speaker: 托特
319471058.content: We're all from the local area. I don't think I've seen you around before, Ms. Gremory. Are you from out of town?

319471060.speaker: 托特
319471060.content: CORG has sealed off Nordburg and things are quite tumultuous in the south as well, so many locals fled the area. It's not often that you see visitors who chose to remain.

319471061.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471061.content: Since you run a bookstore, you must know a thing or two about doing business.

319471062.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471062.content: There are two kinds of intangible wealth in business: The first is order, which brings resources. The second is chaos, which brings opportunities.

319471063.speaker: 托特
319471063.content: It sounds like you speak from experience. May I ask what sort of business you're in?

319471066.speaker: 托特
319471066.content: Do you mean that your work is confidential, or that you trade in secrets—or rather, intel?

319471068.speaker: 托特
319471068.content: Only to this extent, unfortunately. I honestly can't imagine... what you're looking for.

319471070.content: Diners continue to come and go, but none notice the gradually thickening tension at this table.

319471071.content: Ver and Ningishzida break out in cold sweats as they listen. Though not daring to interrupt, they fear that, with just one wrong turn of phrase, the powder keg could blow.

319471072.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471072.content: If you're that interested in my business, why don't—

319471073.content: Gremory is interrupted by a noise from the watch. If the sound from one watch wasn't noticeable enough, three is certainly enough to be heard clearly by everyone at the table.

319471074.content: Thoth frowns, but Ver and Ningishzida breathe a sigh of relief, practically thanking their lucky stars.

319471075.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471075.content: What brand is that? I'm guessing they're good if each of you has one?

319471077.content: Smiling, Thoth is the first to rise. The other two instinctively follow her lead.

319471078.speaker: 托特
319471078.content: I'm afraid we'll have to take a rain check—something urgent has come up. If we meet again, I'll bring you to try more delicacies of Molander.

319471079.content: Gremory gives a slight nod and continues to look through the menu. When she hears the door close behind her, she, too, gets up to leave.

319471080.speaker: 服务员
319471080.content: Excuse me, ma'am... It seems you haven't ordered anything. Was the service unsatisfactory?

319471081.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471081.content: They had something to do, and I have no interest in eating alone. As for what was unsatisfactory...

319471082.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471082.content: I hear you're well-known for your desserts?

319471084.speaker: 格莫瑞
319471084.content: Maybe you should write that on the entrance, then. Otherwise, visitors like myself won't know what we're missing.

319481001.content: Looking at the hole in the outer wall, which is gaping like a broken incisor, Ver hangs her head in despair.

319481002.speaker: 托特
319481002.content: You should be able to sense the increasing intensity of the invasions. Just do your best.

319481003.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319481003.content: But it's only the second day. How much longer can this go on for?

319481004.speaker: 托特
319481004.content: You're here to recover from your illness. Let me worry about the experiment.

319481005.speaker: 托特
319481005.content: To be honest with you, I also think this experiment has been rushed. The technology isn't developed enough yet. But I'm not the one who made that call, so we'll just have to comply.

319481006.speaker: 托特
319481006.content: Perhaps they'll be easier to handle once you're fully recovered?

319481007.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319481007.content: Fine, I hope I can help out a little more... Where's Ningishzida?

319481008.speaker: 托特
319481008.content: Is she off hiding in some corner again...?

319481009.content:
Ver and Thoth look around and find Ningishzida without much effort.
But they don't just find her.

319481010.content: The three Modifiers finally react in the same moment—with silence, alarm, and shock.

319481011.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481011.content: Would anyone be willing to explain? What is this place? What were those things just now?

319481012.content: Raising a hand to grasp a grayish-white fragment and watching as it disintegrates in her hand into a stream of data, Gremory ignores the stupefied Ningishzida and walks over to Ver and Thoth.

319481013.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481013.content: One person to answer for this will suffice. Who will it be?

319481014.speaker: 托特
319481014.content: How did you get in here?

319481015.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481015.content: Darling little Ningishzida brought me, of course.

319481016.speaker: 宁希达
319481016.content: Don't be ridiculous! It wasn't me—I don't even know how to get in here.

319481017.speaker: 宁希达
319481017.content: Oh—! I remember now—I felt a chill at my back before we came in. Was that you about to sneak up and attack me?

319481018.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481018.content: A secret attack wouldn't be necessary to deal with you. I just wanted to see what you were doing. Interesting people like you don't come around every day.

319481020.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481020.content: That's the strangest part. I don't think I did anything conspicuous, yet I caught your eye. Despite that, you couldn't even sense me following you.

319481021.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481021.content: I don't like feeling uninformed. You people have more and more to answer for.

319481022.content: Saying nothing, Thoth looks down at her watch—Gaea's counteraction meter shows no sign of budging, meaning that Gaea is having no reaction to Gremory's appearance in the Data Plane Layer.

319481023.content: Unable to tell if this is good or bad news, Thoth gives Ningishzida a meaningful glance. Ningishzida doesn't need to be a genius to know what that means. She discreetly takes out her Access Key.

319481024.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481024.content: If there are only three of you, then obliging me is in your best interest.

319481025.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481025.content: Even if you don't want to talk, I can make you.

319481026.content: Gremory giggles as red mist appears from out of nowhere and envelops the entire street. She steps back into the mist, seeming to become one with it, then slowly fades away.

319481028.speaker: 托特
319481028.content: I don't sense her Bane Energy... Wait, where's Norn?

319481029.content: Having suddenly lost sight of the enemy, Thoth and Ningishzida don't dare let their guard down. They move nearer to each other, then realize that Gremory and Ver have both disappeared.

319481030.content: Thoth quickly turns on her watch to look up Ver's location. Thoth and Ningishzida's signals are huddled together, and the dot of light representing Ver turns out to be nearby, but moving at a rapid speed.

319481031.content: They face the direction indicated on the map, but see no sign of Ver in the red mist.

319481034.content: As Ningishzida is speaking, the two Modifiers knock heads hard, like an actual specter did it to them.

319481035.content: Their heads are spinning when a loud, nearby crashing sound =snaps them out of it. When their eyes refocus, the red mist is gone. In its place, Ver is standing between them and Gremory, who has suddenly reappeared in her Visbane form.

319481036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319481036.content: Don't just stand there! Give yourselves another knock on the head if you're feeling dazed, but don't fall for her illusion again!

319481038.speaker: 格莫瑞
319481038.content: ...I've never used this move in front of anyone before. How did you know?

319481039.content: Using her shield to repel Gremory's scythe with all her might, Ver falls back in with her companions. She keeps her eyes locked on her adversary, who is almost exactly as strong as she will be ten years in the future.

319481040.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319481040.content: You have your secrets... and I have mine.

319491001.content: A child wearing a backpack is licking some ice cream when he hears a commotion behind him. He turns around to see where it's coming from, then tugs at the shirt of the man next to him.

319491002.speaker: 小男孩
319491002.content: Dad, what are those girls doing in the middle of the street?

319491003.speaker: 中年男人
319491003.content: Where? Whoa, they look pretty good...

319491005.speaker: 中年男人
319491005.content: Uh, I mean, it looks like one of those entertainment companies is filming a variety show or something. You know, the kind your mom likes...

319491006.speaker: 中年男人
319491006.content: There should be a law against that sort of thing. Standing in the street in the middle of the day... Aren't they blocking traffic? How are cars supposed to get by them with all those people standing around, gawking?

319491007.speaker: 小男孩
319491007.content: It's okay, Dad. You don't have to keep looking...

319491008.content: Murmurs swirl around the four women, still locked in combat. Fortunately, Gremory returned to her human form before being transported, so the situation hasn't gotten completely out of hand.

319491009.content: It's awkward, but the three Modifiers aren't about to let their guard down. Even though they were still fighting a second ago, there's no telling what Gremory will do next.

319491010.speaker: 格莫瑞
319491010.content: ...I tire of this. Why don't we part ways for now?

319491012.speaker: 格莫瑞
319491012.content: My questions still stand. If you wish to discuss them, I can always make time for you.

319491013.speaker: 托特
319491013.content: I'm afraid there's nothing to discuss.

319491014.speaker: 托特
319491014.content: Whatever your next move is, let's just stay out of each other's way, even if it's only by a step. Is that acceptable?

319491015.speaker: 格莫瑞
319491015.content: Stay out of each other's way unless it's inevitable, I take it?

319491018.content:
Smiling slightly, Gremory waves at the three Modifiers, then turns to leave.
Thoth lets out a sigh of relief, then leads Ver and Ningishzida back to the side of the road.

319491019.speaker: 托特
319491019.content: I'm not sure whether to call that carelessness or just bad luck...

319491020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319491020.content: Thoth, where's that person you said could handle her?

319491021.speaker: 托特
319491021.content: I only said that to unnerve Gremory. If they really did fight, it's hard to say who would win.

319491022.speaker: 托特
319491022.content: ...Do you remember the girl you met yesterday?

319491023.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319491023.content: Yesterday...? Someone who could beat Gremory... Oh! You mean Lokken?

319491024.speaker: 宁希达
319491024.content: Lokken?! No way. I don't know who's more dangerous, her or Gremory.

319491026.speaker: 宁希达
319491026.content: I treated a wound for her once. When I touched her, she stared daggers at me and said she was gonna eat me... Definitely the scariest patient I've had. Ever.

319491027.speaker: 托特
319491027.content: While the eating bit might've been a joke... don't count on her coming to deal with Gremory. Besides, I'd need the permission of Paracaesar... my superior, I mean, here to mobilize her.

319491028.speaker: 托特
319491028.content: We can't disclose the existence of Cognizant Visbanes to her. If CORG changes course and clashes with the Cognizant Visbanes before it's time, there's no telling how it will change the future.

319491029.speaker: 托特
319491029.content: Ningishzida, head back to Nordburg. As a precaution, avoid going out as much as you can.

319491030.speaker: 宁希达
319491030.content: Works for me—I just bought a bunch of new manga. This is my chance to finally read them...

319491031.speaker: 宁希达
319491031.content: I'll stay inside until the end of time if I have to! ... But feel free to call me if you need me. I'll try to get to where you are.

319491032.content: Ver can't help clenching her fists. Feeling some torment, she looks at Ningishzida. She wants to say something, but Thoth shakes her head at her.

319491033.content:
Their lives haven't been easy, and they can all imagine what Ningishzida is feeling.
If taking life as it comes is the ultimate form of self-preservation, then letting things play out as they will is the best consolation.

319491034.speaker: 托特
319491034.content:
I'm going back to the bookstore to take care of a few things.
We'll leave it at that. Contact me if anything happens.

319491036.content: Ver racks her brain, not sure if she missed something. She points to her chest.

319501001.speaker: 格罗娅
319501001.content: ...So, what you're saying is that your colleagues are busy with work while you weren't given anything to do, so you came to Saint Sophia for a visit. Is that right?

319501002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501002.content: When you say it like that, it sounds like I got benched.

319501004.content: Taking the glass of water brought to her by a service AGI Mecha and drinking from it, Ver looks all around the patient area.

319501005.speaker: 格罗娅
319501005.content: The outer garden wall was damaged, so the Prez is calling for a contractor to come make repairs.

319501007.speaker: 格罗娅
319501007.content: Is the water's temperature not suitable?

319501008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501008.content: N-No, it's fine, it just went down the wrong pipe.

319501009.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501009.content: Doctor Gloria, I was actually hoping to continue our conversation from this morning.

319501010.speaker: 格罗娅
319501010.content: I see. The Prez did say you would return. I would also like to uncover the cause of your illness. It could help us treat our other patients.

319501011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501011.content: Really? It would be amazing if treating me could help others, of course... but what I actually meant was our conversation about visiting...

319501013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501013.content: Yes... but do you have to wait for the Prez to get back before you can decide?

319501014.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501014.content: I don't have any work to do right now, so if you don't mind, I'd be happy to wait here.

319501017.speaker: 格罗娅
319501017.content: No, Miss Norn. What I mean is that you may visit Miss Verthandi and Miss Tarina now.

319501018.content: Ver slowly puts down the glass in her hand. Lost in thought, her vision blurs. In her head, Ver goes over each word Gloria said, making sure she didn't mishear. It's as if she's even hesitant to believe the complete sentence.

319501019.content: Though overcome with utter joy, the sheer unexpectedness of this outcome prevents that joy from showing on her face and in her voice. It's like she's dreaming.

319501020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501020.content: Thank you. But... why would you suddenly...

319501021.speaker: 格罗娅
319501021.content: Perhaps it's because the Prez already gave you permission after seeing this.

319501022.content: Gloria takes a folded piece of paper from her pocket and passes it to Ver.

319501023.content: Ver recognizes it the moment she lays eyes on it, then finally realizes why. She hastily touches her own pocket.

319501025.speaker: 格罗娅
319501025.content: Yes. From this, the Prez determined that your desire to see them is sincere.

319501026.speaker: 格罗娅
319501026.content: As long as we're certain that no harm will come to them, contact with people from the outside world may help them heal.

319501027.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501027.content: I would never hurt them. I can promise you that.

319501028.speaker: 格罗娅
319501028.content: The Prez believes you, and that's enough for me.

319501029.speaker: 格罗娅
319501029.content: The Prez also said that you originally intended to place this on the back garden wall. Who were you hoping would see it?

319501031.content: Ver unfolds the note. She reads the childish handwriting, sheepishly biting her lip.

319501032.content:
Ver, be happy! You're both going to get better!
—Miss Norn, the magical girl from the future

319501034.speaker: 格罗娅
319501034.content: Apart from you, only the Prez has read it.

319501035.content: Ver falls silent. She folds the note back up and puts it in her pocket, forcefully flattening it so the note won't fall back out again.

319501036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501036.content: Doctor Gloria, when can I see them? Would now be okay?

319501038.content:
Is this feeling trepidation? Anticipation? Fear? Joy?
As their footsteps resound one after the other through the empty hall, Ver's emotions grow ever more twisted.

319501039.content: Perhaps all of these feelings are existing at once, each for its own reason, but Ver can't distinguish between any of them. With the inevitable conclusion staring her in the face, she footnotes all of her thoughts as "meaningless."

319501040.content: The oft-feared and deepest despair of all people comes not from despair itself, but from the hope that precedes it.

319501041.speaker: 格罗娅
319501041.content: Here we are. This is the room.

319501042.content:
Snapped out of her thoughts, Ver looks at the door to the room.
The name "Verthandi," written on colorful cardstock, hangs on the door. It's quiet inside, without a hint of movement.

319501044.content: Under Ver's apprehensive gaze, Gloria is silent for nearly half a minute. At last, she nods.

319501046.content: Approaching the door, Ver takes a deep breath and firmly pats her face. She grabs ahold of the door handle.

319501047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501047.content: (Don't say anything you're not supposed to... Remember, you're "Norn"—"Norn...")

319501048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501048.content: (...You know better than anyone what she's thinking, remember?)

319501049.content: Ver relaxes when she feels the warmth of the wooden door handle. Controlling her breathing, she gently knocks on the door, then slowly pushes it open.

319501050.content: All is quiet in the room and the curtains are mostly drawn. Unopened toy boxes lay stacked on the desk and bookshelf. The decor is simple and fresh, but the lack of any sign of life gives the room a cold sort of tidiness.

319501051.content: The bed has been neatly made, and a pair of headphones rests beside the pillow. A row of paperback books stands on the interior nightstand, with one book missing.

319501052.content: Somehow, this familiar arrangement makes Ver seem slightly like a stranger to herself. Her gaze follows the edge of the bed until she sees a small figure, nearly obscured by the bed, cowering in the corner.

319501056.content: Seeing the girl timidly crane her neck, Ver carefully puts her hands behind her back, then slowly walks over to her with small, quiet steps.

319501057.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501057.content: Doctor Gloria is just outside. If you'd like, I can call her in, but...

319501058.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501058.content: Do you think you and I could spend a little time together?

319501059.content: The request, though coming from a stranger, seems to assuage all of the girl's fears. It's gentle, like Doctor Gloria was the first time she met her.

319501060.content: She slowly looks up at a familiar-looking face with glistening teardrops in her eyes.

319501064.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501064.content: Would you like to come up and sit on the edge of the bed? I remember there being an uneven bit in the corner that would always bump against my butt. It wasn't very comfortable.

319501065.content: Ver smiles when she sees her young self's eyes open wide in surprise, like she's heard exactly what was in her own mind. After all, Ver never told anyone about this flaw on the floor's corner when she was young, not even Gloria.

319501066.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501066.content: I used to live here, too. When I heard that you live here now, I thought it would be nice to see you. That's all I'm here to do—to see you.

319501067.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501067.content: But if you're not feeling well, I can leave.

319501069.content: The girl stands up and places the book in her hands onto the nightstand, then sits on the edge of the bed. Still too frightened to look at this unfamiliar visitor up close, however, she keeps anxiously squeezing her fingers.

319501070.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501070.content: "Dirge of the Elven Knight." What chapter are you on?

319501071.speaker: 小薇儿
319501071.content: The one when Lillian and the lord aren't together anymore. In Sky Isle.

319501072.speaker: 小薇儿
319501072.content: Have you read this book, too?

319501073.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501073.content: I have—it's very famous. When I finished this book as a kid, I wanted so badly to become someone like Lillian. Amazingly, that dream came true.

319501074.speaker: 小薇儿
319501074.content: You mean, you're... an elven knight?

319501075.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319501075.content: Um, well... I'm not an elf or a knight. But I do beat up bad guys with a sword like the elven knight.

319501077.content: The girl trembles involuntarily, seeming to recall a bad memory. She clenches her fists tightly as her eyes darken.

319501078.content: Ver doesn't explain or blame the girl for her sensitivity. Time will heal those wounds, but it will also become a barrier to empathy between them.

319501079.content: But she doesn't get discouraged or blame herself, for she knows very well that those feelings have not changed very much in the span of ten years.
