319801061.content: The Prez practically roars while charging at Ningishzida, but the short distance between them becomes chasm-like in the blink of an eye.

319801062.content: Suddenly, a hole appears in the ceiling above Ningishzida's head. She looks up dizzily to see a column of hazy white light expand rapidly before her eyes.

319801064.content: Ningishzida stands frozen in the same spot, seemingly focusing every last ounce of her ability to react on summoning her Divine Power. Layer upon layer of Divine Grace unfurls into shields over her head, like a blue daisy.

319801065.content: The white light steadily and rapidly bombards the shields, causing them to split and wither one by one.

319801066.content: Within a single second, the Divine Power Ningishzida is channeling at all costs is depleted. Mustering up the last of her strength, she pushes Tarina out of the way.

319801067.content: The white light shifts slightly in Tarina's direction, but Ningishzida defiantly raises her last few shields, not allowing the light to move.

319801068.content: Once the final shield is destroyed, the unhindered white light envelops Ningishzida's body but stops at the floor. Moments later, it dissipates with a bang.

319801069.content: It all happens so quickly that Ver and Thoth don't even make it to Ningishzida's side before the light vanishes.

319801071.speaker: 宁希达
319801071.content: Yeah... Heh, I thought I could block it...

319801072.content: Her entire body seems to have been reduced to raw data and computing power. Bit by bit, her unmoored form is peeled away like leaves in the wind.

319801073.content: But Ningishzida doesn't appear to be in any pain. She just smiles weakly, as if embarrassed by some blunder she made.

319801075.speaker: 宁希达
319801075.content: Funny, it doesn't hurt at all...

319801077.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319801077.content:
Can we save her?
Thoth...? Prez?

319801080.speaker: 宁希达
319801080.content: If you cry, I'll start crying too...

319801085.speaker: 宁希达
319801085.content: What can you do...? This is my wish...

319811001.content: The white light flashed through the room like a solar flare, and the tremors were only noticeable for seconds along several residential streets.

319811002.content: The incident, barely registering on the residents' radar, only appeared in a handful of posts online.

319811003.content: "Earthquake Aftershock," "Geologic Activity in Nordburg Resulting from Construction," "Illegal Chemical Lab Explosion," "Subterranean Monster..."

319811004.content: No one knew exactly what happened, nor was anyone motivated to investigate. Once accustomed to uneventful daily life, people tend to view the world through the lens of their own "common sense."

319811005.content: And when something outside the realm of "common sense" takes place, they're even more inclined to regard it the way they would the absurd and fantastical.

319811006.content: But then, when such an incident occurs right before their eyes and breaches the boundaries of common sense, that's when they find themselves in a different world, or a world that is unrecognizable.

319811007.speaker: 小院长
319811007.content: Gloria, take Tarina and Ver back to their rooms.

319811009.content: Gloria lifts the unconscious Tarina from the floor, then deeply bows her head in condolence to the silent Thoth and quietly sobbing Ver.

319811010.content: No trace of Ningishzida is left in the hallway. It's almost as if she was never there to begin with.

319811011.content: After hearing the sound of two doors shutting in succession behind her, Thoth heaves a sigh, then shifts her gaze from the food spilled on the floor to the Prez.

319811014.speaker: 托特
319811014.content: You don't know? Then why did you tell Ningishzida to get out of the way?

319811015.speaker: 小院长
319811015.content: Believe me, it's better if you don't know.

319811016.speaker: 托特
319811016.content: You can't even tell us why Ningishzida had to die?

319811018.speaker: 托特
319811018.content: The truth matters to us. What was that beam of light?

319811019.speaker: 小院长
319811019.content: As I said, I don't know. Really.

319811020.speaker: 小院长
319811020.content: Something has always been locked on to Tarina. Every time she fell ill, there were traces of external computing power scans all over her body.

319811021.speaker: 小院长
319811021.content: I want to know what that thing was too, as well as why it's so fixated on Tarina. But not even I've been able to figure it out...

319811022.speaker: 托特
319811022.content: So, you're certain it came for Tarina.

319811023.speaker: 小院长
319811023.content: That's why I had her stay here in Saint Sophia and cloaked her room in every way I could think of.

319811024.speaker: 小院长
319811024.content:
This is my fault. I never wanted to get anyone else involved.
If I'd known we'd face an attack like this, I never would have let you two in the door.

319811025.speaker: 托特
319811025.content:
I'm not trying to assign blame.
Ningishzida was from this World Line, she was going to reach her end sooner or later.

319811026.content: The Prez laughs self-deprecatingly and nods, then steps to the side of the hallway, opening the path to the main entrance.

319811027.speaker: 小院长
319811027.content: Forget it, it doesn't matter whose fault it is... Now go, and don't come back.

319811029.content: The Prez halts upon hearing the utterly despondent Ver speak up, then responds with great difficulty.

319811030.speaker: 小院长
319811030.content: To be honest with you, there was never a way to cure her. You should know as well as I do that Divine Grace can only manage her symptoms.

319811031.speaker: 小院长
319811031.content: Seeing as this branch has nearly reached its conclusion, let's just forget it...

319811034.content: Biting down hard on her lip, Ver forcefully wipes away her tears and storms over to the Prez.

319811035.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811035.content: Ningishzida wouldn't want to see us like this... All she wanted was to protect Tarina. Even in the end, she regretted nothing.

319811036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811036.content: Her wish was for everyone to be happy and healthy, and like she said, her wish has to come true... We have to help her make it come true.

319811037.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811037.content: So, no matter what happens to this place or who's got their eye on Tarina, I'm not giving up.

319811038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811038.content: I want her to live her life, to see the outside world, and make her own dreams come true so she has no regrets.

319811039.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811039.content: Even if I'm the only one who feels that way, I'm not giving up.

319811040.content: The Prez looks at Ver in a daze, seeming to see another figure overlaying Ver's visage and with no way of telling which is the one speaking...

319811041.speaker: 托特
319811041.content: Norn's right. We came here to save people, so there's no reason to just give up like this.

319811043.speaker: 托特
319811043.content: Even if this branch is reaching its end soon, it will still help us. So, don't let me hear you say anything more about giving up.

319811044.speaker: 小院长
319811044.content: But if something like this happens again...

319811045.speaker: 托特
319811045.content: We have our standards. Saving people isn't an act of suicide.

319811047.content: The Prez is abruptly interrupted by swaying, flickering lights. Ver and Thoth reflexively move to summon their Access Keys.

319811049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811049.content: Turing?! And Gremory... What are you doing here?

319811050.content: The two Cognizant Visbanes appear in the spot where the white light descended at an imperceptible speed. Turing looks up at the hole in the ceiling with a fleeting expression bordering on manic.

319811051.speaker: 格莫瑞
319811051.content: That Divine Power trace... It didn't come from either of you. Where's that green-haired girl?

319811053.speaker: 图灵
319811053.content: What happened here? And why her?

319811055.speaker: 图灵
319811055.content: What I'm asking is why the Modifier named Ningishzida died. What did she do?

319811058.content: Seeing the confusion on Turing's face and the complete disregard for life underneath it, a ferocious look begins to boil up in Ver's eyes.

319811059.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811059.content: Whatever you're up to, Turing, I'm not in the mood.

319811060.speaker: 图灵
319811060.content: Sad and angry about losing a friend?

319811063.speaker: 图灵
319811063.content: Looks like it was an accident. Let's go.

319811064.content:
Gremory gives a slight nod.
With another flickering of the lights, they vanish.

319811065.content: The tension brought by their sudden arrival briefly distracted from the anguish over Ningishzida's passing, but the feeling only returns with a vengeance in the wake of their equally sudden departure.

319811066.speaker: 托特
319811066.content: Ironic that a Cognizant could utter the phrase "my condolences" and even sound sincere.

319811067.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811067.content: They clearly couldn't care less that Ningishzida died...

319811068.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319811068.content: Do you think they did it?

319811069.speaker: 托特
319811069.content: Doesn't seem like it. I don't think Turing would have been capable of breaking all of Ningishzida's defenses from out of visual range in a single second.

319811070.speaker: 托特
319811070.content: He also seemed to be searching for something. It didn't look like he was faking that frantic look on his face.

319811071.content: Thoth looks up at the shroud of night through the hole in the ceiling.

319811072.content: The hallway lights illuminate Thoth's weary profile, as well as the meter on her watch, which has filled up a good few more ticks. There's also another Cleanser invasion alert.

319811073.speaker: 托特
319811073.content: The clues are all right in front of us... It's like we're being toyed with.

319821001.content: There's still light in the sky when she returns to Saint Sophia. The building is sparsely lit, making it look lonelier than usual.

319821002.content: Seeming to be asleep, the security AGI Mecha at the entrance gives no response as Ver walks past it.

319821003.content: Before she even enters the lobby, she collides into a figure moving in a hurry. The two seem to freeze momentarily, not seeing each other's faces clearly until light comes in from the street lamps.

319821004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319821004.content: Prez? Why do you have that backpack...? Where are you going?

319821005.content: After bumping into Ver on the medical center's doorstep, the Prez's expression hardens slightly. With a few vigorous ruffles of the hair, the youth approaches Ver.

319821006.speaker: 小院长
319821006.content: I need to find out where that light came from. I'll be gone for a while.

319821007.speaker: 小院长
319821007.content: Don't worry. Gloria will take good care of Ver and Tarina. They'll be just fine without me.

319821008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319821008.content: Do you have any leads? What if we...

319821009.speaker: 小院长
319821009.content:
No.
Remember what I told you.

319821010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319821010.content: Fine... When are you coming back then?

319821011.speaker: 小院长
319821011.content:
When I find the answer.
There won't be any time to verify whatever I uncover, so I'd prefer not to say anything unless I'm absolutely certain of it.

319821012.speaker: 小院长
319821012.content: Besides, Thoth didn't investigate too deeply, and CORG must have found a few clues... Basically, no matter how deep something's hidden, once it sees the light, it will soon be revealed.

319821013.speaker: 小院长
319821013.content: Go on in, I can make my own way out. Tarina's awake now.

319821014.speaker: 格罗娅
319821014.content: Miss Norn. Ver and Tarina have experienced enough agitation. I don't recommend visiting them right now.

319821015.content: Gloria stops Ver as soon as she enters the lobby, where she's sweeping up a pile of debris on the floor. Her tone is as calm and collected as always, as if nothing had happened at all.

319821016.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319821016.content: Is this... a picture that was hanging on the wall?

319821017.speaker: 格罗娅
319821017.content: Yes. It fell when the building was attacked. Tarina wants to save the pieces, so I'm gathering them up for her.

319821018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319821018.content: You told her what happened yesterday.

319821019.speaker: 格罗娅
319821019.content: The facts are what they are. I only hope they can accept them.

319821020.speaker: 格罗娅
319821020.content: Ver was frightened. Tarina is hopeful, but her kind nature has given her a guilty conscience. I think they both need time.

319821021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319821021.content: Then let me talk with them. No one's blaming Tarina, and there's nothing to be afraid of. I'll keep them company.

319821022.speaker: 格罗娅
319821022.content: Fine. If you insist, I'll go and see what they think.

319821023.content: Gloria leads Ver to the door to Tarina's room. The door is slightly ajar. Just when Gloria goes to knock, Ver pulls her back.

319821025.content: The last whiffs of the previous night's dinner have already been swept away by the air circulation system. The window is firmly closed, as if to shut out all the fears lurking under the curtain of darkness.

319821026.content: The two girls sit side by side on the edge of the bed. Ver holds Tarina's left hand in her right.

319821028.speaker: 塔琳娜
319821028.content: You saw what happened. How I didn't do anything then... How I couldn't do anything.

319821029.speaker: 小薇儿
319821029.content: But that wasn't because you didn't want to, right?

319821030.speaker: 塔琳娜
319821030.content: That's all I can tell myself...

319821031.speaker: 塔琳娜
319821031.content: Ver, Doctor Gloria told me everything. That the thing that killed Ningishzida was aiming for me, and that it might come back.

319821032.speaker: 塔琳娜
319821032.content: Aren't you afraid to be with me?

319821034.content: Tarina's eyes darken slightly, but she quickly flashes an understanding, consoling smile.

319821035.content: When she tries to remove her hand from Ver's, that frail little hand only grips it tighter.

319821038.speaker: 小薇儿
319821038.content: We're friends, and friends are supposed to protect each other... So, that's what I'm going to do.

319821039.content: Grief and warmth turn into tears in the corners of her eyes, and Tarina's smile gradually softens. Turning to face Ver, she reaches out with her right hand and pinches her innocent, yet determined cheek.

319821041.speaker: 塔琳娜
319821041.content: I believe that you'll become a great hero that can protect everyone.

319821042.content: Turning to see the girl's distant figure recede into the end of the hallway, Gloria releases the door handle.

319821043.content: There's no need to close it—children know how to become strong.

319831002.content: No answer comes from the silent bookstore. Thoth didn't come back like she said she would on the Plane Layer, but Ver's used to this.

319831003.content: But what she's used to is Thoth's mysterious comings and goings, not this lonely atmosphere in the shop. Granted, it was a cold and cheerless place to begin with.

319831004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831004.content: I have to get even stronger if I want to protect everyone.

319831005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831005.content: Even an attack like that... I know I can do it.

319831006.content: Not in the mood to rest, Ver goes to the basement. The training room door is open and the lights are still on inside.

319831007.speaker: 洛肯
319831007.content: You've all been gone long enough. Long enough for me to do a big cleanup.

319831008.content: Laying on the break area couch with a manga in hand and her feet on the coffee table, Lokken only gives Ver a passing glance when she walks in the door.

319831009.speaker: 洛肯
319831009.content: Where are the other two? And when's dinner?

319831010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831010.content: Thoth isn't back yet. She might be occupied with something...

319831012.content: Lokken slowly puts down the drink she'd just brought to her lips, raises her eyes, and stares at Ver's crestfallen mien. But all she does is give her a listless nod.

319831013.speaker: 洛肯
319831013.content: Was she killed by Visbanes? Or Cleansers?

319831014.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831014.content: Neither. We don't even know what it was. A beam of white light came down from the sky. Ningishzida took the blow trying to save someone.

319831015.speaker: 洛肯
319831015.content: And the person she was trying to save?

319831018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831018.content: What do you mean "that's okay then"?!

319831019.speaker: 洛肯
319831019.content: What I mean is that while it's too bad we won't get to see greenie again, there's no point in being all down in the dumps over it. She did what she had do, and that's enough.

319831020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831020.content: ... Is that really all you feel about it?

319831021.speaker: 洛肯
319831021.content: Like I said, tools should know their purpose. You'll feel a lot better if you accept the inevitable for what it is.

319831022.speaker: 洛肯
319831022.content: In other words, do you think you'll never die, or do you want everyone around you acting like they'll die from the shock of it when you do?

319831023.speaker: 洛肯
319831023.content: Don't agree with me? Why don't you ask Thoth?

319831025.content: As she looks at Lokken in the break area, Ver can't shake the feeling that something's missing. When her gaze lands on the bookshelf, she realizes that the half of the wooden plaque is gone.

319831026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831026.content: Lokken, have you seen that thing that was placed at the top of the bookshelf?

319831027.speaker: 洛肯
319831027.content: Oh, that bit of wood? I cleaned that spot up, too.

319831028.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831028.content: What do you mean you "cleaned that spot up"???

319831029.speaker: 洛肯
319831029.content: I threw it out. I told you I cleaned up, didn't I? I threw away everything that you trashed with that sword of yours this morning.

319831030.speaker: 洛肯
319831030.content: I didn't touch anything that still looked usable. You can ask Thoth or one of her agents if they know how to use any of it...

319831032.speaker: 洛肯
319831032.content:
The garbage collection spot outside, obviously.
Why? Did you want it for something?

319831035.content: Ver feels her hands and feet go cold as a vast void seems to fill her vision. She clenches her fists, but she can't grab hold of anything.

319831036.content: The narrow crack in the floor looks like a hideous gash, mocking her for her futile search for something to lean on. It slashes through the stifling suffocation and deep dread.

319831037.content: Looking at the puzzled Lokken, Ver is struck by the urge to lash out at her for no reason. But knowing that it wouldn't help, she finally relaxes her hands.

319831039.speaker: 洛肯
319831039.content: How are you gonna train without Ningishzida?

319831041.speaker: 洛肯
319831041.content: Huh? Honestly... What's up with you? It was just a bit of wood...

319831042.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831042.content: Someone I care about gave it to me!

319831043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319831043.content: I'm done talking about this... I just want to be alone.

319831044.content: Apparently subdued by Ver suddenly raising her voice, Lokken shrugs, hops off the couch, and languidly makes her way out.

319831046.speaker: 洛肯
319831046.content: Where did this "someone you care about" go off to without you?

319831047.content: As if materializing from the void, a golden sword light slashes mercilessly at Lokken just as she stumbles past Ver.

319831048.content: Lokken nonchalantly raises her hand to block it—it's only when she feels the force from Ver's Access Key that she realizes her mistake. Before she can fully react, she's completely expelled from the room.

319831049.content: The door to the training room slams shut. Lokken picks herself up from the floor and rubs her aching wrist, shaking her head incredulously.

319841001.speaker: 宁希达
319841001.content: "Beep! Beep! Beep! Time to wake up, Ver!"

319841002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841002.content: Mmm... Just lemme sleep a bit longer.

319841003.speaker: 宁希达
319841003.content: "Beep! Beep! Beep! Time to wake up, Ver!"

319841004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841004.content: Just five more minutes. Okay, Ningishzida...?

319841007.content: She knows she's already slept through the night, but it feels like it's hardly been a wink when she opens her eyes.

319841008.content: Ver lies on the floor and stares at the ceiling. When the alarm from the tactical tablet goes off a third time, she finally gets up as if to escape it.

319841009.speaker: 宁希达
319841009.content: "Beep! Beep! Beep! Time to wake up, Ver..."

319841010.content: She turns off the alarm, then stares at her reflection in the screen, unconsciously mimicking Ningishzida's way of holding the tablet. When she snaps out of it, she puts the tablet aside, as if not wanting to admit it.

319841012.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841012.content: Her wish... Remember her wish... Everyone's wishes...

319841013.content: Balloons, streamers, manga, the sofa... Her field of vision seems to lose focus with each heartbeat. Everywhere she looks, there are vestiges of Ningishzida.

319841014.content: Ver can still almost see the image of Ningishzida busying about amid these purely decorative items. Sifting through her memories of those days, she can't remember Ningishzida ever being upset for even a second.

319841016.content: The training timetable has come off the wall at one corner. Ver sticks it back in place. Heaving a long sigh, she turns to leave the training room.

319841017.content: When she hears the sound of talking coming from upstairs, she quickens her pace. Noticing her approach, the person sitting behind the counter suddenly stops talking.

319841019.content: Thoth looks at Ver for a spell, then motions for her to wait a moment.

319841020.speaker: 托特
319841020.content: Thank you, Doctor Gloria. We'll be right there.

319841021.speaker: 托特
319841021.content: Yes, Norn as well. She's awake now.

319841022.content: Thoth ends the call. Picking up her key from the table, she beckons to Ver.

319841023.speaker: 托特
319841023.content: Something's wrong with the artificial heart... Don't worry, it's not as serious as the issue of how much time is left in hyperspace.

319841024.speaker: 托特
319841024.content: But we still need to go check it out. It could be relevant to you.

319841025.speaker: 格罗娅
319841025.content: Sorry to keep you waiting. I was just conducting a routine checkup on Tarina.

319841026.content: Dispensing with formalities, Gloria immediately proceeds to explain little Ver's current situation.

319841027.content: In about ten minutes, Gloria explains the broad strokes in simple terms, perhaps because she knows that neither Thoth nor Ver have much medical expertise.

319841028.speaker: 托特
319841028.content: The demands on her body itself?

319841029.speaker: 格罗娅
319841029.content: Yes. At present, it looks like Ver's illness isn't the result of heart failure. It's because a normal heart isn't capable of meeting the demand of Ver's body.

319841030.speaker: 格罗娅
319841030.content: At the current rate of attrition, the artificial heart will need to be replaced in a month at least. Her previous symptoms will also re-emerge in this period.

319841031.speaker: 格罗娅
319841031.content: Regular heart transplants would be the most conservative approach. But even putting aside the cost, such frequent surgeries would cause irreversible damage to her body. No amount of advanced tissue repair technology would help either.

319841032.speaker: 托特
319841032.content: Do you know what the source of this physical demand is?

319841033.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841033.content: I still don't understand... Do you mean that there's a problem with my—I mean, Ver's body?

319841034.content: Seeing Ver's bewilderment and worried she might give up the game, Thoth frowns slightly and clears her throat.

319841035.speaker: 托特
319841035.content: Doctor Gloria. Is there anything else you know about the cause of Ver's illness?

319841036.content: After a brief silence, Gloria placidly shakes her head. Wanting to press the matter further when she seems to suddenly realize something, Thoth instead holds her tongue.

319841038.content: Ver scratches her head, not fully understanding what they're talking about. As she debates whether she should ask, she spots a small figure swaying behind the corner down the hall.

319841039.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841039.content: Tarina? What are you doing hiding over there?

319841040.speaker: 塔琳娜
319841040.content: I just wanted to go out and walk around some more now that I can finally leave my room.

319841041.content: Seemingly not expecting to be discovered, Tarina awkwardly comes around the corner and walks over, then lowers her head apologetically at Ver and Thoth.

319841042.speaker: 塔琳娜
319841042.content: To be honest, I heard you were coming just now during my checkup. I didn't think it would be right to hide from you...

319841044.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841044.content: Don't worry about it, Tarina. There's nothing for you to be sorry about.

319841045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841045.content: It's in the past now, and none of it was your fault. All that matters now is finding the real culprit.

319841046.speaker: 塔琳娜
319841046.content: Thank you. But... I used to always think that I'd be stuck in my room forever. That I'd always be a patient that needs to be taken care of without ever having to do anything myself or have any responsibilities.

319841047.speaker: 塔琳娜
319841047.content: I guess things are different now. When I was lying in bed last night, I kept thinking about if I should do something for everyone.

319841048.speaker: 塔琳娜
319841048.content: I heard everything you were saying just now... Doctor Gloria, why don't you use my heart? You and the Prez said that my heart could save Ver, didn't you?

319841050.speaker: 格罗娅
319841050.content: Tarina, you promised the Prez that you wouldn't discuss this.

319841051.speaker: 塔琳娜
319841051.content: But you're all trying to think of a way to cure Ver. Why can't I talk about it?

319841052.speaker: 塔琳娜
319841052.content: If my heart can go to Ver and I can take the artificial one, wouldn't that at least help?

319841053.speaker: 格罗娅
319841053.content: Could you... return to your room for now? I'd need to discuss this with our visitors, as well as the Prez.

319841054.content: Hearing the refusal in Gloria's words, Tarina complies. Smiling bitterly, she nods and reluctantly turns to leave.

319841055.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319841055.content: Doctor Gloria? What do you mean Tarina's heart could save Ver?

319841056.speaker: 格罗娅
319841056.content: Even if I don't answer that, I think you already know what that would mean.

319841057.content: Gloria looks in the direction Tarina left in with a hint of pity in her eyes.

319841058.speaker: 格罗娅
319841058.content: These are the results of six months of analysis of simulated biological data.

319841059.speaker: 格罗娅
319841059.content: We have no sure way to cure Tarina. So, if Tarina reaches the point where she can't hold out any longer, we'd put her heart into Verthandi. There's at least a 75 percent chance that Ver would make a full recovery.

319841060.speaker: 格罗娅
319841060.content: This was our initial treatment plan as well as our final resort to cure Verthandi.

319851002.speaker: 路人B
319851002.content: You should probably step back, miss.

319851004.speaker: 路人B
319851004.content: I don't know... We'd better let the police handle it.

319851005.content: In a moving crowd, it only takes one person stopping before a second, and then a third stop... And if every person stops for long enough, it'll just keep sucking in passersby like a vortex.

319851006.content: This is the scene that greets Ver and Thoth when they return to Sudburg.

319851007.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851007.content: This house looks just like the Plane Layer...

319851008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851008.content: Could something have happened on Lokken's end?

319851009.speaker: 托特
319851009.content: If the Data Plane Layer were damaged, it would be reflected in the Surface Layer. This looks more like a localized overlapping of the Plane and Surface Layers. This wasn't us, I'm afraid.

319851010.speaker: 托特
319851010.content: The collapse factor is nearly at 80. Whatever happens now shouldn't come as a surprise.

319851011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851011.content: We're not gonna do anything? But there's so many people standing around staring...

319851012.speaker: 托特
319851012.content: There's nothing we can do. Phenomena like this will only multiply. Influencing the trajectory of people's lives will also amplify the World Line's deviation.

319851013.speaker: 托特
319851013.content: Starting today, we should be prepared to return at a moment's notice.

319851014.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851014.content: The experiment's ending? But we still haven't figured out what happened at Saint Sophia, and I still haven't taken Tarina out...

319851015.speaker: 托特
319851015.content: You'll just have to hurry then.

319851016.speaker: 托特
319851016.content: We have no control over this at all. It's time to face this world's inevitable fate.

319851017.content: Thoth pulls Ver past the crowd of onlookers without slowing down.

319851018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851018.content: Tho-Tho, what's the rush? I thought it didn't matter if the experiment ended.

319851019.speaker: 托特
319851019.content: Aren't you pretty much fully recovered? Don't tell me you want to stay here forever?

319851020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851020.content: Of course not. It's just that we've run into so many more problems today. Not just little Ver's, but that house just now, and Cleansers appearing in the Surface Layer...

319851021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851021.content: Don't you want to get to the bottom of them before we leave?

319851022.speaker: 托特
319851022.content: New problems will just keep arising.

319851023.content: Seeming to think that her own delivery echoed the urgency in Ver's voice, Thoth collects herself and tries to recoup her usual tone.

319851024.speaker: 托特
319851024.content: The unknown comes with both curiosity and fear. The former compels us forward, the latter sends us running.

319851025.speaker: 托特
319851025.content: When it comes to the kaleidoscope of peculiarities in hyperspace, we're just observers. Just like the people who gathered around that faded house.

319851026.speaker: 托特
319851026.content: The desire to get to the bottom of what's happening before their eyes only drags the onlookers in. Even if we wanted to, it would be Director Paracaesar's research team that would do it.

319851027.speaker: 托特
319851027.content: From your vantage point, there are still many unanswered questions and things you want to do. But remember... this is all just an experiment.

319851028.speaker: 托特
319851028.content: From the research center's vantage point, the experiment has already reached its final phase. The problems we encountered will be recorded for later analysis and to prepare for the next experiment...

319851029.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851029.content: Do you think not giving up is pointless too?

319851030.content: Thoth stops and looks back at Ver, who has fallen behind. Ver lowers her head and stubbornly bites her lip.

319851031.content: A vague hint of heartache flashes through her eyes. Thoth turns around and takes Ver's hand, caressing it consolingly.

319851032.speaker: 托特
319851032.content: I just want you to understand that there's no reason for you to regret or suffer over the things you can't change. How this all ends isn't up to you alone.

319851033.speaker: 托特
319851033.content: Besides, if you go back looking like this, Odin and the Administrator will think that I bullied you. How will I explain myself to them then?

319851034.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319851034.content: That won't happen... They're all reasonable people.

319851035.speaker: 托特
319851035.content: You're probably more optimistic than I am then. Everyone has their own way of approaching what they see meaning in, and no one will deny you yours.

319851036.speaker: 托特
319851036.content: We don't have much time, but there is still time. I'll be right behind you until we leave the hyperspace. Do what you have to do.

319861002.speaker: 托特
319861002.content: We walked from Nordburg. Of course we weren't as fast as you.

319861003.content: Thoth sits on the lounger and rubs her brow, but doesn't hear Lokken or Ver speak to each other. Opening her eyes uncertainly, she discovers twisted expressions on their faces.

319861004.speaker: 托特
319861004.content: ... Alright, you two. Who's going to speak up and tell me what the fight was about?

319861005.speaker: 洛肯
319861005.content: I threw away a—no, half a wooden tablet that was in the training room. Norn said it was something her friend gave her.

319861006.speaker: 托特
319861006.content: Tablet? You mean the wooden plaque?

319861008.speaker: 托特
319861008.content: Why did you only have half the plaque?

319861009.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319861009.content: I think it broke the day Lokken and I fought...

319861010.speaker: 洛肯
319861010.content: Huh? So you're saying this is my fault again?!

319861011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319861011.content: I didn't say you broke it. I must've been too careless... Besides, with only half of it left, it'd have looked like something that should be thrown away.

319861012.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319861012.content: I tried to find you this morning, but you weren't there. I'm sorry for how I behaved yesterday.

319861013.speaker: 洛肯
319861013.content: Tch. Don't just apologize out of nowhere.

319861014.content: No sooner had Lokken pulled a triumphant expression than Ver's sudden apology turned it to one of discomfort.

319861015.speaker: 洛肯
319861015.content: It was only a tickle. If you've got that much energy, it's fine to play around.

319861016.speaker: 洛肯
319861016.content: I didn't know that plaque thing mattered that much to you. I won't mess with anything else in the training room.

319861017.speaker: 托特
319861017.content: Pinky promise you two won't fight anymore?

319861018.speaker: 洛肯
319861018.content: I think you're getting hooked on playing make-believe... Do we have anything else planned for today?

319861019.speaker: 托特
319861019.content: We'll take a break this afternoon. Ver and I are going back to Saint Sophia this evening.

319861020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319861020.content: Oh, right! I need to go in and grab something.

319861021.content: Nearly forgetting the whole reason that she came back, Ver rushes into the back room. The ensuing rummaging that comes from inside makes Lokken roll her eyes.

319861022.speaker: 洛肯
319861022.content: What's with her? One minute it was all doom and gloom, and now she's full of beans again.

319861023.speaker: 托特
319861023.content: Grief comes from compassion, cheerfulness comes from optimism. If she had a sour face like yours all the time, I wouldn't be interested in helping her.

319861024.speaker: 洛肯
319861024.content: Is that so? I don't remember you feeling that way ten years ago.

319861025.speaker: 托特
319861025.content: To this day, I still don't know whether saving you was the right thing to do.

319861026.speaker: 洛肯
319861026.content: Did you say that to the other me?

319861027.speaker: 托特
319861027.content: She was the one who was saved, of course she thought it was the correct choice.

319861028.speaker: 洛肯
319861028.content: I think so too... I'm only Lokken if I'm still alive. Otherwise, I'm just "0700 (10)." At least she's still a person.

319861029.speaker: 托特
319861029.content: Would you like to see what she's up to?

319861030.content: Having been outsmarted by Thoth, Lokken scoffs and shakes her head helplessly, then gets a little closer.

319861031.content: Thoth opens her terminal and brings up a photo. In it, Lokken is helping to arrange goods outside an old store that's in complete disarray. She's raising a finger up to the camera with a forced smile on her face.

319861032.speaker: 洛肯
319861032.content: Bahahaha! What IS that place? How did it end up like that? Seriously, doesn't she have anything better to do...?

319861034.speaker: 洛肯
319861034.content: Yep, that's definitely "happy" written all over her face.

319861035.speaker: 洛肯
319861035.content: Norn and greenie... The ways those rookies would laugh their heads off into the night... I guess that's what "happy" looks like.

319861036.speaker: 托特
319861036.content: At least you can understand them.

319861037.speaker: 洛肯
319861037.content:
That doesn't make us the same.
You can't erase what you're born with, even if you try so hard that you end up covered in blood. It's stuck in your bones.

319861038.content: Lokken looks at the other version of herself in the photo. She extends a finger and, pointing it at her forehead, flicks it up like she's firing a gun.

319861040.content: Pushing away the screen, Lokken reaches into her pocket and fishes out the chip Thoth gave her the morning before, then tosses it onto the table.

319861042.speaker: 托特
319861042.content: No. That's as much as we know about the Cleansers. You don't think it's enough?

319861043.speaker: 洛肯
319861043.content: There's obviously a difference between looking at a strategy and carrying it out yourself. I went to hang out in the Plane Layer today. I got way more information from that than all that "analysis" of the data.

319861044.speaker: 洛肯
319861044.content: If you guys don't know... then fine. Go explore for yourselves, it might be fun.

319871001.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871001.content: These are number birthday candles. You just stick the number for how old she's turning that day into the cake.

319871002.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871002.content: You could also just use regular celebration candles. Or you could write something on the cake. What do you think Tarina would like?

319871003.speaker: 小薇儿
319871003.content: The number candles, I think. She's turning 15.

319871004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871004.content: Okay. Then you can write her a birthday wish in a card. How's that?

319871006.content: The two girls lean over the table in little Ver's room, patiently making their selections from a pile of celebration supplies.

319871007.content: Apparently worried that Tarina will hear them from next door and spoil the surprise, they speak in hushed whispers. All that can be heard from outside the room are bursts of heartfelt laughter.

319871008.content: Gloria gently closes the door, then shakes her head at Thoth beside her.

319871009.speaker: 格罗娅
319871009.content: I don't know where the Prez intends to go. But the Prez certainly didn't withhold any information regarding Verthandi.

319871010.speaker: 托特
319871010.content: So, you still don't have any leads on her cardiac load?

319871012.content: Thoth nods and falls silent. She looks at Ver's back through the crack in the door.

319871013.content: Seeming to confirm that Ver hasn't picked up on their conversation, Thoth looks back at Gloria with an added hint of mystery in her eyes.

319871014.speaker: 托特
319871014.content: Doctor Gloria. If I'm not mistaken, the person named Norvi is the one who actually runs this place.

319871015.speaker: 格罗娅
319871015.content: The president hasn't returned for quite some time.

319871016.speaker: 托特
319871016.content: I haven't seen her in a long time either.

319871017.speaker: 格罗娅
319871017.content: Could you be a little more specific?

319871018.speaker: 托特
319871018.content: I run a bookstore in the old town area. There aren't many people who want to come and sit down in a bookstore these days, but the ones that do always come with a story.

319871019.speaker: 托特
319871019.content: The rest is simple. Except one day, a customer came into the store. She told me a piece of history, gave me a name, then asked if I could wait.

319871021.content: Thoth opens her hand to reveal a silver pocket watch.

319871022.content: The hands of the watch are stopped at 8:08, seemingly uncalibrated. And yet, when the second hand reaches the 40 second mark, it then begins to proceed counterclockwise.

319871023.speaker: 格罗娅
319871023.content: Why would she give that to you? I don't understand... You're with CORG.

319871024.speaker: 托特
319871024.content: I don't know how much more intelligent you can get, but you'd do well not to judge a person's stance on the basis of their status. Especially when it comes to sensitive questions.

319871025.content: Barely letting the watch see the light of day, Thoth returns it to her pocket, then casts Gloria a somewhat regretful look.

319871026.speaker: 托特
319871026.content: You know, I wouldn't have said any of this... if the truth weren't so important.

319871028.content: Little Ver slowly puts down the colored pen in her hand as she watches Ver slip the birthday card into an envelope.

319871029.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871029.content: Hm? Did you want to write something else?

319871030.speaker: 小薇儿
319871030.content: No. I was wondering... am I still not cured yet?

319871032.speaker: 小薇儿
319871032.content: Doctor Gloria brought a new medical instrument in this morning, and she asked if my heart was beating faster than usual or if I wasn't feeling well.

319871033.speaker: 小薇儿
319871033.content: And Thoth and Doctor Gloria are discussing something again. That's why I was wondering...

319871034.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871034.content: Why not think on the bright side?

319871035.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871035.content: You just had surgery. It's perfectly normal for Doctor Gloria to give you a checkup and make sure you're doing okay.

319871038.content: Ver looks back imploringly towards Thoth and Gloria for help, but realizes that the door is closed.

319871039.content: In the nearly sealed room, weariness and dissension flood Ver's heart without warning—She doesn't want to lie anymore. She wordlessly puts down the envelop and takes little Ver's hands in hers.

319871040.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871040.content: If you're still worried, how about I examine you? I won't lie to you.

319871041.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319871041.content: Let's close our eyes and think of other things...

319871042.content: Seeing little Ver obediently close her eyes, Ver sighs deeply and, just as she'd learned to probe Tarina's computing power for defects, she directs her Divine Power into little Ver's body.

319871043.content: But unlike the previous day, she feels her Divine Power being pulled by something the moment it comes into contact with little Ver's body. Ignoring Ver's intentions, it picks up speed and courses into little Ver.

319871045.content: Ver immediately lets go of little Ver's hands. She's so stunned that she forgets to comfort little Ver as she somewhat grievously clutches her chest over her heart.

319881003.speaker: 托特
319881003.content: What year is it right now?

319881005.content: In a corner of Saint Sophia's back garden, Thoth looks at Ver's animated expression. Her calm gaze, hidden in the shade, subconsciously falls to Ver's chest.

319881006.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881006.content: But I really did sense Divine Grace. Could her awakening have stopped halfway or something?

319881007.speaker: 托特
319881007.content: Awakenings don't "stop halfway." Awakenings are authorizations granted to Modifiers by Gaea. They don't happen twice.

319881008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881008.content: But there's a first time for everything, right? Besides, it makes sense—

319881009.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881009.content: She might only have a little Divine Grace, but her body hasn't matured enough to withstand it. That's why the demand on her heart is so high... Wouldn't that make sense?

319881010.speaker: 托特
319881010.content: You're looking at the process in terms of the results.

319881012.speaker: 托特
319881012.content: You're probably the first person to inject their Divine Grace into a version of themselves that hasn't awakened yet. What kind of bizarre reactions might occur is anyone's guess.

319881013.speaker: 托特
319881013.content: Of course, it's a phenomenon that's worth paying attention to. I'll take a note of it. For now, try not to think about it too much.

319881014.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881014.content: Okay... Then after I leave, I'll go ask the Cryptics, or I'll see if Odin's around. She might know...

319881016.content: Ver freezes. As far as she can remember, this is the first time Thoth has spoken to her in such a strict tone. It doesn't sound at all like she's joking.

319881017.speaker: 托特
319881017.content: No one else can know about this.

319881018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881018.content: I'm not saying I'll tell anyone what actually happened. I'll just say that I seem to remember having Divine Power when I was little...

319881019.speaker: 托特
319881019.content: That's what I mean. You don't want to know the answer.

319881021.content: Thoth is silent for a while. Putting her hands into her pockets, she steps closer to Ver.

319881022.speaker: 托特
319881022.content: Many things aren't the way you think they are. We all have to do our best to accept truths we'd rather not even speculate on.

319881023.speaker: 托特
319881023.content: Ver... Do you remember what the goal of the hyperspace experiment is?

319881024.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881024.content: To find the source of the Visbanes.

319881025.speaker: 托特
319881025.content: Indeed. No one knows what caused Visbanes to appear. They're by no means a part of Gaea, so they must have come from a different source.

319881026.speaker: 托特
319881026.content: After years of searching for clues, all CORG could come up with were a few data characteristics. However, we know for sure that the source is an entity that can move through Gaea just like us.

319881027.speaker: 托特
319881027.content: The only thing Gaea has made easy for us here is that everything is composed of data with the same set of rules applied to everything.

319881028.content: As she speaks, Thoth produces a metal rod the size of a needle from her pocket. An indicator light protrudes from one end.

319881029.speaker: 托特
319881029.content: This custom probe lights up green when it comes into contact with anything that has predefined data characteristics.

319881030.speaker: 托特
319881030.content: Remember when we ran into Turing? Raphael touched the surface of that building with this probe. The green light came on.

319881031.speaker: 托特
319881031.content: I thought it meant he'd found what he was looking for. It wasn't until you gave me Tarina's examination report that I realized there was something else we had to look into, too.

319881033.speaker: 托特
319881033.content: No one knows exactly how Visbanes came into existence. CORG has been searching for the answer, as have Gengchen and Odin.

319881034.speaker: 托特
319881034.content: Up to now, CORG concluded from the data they found that it was a person—a person cycling in Gaea with some of the Origin's power.

319881036.speaker: 托特
319881036.content: And then I learned that Tarina's heart is in your body.

319881037.speaker: 托特
319881037.content: So, how would you explain to others that your heart is connected to the Visbanes?

319881038.content: Thoth raises the metal rod and pokes Ver's heart with it. She does so slowly, and Ver makes no move to evade her.

319881039.content: A nano needle emerges from the smooth end of the rod and pricks Ver's skin.

319881040.content: A green light illuminates their frozen faces.

319881041.speaker: 托特
319881041.content: Now it all makes sense. Tarina was born with a congenital defect because she isn't actually human.

319881042.speaker: 托特
319881042.content: It also explains why you have Bane Energy spreading from your heart... That heart is its source.

319881043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881043.content: That can't be... You must have gotten it wrong, Tho-Tho. How is that even possible...?

319881044.content: Ver pushes Thoth's hand away, takes a few steps back, and shakes her head glassy-eyed. Thoth nearly follows her when she sees a child-like fear dawn in Ver's eyes.

319881045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881045.content: Are you... going to kill Tarina and me?

319881046.speaker: 托特
319881046.content: Of course not. Remember what I told you? I'll be right behind you.

319881047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881047.content: But you're a Modifier. And I'm... What even am I?

319881048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881048.content: I know I have Bane Energy in my body, obviously. But I'm not...

319881049.content: Ver's body is trembling. Looking down at her hands, she summons her Access Key and desperately fires up her Divine Power.

319881050.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881050.content: See, Tho-Tho? My Access Key is normal, so is my Divine Power. I'm a Modifier. How could I have anything to do with the Visbanes?

319881051.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881051.content: And there's absolutely no way that Tarina has anything to do with them. Visbanes are murderous monsters, and Tarina is so kind—

319881052.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881052.content: Why are you making that face?

319881053.speaker: 托特
319881053.content: Ver, this isn't the time to be running away from the truth. You need to accept it, as well as remember how sensitive this secret is.

319881054.speaker: 托特
319881054.content: Promise me that you won't tell anyone else about your heart transplant, nor will you let anyone start digging into your past.

319881055.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881055.content: How is that fair? You can't just say something like that and expect me to accept it... I need to go back. I don't want to be part of this experiment anymore.

319881056.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881056.content: Just tell me how to go back, okay? I need to find the Administrator. The Administrator will know what to do...

319881059.content: Silk threads and flying daggers hover around Thoth. The blades, thin as a cicada's wings, meld with the night, while a wisp of cold light points at Ver's heart from the distance.

319881060.speaker: 托特
319881060.content: Maybe you need more tangible evidence, maybe you just need to blow off some steam. Maybe you need to be told by someone you trust more than me, or maybe you just need some time, as well as a good night's sleep...

319881061.speaker: 托特
319881061.content: But I can't just let you leave like this. I'm sorry, but this matter involves too many people, and it will impact their fates and decisions.

319881062.speaker: 托特
319881062.content: You can take this as a warning. You just need to promise me, I know you'll keep your word.

319881063.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881063.content: What will it take for you to believe that I'm not?

319881064.speaker: 托特
319881064.content: What will it take for you to accept that you are?

319881065.content: Ver shakes her head and looks forlornly at Thoth.

319881066.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881066.content: From the day I awakened as a Modifier, I knew that Modifiers are comrades, while anything that uses Bane Energy is our enemy.

319881067.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881067.content: I was happy knowing that I finally had the power to protect everyone. I didn't have to hide in some corner anymore. I could fight for everything I love.

319881068.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881068.content: When things got really dangerous, I thought I might die. That a Visbane might kill me. But I never regretted a thing, because I knew that this was my mission as a Modifier.

319881069.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881069.content: So, how could I possibly accept that? If it was actually the Visbanes' power that kept me alive, then what am I even holding on for...

319881072.speaker: 托特
319881072.content: You didn't lose control of the Bane Energy in your body only one time. If this was just corrosion, there simply wouldn't be this much of it.

319881073.speaker: 托特
319881073.content: Have you really never thought about it? Or even sensed just where that Bane Energy was coming from?

319881075.content: A look of panic starts to form on Ver's face. She starts retreating again, as if she's about to make a run for it.

319881076.content: The daggers, already poised and ready, fly towards Ver the second she turns to run. She blocks them with her sword, but like falcons on the hunt, they fly back around from all sides and pin her in place.

319881077.content: Ver's mind goes blank at Thoth's sudden attack. Just as Modifiers can't harm humans without a reason, they can't attack each other with hostility either, unless...

319881079.content: Ver's fear seems to trigger her defensive instincts, and her vision grows blurry and her body no longer seems to be under her control as another, inexplicable power erupts from it.

319881080.content:
A golden sword light knocks away the flying daggers and slashes at Thoth with unabating speed.
Seeing that Ver is about to land a blow on her, Thoth lowers her hands and makes no attempt to evade it.

319881081.speaker: 托特
319881081.content: Is this who you really are?

319881084.content: The rattling of her blades as they fall to the ground ring in Ver's ears.

319881085.content: They fall to the ground, and like all the Access Keys she's seen, they will decay along with the earth after the sword is swung down.

319881087.content: The enmeshing of illusion and reality is like a bucket of cold water poured over Ver's head. A glimmer of reason swiftly returns to her empty-looking eyes, and she quickly pulls back on the power she's unleashing through her hands.

319881088.content: The sword light vanishes the instant it touches Thoth's skin. A crimson line spreads across her arm, followed by a stream of blood flowing down from it.

319881091.speaker: 托特
319881091.content: It's only a scratch... But tell me, is there anything at all I can do to help you?

319881092.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881092.content: That wasn't me... That's not true...

319881093.content: Recalling her Access Key, Ver reaches out to cover Thoth's wound. But when she catches sight of her own hands, she pulls them back in disgust.

319881094.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319881094.content: I have to go. I'm sorry.

319881095.content: No longer caring whether Thoth intends to stop her, Ver steps back a few paces, then turns and runs from the medical center.

319881096.content: Thoth turns to the medical center and runs her eyes over a row of lit windows. A curtain behind one of them sways.

319881097.content: When she turns back to the direction Ver ran off in, her figure has all but disappeared into the night. The silhouette she catches a fleeting glimpse of looks so despondent that Thoth can't even bear to call out her name.

319891002.content: Waves riding the darkness lap against the embankment, swallowing Ver's words in splashes of water. A passing scavenger glances curiously at this lone girl sitting at the side of the road, but doesn't dare to disturb her.

319891003.content: She stares blankly at the lights diffused over the water's surface. They waver, splinter, then gather back together, like a dying candle flame, powerless to illuminate anything below the dark, towering wall of the night.

319891004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891004.content: I didn't want it to be this way...

319891005.speaker: 托特
319891005.content: The way what's supposed to be?

319891006.content: Ver hears Thoth's voice from beside her, but doesn't turn to look. She continues to stare at the lights.

319891007.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891007.content: I'm not supposed... to have anything to do with the Visbanes. I'm supposed to be a Modifier, just like everyone else.

319891008.speaker: 托特
319891008.content: Well, what do you think you are?

319891010.speaker: 奥丁
319891010.content: I didn't bring you to Aether Gazer just to hear you say "I don't know."

319891011.content: Ver turns her head in astonishment to see Odin standing behind her with her arms folded.

319891012.speaker: 奥丁
319891012.content: Have you forgotten the oath you swore when you joined the Special Task Force?

319891013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891013.content: "Fight, fight with all you have... until everything that has to do with the Visbanes is destroyed..."

319891014.speaker: 奥丁
319891014.content: Then what are you hesitating for?

319891015.content: Ver wordlessly lowers her head. She summons her Access Key and, gripping the blade end, points the tip at her own heart. She doesn't even feel it cutting into her palms.

319891016.speaker: 塔琳娜
319891016.content: Did you forget the promise we made?

319891017.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891017.content: That's different. If you knew you were...

319891018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891018.content: I wrecked the patient room, I hurt Lokken, and I almost hurt Tho-Tho... There's no excuse for any of it. The version of myself that I can't control might actually be the real me after all.

319891019.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891019.content: If I do something I can never take back one day, what right would I have to ask for everyone's forgiveness?

319891020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891020.content: What right would I have to forgive myself?

319891021.speaker: 庚辰
319891021.content: Do you remember what I told you to do whenever you start doubting yourself?

319891023.speaker: 庚辰
319891023.content: Is the path of retreat really the right one for you to take?

319891024.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891024.content: But where can I even go now...

319891025.speaker: 图灵
319891025.content: I told you—This is a problem you have to face.

319891027.speaker: 图灵
319891027.content: You sensed this a long time ago, but you were too scared to dig any deeper in case you found an answer you didn't want to know.

319891028.speaker: 图灵
319891028.content: You're afraid of me, and you're afraid of yourself too. You want to keep your naive, childish dream alive until it's all over and no one will ever give it a closer look again.

319891029.speaker: 图灵
319891029.content: You're afraid of losing everything you've worked so hard for, but it never occurred to you that none of it was yours to begin with—and now, it's become your restraints. You're afraid of the pain of breaking free, that's it.

319891030.speaker: 图灵
319891030.content: You still won't let yourself admit it? That you were never—

319891031.content: Crimson threads of blood spreading from the corners of her eyes, Ver whips around furiously and points her blade in the direction of Turing's voice.

319891033.content: The blood is dripping endlessly from Ver's palms. The pain gradually hits her, but she doesn't let go of the sword. Instead, she stares frozen at the person behind her.

319891034.content: She's staring at a scavenger, as ordinary a human being as they come. He bends down, apparently to pass Ver a water bottle, but his hand is frozen mid-motion.

319891035.content: The sword's has pierced into his thigh. Had it gone just a centimeter deeper, it would have pierced his femoral artery.

319891039.content: The bottle falls from his hand to the ground. It's already-loosened cap is knocked free, spilling water all over and washing away the drops of blood on the ground.

319891040.content: The pale-faced scavenger stumbles back a few steps. Seeing no further moves from Ver, he limps away screaming in terror, his blood-soaked pants notwithstanding.

319891042.content: The scavenger's actions draw the attention of everyone nearby, and they look at Ver in disbelief, including the sword in her hands and the blood on them.

319891043.content: Ver is desperate to explain herself, but her mind draws a complete blank. Still clutching her sword, she numbly stands up and walks toward the crowd.

319891044.content: The crowd screams and scatters. Ver can vaguely hear shouts like "monster," "psycho," "murderer," and "call the police" as their fearful glances cut through her nerves like a series of sharp blades.

319891045.content: She is utterly alone at this moment, and there is this pervasive pain in her that's growing, growing in her, a pain that is infinitely more acute than that from the wounds on her hands.

319891046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891046.content: That was obviously Turing talking. I never wanted to hurt humans...

319891047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891047.content: But you know that's not true. You know that you've attacked a human.

319891048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891048.content: He just wanted to give you some water, and you attacked him.

319891049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891049.content: He just wanted to give you some water... and you attacked him?

319891050.content: The sound of sirens is growing louder and louder. Ver's sword clatters to the ground from her weakened grasp. While this isn't the first time she's alone, she's never ever felt so far removed from other people.

319891051.content: Blood trickles down next to Ver's feet from her palms, clinging to the soles of her shoes and tracing bright red outlines around her footsteps. She seems to be running not from the scavenger, but from herself.

319891053.content: But the police cars never appear in front of Ver. She vaguely makes out Raphael's voice, and before long, the sirens go quiet.

319891054.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891054.content: Couldn't you just let them arrest me? I did this.

319891055.speaker: 拉斐尔
319891055.content: Absolutely not. Even if you really did kill someone here, we can't let the forces of this branch detain you.

319891057.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891057.content: Let's just say I lost control again.

319891058.speaker: 拉斐尔
319891058.content: Sorry, but I'm not a Modifier. I have no way of understanding your situation.

319891059.speaker: 拉斐尔
319891059.content: But the director and the captain chose to place their trust in you, and I trust their judgment.

319891060.speaker: 拉斐尔
319891060.content: The captain asked me to bring you a message: "If you really don't know where to go, then go back to the bookstore to rest."

319891063.speaker: 洛肯
319891063.content: What is it this time? Why do you always come back here with that look on your face?

319891064.speaker: 洛肯
319891064.content: Don't tell me Thoth is dead too.

319891066.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891066.content: Sorry, but I don't feel like talking right now...

319891068.content: Lokken clicks her tongue with a scowl as she watches Ver go down to the basement. Just when she's about to go and stop her, she feels a hand on her shoulder.

319891070.content: Wholly unaware of anything happening behind her, Ver shuts the door. Looking around the training room, for the first time, it looks almost unfamiliar to her.

319891071.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891071.content: Ningishzida did so much to help me...

319891073.content: "Preset tactical module: Endurance. Dynamic difficulty: Extreme."

319891074.content:
After pressing the confirmation button on the tactical tablet, Ver walks silently onto the training platform.
Countless simulated Visbanes appear around her, ready to charge the moment the preparation time ends.

319891075.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891075.content: My enemies. These are my enemies.

319891076.content: This isn't the first time she's been surrounded like this, facing an endless tide of Visbanes. But she had companions watching her back before. Now, it's only her.

319891077.content: Ver hasn't enabled the Divine Power Suppressor, but her power is being expended faster than during any other training session. There's no one here to help her adjust the difficulty on the tactical tablet under the training platform, and she has no intention of adjusting it.

319891078.content: As her Divine Grace is nearly exhausted, the Bane Energy in her heart seems to rise like lava against a layer of earth too weak to stop it. Her entire body surges with unfettered rage.

319891080.content: Ver grits her teeth, not allowing herself to lose consciousness. Lowering her head, she fends off the Visbanes' attacks.

319891081.content: In her wavering vision, she catches the piercing glare of scarlet lines spreading over her body. The originally noble white-gold color of her Divine Grace is also incrementally covered by the dark red hue of Bane Energy.

319891082.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319891082.content: Is this who I really am?

319891084.content: As if in answer to Ver's question, the Bane Energy fervently stretches beyond her body, spreading outward like a ring of fire. It destroys the simulated Visbanes on impact, clearing half of the training platform in the blink of an eye.

319891085.content: The hand gripping her sword freezes mid-air—no enemies remain beneath its blade. The momentarily empty arena seems to echo with the lingering sneering of Bane Energy.

319891087.content: Disregarding the regenerated Visbanes now charging toward her, Ver shuts her eyes, casts aside her Access Key, and relinquishes control over all the power in her body.

319891088.content: Intense pain instantly floods her entire body. A mixture of Divine Grace and Bane Energy spreads out from her body in a shock wave that shatters the shields around the training platform and crashes into the walls.

319891089.content: Bane Energy corrodes the machines and electronics, which let out a cacophony of bizarre sounds. Confined to the training grounds by the soundproofing, the noises swirl around Ver's head like spiteful laughter.

319891091.content: Exhausted, Ver falls to the ground with a vacant expression on her numb face. The pain and the Bane Energy recede like a tide, seemingly taking her vitality with it.

319891092.content: Without even the strength to cry out loud, the tears stream down her face as she curls up on the floor. Slowly, the fatigue and anguish drag her into a lightless dream.

319901002.speaker: 托特
319901002.content: It's still early. She could sleep a little longer if she wants to.

319901003.content: Ver clambers out of bed, cradling her head in her hands. It's getting light out now. Thoth is seated at the desk drinking tea, still wearing her combat uniform. It doesn't seem like she's slept all night.

319901004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901004.content: 7 o'clock... How did I get up here?

319901005.speaker: 托特
319901005.content: Would you rather have stayed down there until Lokken came in, saw a pile of Bane Energy-corroded AGI Mecha, then asked Paracaesar to have you investigated?

319901006.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901006.content: I'm sorry. I just wanted to see what the Bane Energy inside me was really like. Turns out I couldn't control it at all.

319901007.speaker: 托特
319901007.content: At least you wouldn't think of using it to hurt others.

319901008.content: Ver's gaze trembles. As her murky memories of the previous night dispel the residual morning grogginess, her expression darkens.

319901010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901010.content: So many people saw me attack that man. They ran off like they'd seen a Visbane, and I don't blame them. I must have looked terrifying.

319901011.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901011.content: Is there really any difference between how I was then and Turing?

319901012.speaker: 托特
319901012.content: If it was Turing, no one would have lived to tell the tale. He has no regard for life.

319901014.speaker: 托特
319901014.content: Raphael fixed him up before he saw you last night. You didn't use Bane Energy to do that, it was just an ordinary wound.

319901016.speaker: 托特
319901016.content: Everyone makes mistakes, and our duties as Modifiers mean that we'll inevitably face many things that are difficult to accept. Not just with regard to others, but ourselves as well.

319901017.speaker: 托特
319901017.content: I won't lie and say you did nothing wrong. You did hurt someone. But the important thing is that you yourself are not the root of the problem. Did you want to hurt that man?

319901018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901018.content: No, of course not. But I also don't know for sure that it won't happen again.

319901019.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901019.content: Can I really still call myself a Modifier if I'm so unstable that there's no telling when I could harm other people?

319901020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901020.content: Last night, I was just sitting by the ocean doing nothing when I heard Turing's voice. I thought he was right behind me, but it turned out to be a human.

319901021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901021.content: I also saw Odin and Gengchen, as well as you and Tarina. I couldn't tell what was real or not, I really couldn't...

319901022.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901022.content: I also heard Ningishzida's voice telling me to stop. Or... I'd...

319901023.speaker: 托特
319901023.content: Ver. Ver. You're just exhausted, that's all...

319901024.content: Thoth sits down next to Ver. She gently takes her into her arms with one hand while supporting the back of Ver's head with other, as if enveloping her in a pair of warm wings.

319901025.content: Choking up, Ver's nose begins to sting. She slowly lowers her head and buries it in Thoth's arms, trying as hard as she can not to cry.

319901026.content: Thoth calmly strokes Ver's head until the tears gradually stop.

319901027.speaker: 托特
319901027.content: Feeling better after having a cry?

319901029.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901029.content: Sorry for making you take care of me again.

319901030.speaker: 托特
319901030.content:
Then you'd better learn to take care of yourself.
What's done is done. You just have to face it and keep moving forward.

319901031.speaker: 托特
319901031.content: If you know that you're not the same as Turing, then confront yourself. Forget about losing control or your worries—Confront yourself until you find the outcome you're looking for.

319901032.speaker: 托特
319901032.content: I hope you'll remember that as a Mod, you have a duty to protect yourself as well as others.

319901033.content: Ver nods and releases Thoth, noticing something that worries her as she does so.

319901035.speaker: 托特
319901035.content: Ver, you're as much a Mod as I am. You know how quick we heal, right?

319901036.content: Ver manages to force a smile. She sits down on the edge of the bed, still feeling weak.

319901039.speaker: 托特
319901039.content: Hang around the bookstore, get some rest. And I mean real rest this time. Mute your watch if it sounds. Keep it on, though.

319901041.content: Ver's used to accepting any mission she gets sent, but she just accepts the instructions. Thoth watches her for a moment then gives an encouraging smile.

319901042.speaker: 托特
319901042.content: Leave the mission to Lokken and I. You've already done your fair share.

319901043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901043.content: But what about those Realm Controllers? Can you beat them?

319901044.speaker: 托特
319901044.content: If I can't, I won't fight it. Gaea's a tough opponent, right? If it comes for me I'm not going to try and hold out.

319901045.speaker: 托特
319901045.content: The chaos on the streets is starting to spread. Hyperspace has got a week left, tops. It's not long, but use it as best you can to recover. We'll worry about what comes next when we're out of here.

319901046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901046.content: But then... What do I do next? Am I still a Mod when we get out of here?

319901049.speaker: 托特
319901049.content: I'm not going to pretend I know how you're feeling after everything you've been through. And I'm not going to make decisions for you.

319901050.speaker: 托特
319901050.content: What I can give you is time and my trust. Who you want to be, who you can be... that's all up to you.

319901051.speaker: 托特
319901051.content: I've long heard that you're a optimistic person. So if you can still find it in you, summon up some optimism?

319901052.content: Just as Thoth is lifting her teacup, her watch sounds. But she doesn't seem surprised, just a little disappointed, as she places her cup down and stands up.

319901053.speaker: 托特
319901053.content: Oh yeah. Amuse yourself however you want to, but stay out of the Plane Layer. It isn't important now, so the tech guys made a few changes to cut down on the use of computing power.

319901056.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319901056.content: Why are you helping me so much?

319901057.content: Thoth stops by the door and turns her head to look at Ver. She raises a finger to her lips, shushing her.

319901058.speaker: 托特
319901058.content: Let's both keep our secrets, huh?

319911001.speaker: 塔琳娜
319911001.content: Cloudy, which days are good for going out this week?

319911003.speaker: 无人机
319911003.content: September 19th. Clear, max wind speed of 8 meters a second, average temp of 20C. Good air quality. A good day to go out.

319911004.speaker: 无人机
319911004.content: September 20th. Cloudy, max wind speed of 10 meters a second, average temp of 19C. Good air quality. A good day to go out.

319911006.speaker: 塔琳娜
319911006.content: Okay, okay. You can stop at "rainy."

319911007.content: Tarina puts the drone aside and returns to the window, where she sticks her tongue out at Ver.

319911008.speaker: 塔琳娜
319911008.content: So tomorrow or the day after?

319911009.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911009.content: Is that too soon? I've only given you two treatments, counting this time. Prez said I should keep an eye on you.

319911012.speaker: 塔琳娜
319911012.content: Then it's up to us! And you said it yourself, Ver, everything we need for going out is ready.

319911013.speaker: 塔琳娜
319911013.content: So I've just got one last thing to do and we can go!

319911016.content: Tarina twists and points at the pile of fragments on the table.

319911018.speaker: 塔琳娜
319911018.content: Yeah. You and Ningishzida helped me hang it up but it fell and broke.

319911019.speaker: 塔琳娜
319911019.content: So, for Ningishzida, and for everyone in the photo, I want to fix it. I don't want to lose those happy memories.

319911021.content: Ver ruffles Tarina's hair. The faint sound of footsteps comes from the hallway and Ver turns to look, just as Gloria walks in.

319911022.speaker: 格罗娅
319911022.content: Miss Norn, Miss Thoth is waiting for you.

319911024.content: Thoth whisks Ver back to the bookstore, where Lokken is resting on the doorstep. Given the way her chest is heaving, it looks like she just finished a fight.

319911025.content: Lokken nods as the other two pass her and, when she hears the door close, takes out her gaming device. She turns the volume up.

319911026.speaker: 托特
319911026.content: Director Paracaesar thinks that if you don't want to fight, you should pull out of the experiment. It'll save computing power.

319911028.speaker: 托特
319911028.content:
If she knew everything she wouldn't let you go back.
I don't know what Aether Gazer will think, but Paracaesar absolutely cannot find out what happened to you.

319911029.speaker: 托特
319911029.content: So, do you want to go back?

319911031.speaker: 托特
319911031.content: No. Still dealing with the Karasugo, I guess.

319911032.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911032.content: Okay... Can I have two more days? I promised Tarina we'd go out tomorrow or the day after.

319911033.content: Thoth gazes at Ver for a while, wondering how to refuse the request. She opens her terminal and pulls up some news stories.

319911034.speaker: 托特
319911034.content: I'm sure you noticed when you came out earlier, but there are increasing indications of collapse. There's going to be a domino effect as more and more people are affected. The streets are going to be increasingly dangerous.

319911035.speaker: 托特
319911035.content:
Two days... I don't think we have two days.
Remember this? Someone got a photo.

319911036.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911036.content: "The Second Sun." Just like we saw in the Plane Layer.

319911037.speaker: 托特
319911037.content: The Controller will be here soon. And when it arrives, the hyperspace will be wiped out of existence.

319911038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911038.content: So in other words, I can't have two days?

319911039.speaker: 托特
319911039.content: The experiment is the priority. I can't disobey Paracaesar's instructions just to keep you happy.

319911040.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911040.content: This Controller... can we do anything to stop it?

319911041.speaker: 托特
319911041.content: If we could get you back into your Gremory-beating form, maybe you could hold them off a while. But Gaea has virtually infinite computing power. You can't beat infinity.

319911042.speaker: 托特
319911042.content: Fighting them is just a bit of extra research. We're not planning to win.

319911043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911043.content: I want to give it a shot.

319911045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911045.content:
You said I could choose.
And this way I don't have to quit the experiment. I get to stay here.

319911046.speaker: 托特
319911046.content: You can't choose to do something impossible. What are we supposed to tell Aether Gazer if you get hurt again?

319911047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911047.content: I'll handle the explanations. Nobody's going to blame you, Tho-Tho. Or CORG.

319911048.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911048.content: And it doesn't matter if I get hurt, really. I'm already like this. Maybe whatever's inside me shows itself again. And even if I die—

319911050.content: Ver stops in mid-sentence, mouth open. She looks away, as if trying to hide what she's thinking.

319911051.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911051.content: Sorry. I know I shouldn't talk like that.

319911052.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911052.content: I just... I can't see the point of carrying on like this.

319911053.speaker: 托特
319911053.content: We've talked enough about other people's wishes. What do you wish for?

319911054.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319911054.content: I don't want bad things to happen again.

319911055.speaker: 托特
319911055.content: Then let's make that come true. Deal?

319921001.content: Lokken yawns as she walks into the bookstore. She glances at the counter, but there's no sign of Thoth. She's about to leave, but someone emerges from the back room, surprising her.

319921003.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921003.content: Yesterday, I told Tho-Tho I want to fight the Controller. She said I could stay here.

319921004.speaker: 洛肯
319921004.content: You? She agreed to that? Wow. What do you think you're going to do? Cheerlead?

319921005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921005.content: I'm going to do my best.

319921007.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921007.content: Anyway, if you're looking for Tho-Tho, she went out first thing.

319921008.speaker: 洛肯
319921008.content: I was looking for her. But you're here, so you'll do.

319921009.content: Lokken's starting to seem a bit impatient. She takes something from her pocket and tosses it to Ver, who manages to snatch it from the air. She opens her hand to see what it is and stares in surprise.

319921010.content: Half a plaque lies in her palm. It's damp, as if recently cleaned.

319921011.speaker: 洛肯
319921011.content: Luckily, it was mixed up with some scrap metal at the recycling center. The drone had a look and found it easy enough.

319921012.speaker: 洛肯
319921012.content: You should be more careful with your things. Don't blame me if you lose it again next time.

319921013.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921013.content: Thank you. I never thought I'd see it again.

319921014.speaker: 洛肯
319921014.content: It's not like Gaea deleted it.

319921015.content: Lokken shakes her head and opens the door to leave. She pauses in the doorway for a moment, then returns.

319921018.speaker: 洛肯
319921018.content: I know you don't have a snowball's chance, but... Look, if you're going to fight a Controller, make sure you're ready.

319921019.speaker: 洛肯
319921019.content: You beat me once, I know. Sometimes, when I'm feeling down, I forgive you for that. But I don't want to see you lose too badly.

319921022.content: Tarina, sitting by the table, laughs. She puts down the glue and pieces of photo she's holding, then turns to Ver.

319921023.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921023.content: I just asked you if Thoth is going to come.

319921024.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921024.content: I don't think so. She's busy. She'd already left when I got up this morning.

319921025.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921025.content: You're both going to leave soon, aren't you?

319921027.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921027.content: I was watching when you two fought that evening. And it's been so noisy outside lately. I can sense something bad's coming.

319921028.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921028.content: You and Miss Thoth are both awesome. That means lots of people must need your help. I don't think you'll stay here for long.

319921029.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
