319921029.content: So you figured it all out? You're too smart for your own good.

319921032.content: Tarina purses her lips and lowers her head, eyes raised to look out the window. The smile which still plays at the corners of her mouth fades a little.

319921033.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921033.content: Actually, Thoth came to see me. She looked like she'd been on a long journey and I begged her to tell me a story. And eventually, she agreed and told me this one.

319921034.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921034.content: There's a type of monster that lives in the world. A monster that can't do anything but destroy cities and kill people.

319921035.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921035.content: The monster can appear and disappear at will, so nobody ever knows when it'll attack. So people search for them. For where they come from.

319921036.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921036.content: And they all assume it must be some big scary monster. But what they actually find is a little girl.

319921037.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921037.content: And that little girl doesn't look anything like a big scary monster. She's a sickly little thing. She couldn't destroy a city or kill anyone...

319921038.content: (Video) I... We... are we... I... We... are we...

319921040.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921040.content: Oh, it seems you've already heard this story. Then I won't go on.

319921041.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921041.content: Let's go out! We can go for a walk! Go shopping! What do they call it? Ah, yes... a bit of scouting!

319921042.content: Tarina stands up to take a handbag from the closet. She pauses for a moment, wondering if she should take the drone or not.

319921043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921043.content: Tarina, how come you don't find that story, the one Thoth told you, odd?

319921044.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921044.content: Of course I find it odd. If it's true, doesn't that mean that I killed Miss Ningishzida?

319921045.content: In the end, Tarina returns the drone to its corner and turns to look at Ver. Her eyes are red, but she's keeping a smile on her lips.

319921046.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921046.content: But it doesn't feel like any of you blame me. You're all helping me. Trying to cure me, so I can live.

319921047.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921047.content: There really isn't anything I can do to help, though. All I can do to thank everyone is to stay happy. Even if I don't feel it.

319921048.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921048.content: Miss Norn, do you think I'm a monster?

319921049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921049.content: Why would you think that? You're not a monster.

319921050.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921050.content: That story made me want to ask everyone to check. If you come up with a theory, you have to test it, in case it's wrong.

319921051.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921051.content: I've never thought of you as a monster. You're Tarina. That's all.

319921053.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921053.content: I'd have to stop talking to you if you were scared of me, Miss Norn. But you're not. That's all I need to know.

319921054.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921054.content: What if you had to give up something you wanted to do, for reasons you couldn't control—

319921055.content: Tarina takes Ver's hand and stands from the table, smiling and cheerful.

319921056.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921056.content: —that has to be a bit disappointing, right?

319921057.content: She pulls Ver, who seems a bit distracted, to the door. She sticks her head to check the coast is clear.

319921058.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921058.content: No sign of Dr. Gloria. Now's our chance!

319921059.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921059.content: Should we? Maybe we should check with Prez. They might be back soon.

319921060.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921060.content: We don't have time for that.

319921061.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319921061.content: Thoth and I aren't leaving right away.

319921062.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921062.content:
That's not what I mean.
Miss Thoth told me more than one story, y'know.

319921063.speaker: 塔琳娜
319921063.content: Before she told me the story about the monster, she told me one about the Plane World.

319931001.content: A flood of Bane Energy washes over her, causing the ground to shatter at her feet.

319931002.content: How far does she have to go? Where will she end up? Ver can't worry about that now. All she knows is that there's nobody up above. Nobody waiting for her. Nobody to get hurt.

319931003.content:
"That's good enough for me."
"That's good enough for me."

319931004.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931004.content: If I fall asleep, will that be the end?

319931005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931005.content: I'm sorry, everyone. But I don't think I have any other choice...

319931008.content: A pair of delicate hands wrap themselves around Ver's right hand and the hilt of the sword it holds. The Bane Energy twisting around Ver suddenly weakens.

319931009.content: Ver opens her eyes and sees Tarina crouching in front of her, an anxious smile on her lips.

319931011.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931011.content: Private Tarina couldn't abandon you, Captain Norn...

319931012.content: Tarina's hands tremble as the Bane Energy flows into them. Dark lines form and twist across her body and her face starts to twist in pain.

319931013.content: In a panic, Ver tries to wrest her hand from Tarina's grasp, but the Bane Energy still holds it firm.

319931015.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931015.content: What are you doing? Don't you dare hurt Tarina!

319931016.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931016.content: Don't! Hurt! Tarina! You hear me?

319931017.content: Ver sees how the pain Tarina is enduring is leaving her weakened and roars in anger, every ounce of strength in her being poured into her voice.

319931018.content: Her eyes flicker between confusion and clarity, scarlet lines pulsing as if breathing. But she's unaware of any of that, or even what power it is she wields.

319931021.content: A fine golden glow is entwined with the darkness that has surged like flames. It feels like everyone and everything is on a great marching to collapse.

319931022.content: A hand reaches out from the dreary void and grabs hold of the end of the pointer. The golden light and black flames cling to her arms, leaving scarlet lines on her skin.

319931023.content: But these lines no longer register in her vision, for all she sees are the threads of Bane Energy links in front of her. There's no ifs or buts now. She raises her right hand high.

319931025.content: The pointer returns to its starting point. The gears have stopped after the last meshing, and time is now standing still. The golden light and black flames gather into her person to form a long sword in her hand.

319931026.content: The sword spins slowly and steadily, cutting off everything in sight apart from the operations of time and space.

319931027.content: The two there for a moment and then fall apart.

319931028.content: Ver doesn't notice how the Bane Energy surrounding her flows back into her body. She doesn't even wipe away the traces of blood at the corner of her mouth. All she does is clutch Tarina and pour Divine Grace into her body.

319931029.content: Gradually, the black lines on Tarina's skin start to fade. Her expression and her breathing slowly return to normal.

319931031.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931031.content: Why did you come back? I told you to go.

319931032.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931032.content: Ah, you know what it's like being my age. You don't listen...

319931033.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931033.content: How can you joke about it? You could have... Are you okay?

319931034.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931034.content: (Cough) Well, I guess I'm a monster, even if I don't look like one. Although you'd think a monster would be stronger... Rargh!

319931035.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931035.content: You need to be scary to be a monster.

319931036.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931036.content: I'm okay though, really. That stuff coming out of you reminded me of when I was ill. That's why I came back.

319931037.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931037.content: I know better than anyone how awful it is to be ill... How much it hurts. How hard you have to try not to weep.

319931038.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931038.content: And I didn't want you to go through that, Miss Norn. I don't want anyone to have to go through that, ever.

319931039.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931039.content: Ver too... I hope she gets better soon. Then we can go out for walks and shopping every day! And see all the wonderful things the outside world has to offer.

319931040.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931040.content:
I'm going to take you back.
And relax. Your wishes will all come true.

319931041.content: She carefully lifts Tarina, as if she's a fragile crystal vase, and escorts the weakened girl back to the Medical Center.

319931042.content: She pushes through a door and into a scenic passageway that skirts the small town's central plaza.

319931043.content: Tarina rests against Ver's chest, watching the scenery as if she's never stepped outside before.

319931044.content: She's humming a familiar melody under her breath, gently. Something that balances a sense of longing and a sense of completion, and in doing so eases all remaining pain.

319931046.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931046.content: Really? I don't remember singing it for anyone... Oh, I've got another wish. I'm so greedy.

319931047.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931047.content: I want to sing songs for everyone. And tell them stories.

319931048.content: Tarina looks up at Ver, a hopeful smile on her lips. But Ver isn't smiling back.

319931049.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931049.content: Miss Norn, why are you crying?

319931050.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931050.content: Yeah, why? I don't know. I don't usually cry.

319931051.content: Tarina lifts a hand and wipes away the tears from Ver's cheeks.

319931053.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931053.content: No, not even a little bit.

319931056.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931056.content: Remember what I asked you the first time we met? Why should you be the one saying thank you?

319931057.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931057.content: Yeah. I shouldn't have said that. I almost gave the game away.

319931058.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931058.content: Why did I say thank you... Because I couldn't think of anything better to say. No wonder Tho-Tho says I'm awkward.

319931061.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319931061.content: I just feel like... like you're always saving me.

319931062.content: Tarina looks at her in surprise, then gives a weak smile. She doesn't ask why.

319931063.content: Their hearts are beating in time. It's as if they've formed a bond, a connection more mysterious and more fundamental than any energy link.

319931064.content: Back under the tree again, the branches laden with golden osmanthus.

319931065.content: The young girl grabs a branch and ties a red ribbon around it before turning, still on tiptoes.

319931068.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931068.content: Nothing of this belonged to you before. But now, it's all part of your life.

319931069.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931069.content: This "now" is yours. And I think you've already decided what you want to do with it, right?

319931070.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931070.content: It won't hurt. This is ours. This is a power I have because of you.

319931071.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931071.content: All you need to do is face up to it. If you wanted to come back to reality, I could help you.

319931074.speaker: 塔琳娜
319931074.content: "So let's just bid each other farewell here, Ver."

319931075.content:
The autumn breeze sends a few osmanthus blooms swirling.
The red ribbon blows in the wind, as if waving goodbye.

319941002.content: Tarina holds her head, grinning as she walks towards Gloria, fingers tapping on the back of her hand.

319941003.speaker: 格罗娅
319941003.content: Where have you been? How did you get in such a state?

319941004.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941004.content: Oh, we just went for a walk.

319941005.speaker: 格罗娅
319941005.content:
You look like you've been climbing mountains.
Go and wash up, it's almost time for lunch.

319941006.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941006.content: Can Miss Norn eat with me?

319941007.content: Lunch. Possibly their last meal together, but nobody says so. Ver keeps one eye on her watch and, in the end, shakes her head and looks apologetically at Tarina.

319941008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941008.content: I need to go and get ready. I'll be right back.

319941009.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941009.content: Sure... If you're not back this afternoon we'll make our own way.

319941010.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941010.content: I'll catch up with you, even if you do try to leave me behind.

319941011.content: Ver makes a mock grab for Tarina, who dodges her, giggling. She runs to the corner, then comes back, hands clasped behind her back.

319941012.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941012.content: If you're late there won't be any cake left.

319941013.content: Ver waves farewell to Tarina and, hearing far-off footsteps, lets the smile fade from her lips. She nods to Gloria and makes to leave.

319941014.speaker: 格罗娅
319941014.content: You're looking a lot better, Miss Norn.

319941015.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941015.content: Really? Maybe this time I'm really cured.

319941017.content: There's a pale green balloon tied to the corner of the tactical tablet lying on the left side of the table.

319941019.content: Lokken grabs a bottle of juice from the fridge and places it on a napkin on the right side of the table. She puts her gaming device next to it.

319941021.content: The book Thoth hasn't finished and the cup she used to drink her morning tea are in the middle of the table.

319941023.content: Half a plaque... She thinks a good long while, then puts it back in her pocket.

319941024.content: Verthandi walks up to the beat-up training desk and takes a deep breath. She faces the tables in the rest area and closes her eyes.

319941026.content: The computing power is called upon and her body fills with Divine Grace. It fills to the point it usually does, but keeps going. It goes beyond what she should be able to handle.

319941027.content: And alongside this, another form of energy wells up in her heart. It seems to act like a stabilizer, something that joins the flow of Divine Grace and calms it, with no conflict or disturbance.

319941028.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941028.content: (I can do it... If I'd known that I wouldn't have been scared of you.)

319941029.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941029.content: (A response to my life, to my wishes, to my "now"... And it all becomes a protective power, I guess.)

319941030.content: She doesn't fight it any longer. She accepts it. It's like a seedling that bursts through the ground and spreads across an open plain. The energy surging through her reaches unknown heights...

319941031.speaker: 托特
319941031.content: I know, Raphael. But orders are orders. There's no need to come to the bookstore, just head back.

319941032.speaker: 托特
319941032.content: I've promised Paracaesar I'll get Verthandi safely home. And I promised Verthandi the same thing. So I can't come with you.

319941033.speaker: 托特
319941033.content: I've got a plan. She's right next to me, I can get to her easily. Look, is this really the time for chatting?

319941034.speaker: 托特
319941034.content: I promise nothing is going to go wrong. And tell Bernini to keep quiet, I can hear him.

319941035.content: She lowers her head to check Ver's position on the map. Sure enough, she's in the bookstore. Thoth pushes through the door and just as she steps inside the floor starts to shake. The tremors are setting new records for the hyperspace.

319941036.content: She pales and cuts the call, sprinting towards the basement.

319941037.content: All she sees is a giant hole, taking up maybe half the floorspace of the basement. She can't see how deep it is from the doorway, but it has to go down ten meters, minimum.

319941039.content: She looks around and notices a figure squatting by the side of the hole, looking as confused as she is.

319941041.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941041.content: Uh... This doesn't matter, right? I mean, it's all as good as over?

319941042.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941042.content: You see, when I saw that Tarina wasn't corroded by the Bane Energy, I realized what's going on.

319941043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941043.content: I mean, it's my heart, right? It's been in me ever since before I even awakened. And it's been quietly beating away all those years. So how come it suddenly went rogue?

319941044.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941044.content: And I've never heard of Mods being able to control Bane Energy. But Turing kept on going on about how I'm like him, blah blah blah. And so I figured, what if I try?

319941045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941045.content: Ningishzida's been helping me practice. I'm kinda decent at controlling Divine Grace now. So I tried both at once. Letting them fight it out.

319941046.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941046.content: And it worked! Made me way stronger. I barely flexed a finger and, bang, great big hole in the basement floor.

319941047.content: On the way to Saint Sophia with Ver, Thoth looks distracted, as if listening to something nobody else can hear.

319941049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941049.content: Oh, I was worried if I tried too hard something bad might happen. I didn't want to do that in a confined space...

319941050.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941050.content: You think I could stop the Controller now?

319941051.speaker: 托特
319941051.content: I don't know... I mean, originally I figured there was no way. Now? You could have a chance.

319941052.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941052.content: I see... So still a tough ask, huh?

319941053.speaker: 托特
319941053.content: One thing. You aren't the first Mod to use Bane Energy, but it would be better if we kept this quiet. Can you do that for me?

319941054.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941054.content: I think I've already done a good job of keeping quiet. And it's a part of me now, so I can keep it under control. Sound good enough?

319941055.speaker: 托特
319941055.content: Remember being like Turing? That's going to make it difficult for me to persuade people to trust you.

319941056.speaker: 托特
319941056.content: Let me put it like this: Can you be sure you won't end up like Turing?

319941058.content: The two stop at the door to Saint Sophia. Ver is holding Thoth's gaze. There's a sense of an ending in her eyes.

319941059.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941059.content: Maybe being a Mod or not doesn't matter any more. Doesn't matter if you're Turing or someone who's my friend. It's what you do that counts.

319941060.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941060.content: There's only one thing I want to make sure I remember. My power is the power to protect.

319941061.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941061.content: I know that if I ever forget that, I won't be myself. So I won't let that happen. I will stop myself, one way or another, before I hurt anyone.

319941062.speaker: 托特
319941062.content: Like today, by heading off to certain death?

319941063.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941063.content: Well, if there's nothing else I can do, then...

319941064.speaker: 安保智械
319941064.content: Welcome to Saint Sophia Comprehensive Medical Services Center.

319941065.content: Thoth watches as the AGI Mecha emerges from the door of Saint Sophia and greets them politely. Her expression changes to match Ver's.

319941067.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941067.content: I thought it was broken when Miss Norn and I came back. It couldn't say a single thing.

319941068.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941068.content:
Come on, we've already cut the cake.
Ver, do you want some?

319941070.content: Five people sit around the table placed under the osmanthus tree in the courtyard. In the middle of the table is a birthday cake. Well, half of one.

319941071.content: Two candles sit in front of Tarina: A "1" and a "5", both slightly melted. The holes where the candles have been removed from the cake are still visible.

319941073.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941073.content: I wanted to eat it somewhere out in the countryside. But then we'd need to take the table and the tablecloth and the knife and the plates and the candles and...

319941074.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941074.content: Have some cake. It'll taste as good now as it would in the evening.

319941075.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941075.content: I'm sorry we missed you blowing out the candles and making a wish.

319941076.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941076.content: We could light the candles again. But... I didn't make a wish.

319941077.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941077.content: That's no good! It's important to make a wish on your birthday.

319941078.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941078.content: I couldn't think of one, though. Whenever I make a wish, I write it down in here.

319941079.content: She takes out a notebook and starts flicking through it as she eats her slice of cake.

319941080.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941080.content: I've been keeping track of my wishes in here for years. I'd need a bit of time to come up with a new one for today.

319941081.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941081.content: It's a birthday wish, so you could make a bigger one than usual.

319941083.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941083.content:
Maybe not that big.
Something about you. Something you would regret not happening in your life.

319941086.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941086.content: Yeah... I had some back when I got ill and ended up in the hospital. There were so many things I suddenly couldn't do.

319941087.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941087.content: Then all the doctors came and started sighing and scratching their heads. I figured they couldn't cure me, so I should be ready to die any day.

319941088.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941088.content: Who knew I'd live this long, huh? And I met so many cool friends. Every day I've got to make new memories and enjoy new surprises.

319941089.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941089.content: I'm far too lucky to have any regrets. I think fate might turn on me if I did.

319941090.content: Ver stares in Tarina at amazement. She only comes to when she's handed another slice of cake. She gives a helpless little smile.

319941091.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941091.content: I see... I guess I'm the one with regrets.

319941092.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941092.content: What did you say, Miss Norn? Do you want the cake?

319941093.content: Ver takes the cake and places it in front of little Ver, who is sitting by her side, wide-eyed and gripping her spoon. She's about to say something to Tarina when she notices the sun slowly coming over the wall of the courtyard.

319941094.speaker: 塔琳娜
319941094.content: Oh, is it clearing up? The forecast was spot on.

319941095.content: The sunlight shines on them, but there's no warmth to it. Ver and Thoth look up, wary, and see an unnatural hole in the clouds, with a ball of fire hanging high above it.

319941098.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319941098.content: Yeah. But like I promised, I'll be back.

319951001.content: Lokken's unrestrained laughter can be heard halfway down the street. It's accompanied by a rhythmic thumping that's shaking the ground.

319951002.content: Half a Cleanser arcs through the air to crash in front of the squad. Lokken casts the other half aside and walks across, calling out in greeting.

319951004.speaker: 托特
319951004.content: Who told you to come here without us?

319951005.speaker: 洛肯
319951005.content: I'm just the reserve, right? Figured I should get here early, find a bench to watch from.

319951006.speaker: 洛肯
319951006.content: How's our starting team looking? She ready?

319951008.content: Lokken looks at her in surprise, taken aback by her calm but confident answer. She grins and claps a hand on Ver's shoulder.

319951009.speaker: 洛肯
319951009.content: Looks like I'll need that bench, then.

319951010.speaker: 托特
319951010.content: Go help Raphael and the others set up the defensive positions. I want the Controller trapped in here like a rat in a trap.

319951012.content: Ver watches as Lokken and the agents weave back and forth between the buildings surrounding the plaza, setting up all their gear. She realizes she has nothing to do.

319951013.content: The Controller could arrive at any minute, so she can't go far. She looks about and notices an old man sitting on a roadside bench, leaning on his walking stick, as immobile as any statue.

319951014.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319951014.content: Sir, you'd be safer at home.

319951015.speaker: 老人
319951015.content: That so? Tell me, redhead, are you with that other redhead lass over there?

319951017.speaker: 老人
319951017.content: She got rid of all those things that have turned up these last few days. I think this might be the safest place in the city.

319951018.speaker: 老人
319951018.content: And she told me not to worry. CORG's going to send all the aliens packing, just like in The Miracle League.

319951019.content: Verthandi turns to gaze in surprise at Lokken, who is sitting cross-legged on a rooftop, playing her games. It's hard to imagine her playing CORG cheerleader.

319951020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319951020.content: I still think you should go home. We're expecting an attack any minute. The aliens are coming, and this is where we're going to fight them.

319951021.speaker: 老人
319951021.content: Oh... Well, I hope you win.

319951022.content: The old man hauls himself to his feet and makes his way from the plaza, singing to himself as he goes.

319951023.speaker: 老人
319951023.content:
"Crossed the vast glaciers in my warship, I did, back to my pasture and farm."
"Had a barrel of mead at the banquet, I did, and shared it with my friends and love."

319951024.speaker: 老人
319951024.content:
"My hometown is safe from the rage of war, and glory is seen in its scars."
"The ancient runes may have faded away, but still we tell the tales of the stars."

319951025.content: Ver's fists clench as she watches the old man. He makes for a sad figure.

319951026.content: She's doing the best she can to treat the destruction being wrought on the town as nothing more than part of an experiment. But she can't help imagining how helpless the locals must feel.

319951027.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319951027.content: So, is this what the end of the world will look like?

319951028.speaker: 托特
319951028.content: The end of the Axis World is going to be a lot worse than this. That will mean real hopelessness. There won't be a thing we can do.

319951031.speaker: 托特
319951031.content: Remember the command to leave the hyperspace. The worst outcome is to get dragged out of here half-dead, so leave before you get hurt.

319951032.content: The agents are all in position, the plaza is empty. The only movement comes from a rooftop, where Bernini and Lokken are setting up some kind of heavy weapon. A point-defense cannon?

319951037.content: Everyone looks up and sees several points of light in the sky, just like when the Cleansers arrive... but not exactly the same.

319951038.speaker: 手表
319951038.content: Unstable energy signal detected. Lethal risk. Take evasive action.

319951040.content: The incoming beams get brighter and brighter, but that's all they are. Beams of energy, not actual attackers. The beams strike different locations in the town and start to cut through the buildings.

319951041.content: And everything they touch fades to grey and collapses. It's like stabbing balloons with a scalpel.

319951042.content: Thoth is still sounding the alarm when Ver cannons into her. The two roll towards cover, narrowly avoiding being hit. The agents escape unscathed too, but the gear they've set up can't be moved and in the blink of an eye, much of it is destroyed.

319961001.speaker: 托特
319961001.content: Were you serious? You wanted Aether Gazer Mods in the experiment?

319961002.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961002.content: I have my reasons. You have your orders.

319961004.content: Ranks of transportation capsules are lined up in the laboratory. Most stand idle, their work done. One is still ready to go.

319961005.content: On the other side of a glass wall, CORG Engineering Department technicians are hurrying through the procedures to close the hyperspace. The two managers, though, just keep looking at that last capsule.

319961006.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961006.content: If Odin comes asking about why she got left till last, I'll be naming you.

319961007.speaker: 托特
319961007.content: Well, thanks. It's always nice to get credit, even if it isn't my fault.

319961008.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961008.content: You're really this sure of Verthandi?

319961009.speaker: 托特
319961009.content: It's been more than two weeks. I know a little about her now.

319961010.speaker: 托特
319961010.content: And there's no faking what she did in Xu Heng. Sooner or later, she was always going to develop to this point.

319961011.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961011.content: Regarding the Medical Center... Anything to add?

319961012.speaker: 托特
319961012.content: No. I'm sticking to my original view. That place marked a new start for her. Childhood playmates, people who cared for her.

319961013.speaker: 托特
319961013.content: She's a very sentimental person. It makes sense she'd want to go back.

319961014.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961014.content: But that night, when it happened, Turing and Gremory were both there.

319961015.speaker: 托特
319961015.content: Because they were interested in that white light.

319961016.content: Thoth takes a probe, used for measuring data characteristics, from her pocket and passes it to Paracaesar.

319961017.speaker: 托特
319961017.content: When Ningishzida died, this lit up.

319961018.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961018.content: I'll have someone look into it.

319961020.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961020.content: Wrapped up yesterday. You missed a lot.

319961021.speaker: 托特
319961021.content: Nothing good, from what I hear.

319961022.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961022.content: Sasanami's Child of Heaven turned out to be a Cognizant Visbane. Sekhmet killed her, but had to use Omega gear.

319961024.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961024.content: Relax. Sekhmet's still alive. I wouldn't abandon her so easily.

319961025.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961025.content: Attention, all teams. Prepare for transportation—

319961026.content: A beam of light shines from the data migration engine onto the transportation capsule. There's a moment of silence, soon shattered by alarms.

319961027.content: An energy storm appears and starts to grow, engulfing the laboratory. In the blink of an eye a dozen or more transportation capsules are smashed to pieces. Only the engine itself, protected by a cover, survives.

319961029.content: Thoth pales. She turns, but Paracaesar stops her.

319961031.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961031.content: The experimental subject seems to be out of control. Stand ready to deal with her.

319961032.content: The door to the laboratory opens and squads of elite security guards file in, surrounding Ver. They aim their rifles at her and await Paracaesar's order to fire.

319961034.content: Being surrounded by CORG killers seems somehow familiar. Ver starts, then quickly gathers back the streams of energy. She rubs her head and looks about her at the shattered equipment.

319961035.content: And in a second, the laboratory is silent again. Unsure, the guards lower their weapons an inch or two. Their target does not seem to be out of control.

319961037.content: Ver seems to relax as she sees Paracaesar walk into the laboratory. She moves to approach, but the guards are still blocking the way so she stays where she is.

319961038.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961038.content: So, I guess this was your lab? Sorry, didn't mean to...

319961039.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961039.content: I know you didn't mean to. But does that mean you can't control your powers?

319961040.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961040.content: No. I just wasn't expecting to be transported back. I didn't know what was going on and tried to protect myself.

319961041.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961041.content: You were conscious during the migration?

319961043.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961043.content: There's no question that there is a lot going on with you which we don't understand. For security reasons, I would like you to submit to a CORG investigation.

319961044.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961044.content: It won't take long. We just want to... get to know you better, shall we say? I know Thoth has told you the point of our experiment, so I'm sure you'll understand how important this is.

319961046.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961046.content: I am in charge of the lab.

319961047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961047.content: I... It's not my decision. I'd need to speak to Admin and Shu. I can't do it if they don't approve.

319961048.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961048.content: I will explain everything to Aether Gazer.

319961049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961049.content: You mean I can't even see them?

319961051.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961051.content: I'm still not sure what I'm meant to be understanding.

319961052.content: Ver stares down at her feet for a moment and pouts as she's thinking. Then she looks back up and holds Paracaesar's gaze.

319961053.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961053.content: I'm familiar with our cooperation agreement with CORG. I don't remember anything about you having the right to detain me.

319961054.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961054.content: If you're intending to break that agreement, then as a member of Aether Gazer, I will use reasonable force to defend my rights.

319961055.content: Ver sounds as if she's reciting from a rulebook. When she's finished speaking, she walks towards the door. Paracaesar, expressionless, raises a hand and, in response, the guards raise their weapons to point at Ver's torso.

319961056.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
319961056.content: There's no need to make this unpleasant.

319961057.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961057.content: You think this isn't already unpleasant?

319961060.content: A cold retort comes from outside the door, cutting Paracaesar off.

319961061.content: The CORG personnel quickly make way for the figure who is striding in without any compunction, as well as the team behind them..

319961062.content: Ver's eyes have been growing wider and wider ever since she heard the voice, and when she finally sets eyes on that face...

319961064.content: It's as if all these days of pain, suffering, and isolation, she's experience, all that joy and hope... have all turned into tears in this very instant.

319961067.content: Really? You're crying? Just how terrifying do I look to you?

319961068.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961068.content: Why do you always have to joke like this? Stop it or I won't talk to you.

319961069.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961069.content: I thought you were in Sasanami.

319961070.content: I didn't want you to get lost, so I came for you.

319961073.content: These few days must have been really hard for you.

319961074.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961074.content: No... I met so many good people. Everyone... gave me so much help.

319961075.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961075.content: I don't want to cry. I just... I've missed you so much.

319961076.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961076.content: Why has it been so long? And why has it been so hard...

319961078.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319961078.content: It's not your fault! Why are you apologizing?

319961079.content: I shouldn't have left you here this long.

319961081.content: Ver nods, wipes the tears away, and takes Admin's hand...

319971001.speaker: 宁希达
319971001.content: Basic stats are good. Biomarkers are good. Divine Power is good. Access rights are good.

319971003.content: Ningishzida gives her perfectly healthy patient a strange look and hands over the report. But her patient just keeps looking at her.

319971004.speaker: 宁希达
319971004.content: W-What's up, Ver? Aren't you feeling well? Is there something I missed...

319971005.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971005.content: No. I was just thinking of something...

319971006.speaker: 宁希达
319971006.content: Hmm. You were out for a long time. It might take a while to organize your thoughts. Get some rest when you get back.

319971010.speaker: 我
319971010.content: The Cryptics can't find any problems. The Medical Center can't find any problems.

319971011.speaker: 我
319971011.content: So, I guess you don't have any problems.

319971013.content: I've just got back from Sasanami and I'm not in the mood to go out. Ver looks tired too, so we're staying home and chatting.

319971014.content: A lot happened in Sasanami and Ver had a tough time in that experiment she got caught up in. Neither of us can quite believe the tales we have to tell.

319971015.speaker: 我
319971015.content: Breaking a plaque's not a big deal, you know.

319971016.content: I'll give you an electronic one next time.

319971017.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971017.content: I knew you'd say that. You can replace it next time you go to Sasanami.

319971018.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971018.content: So, on your mission to Sasanami you fought... one, two, three... three Cognizant Visbanes?

319971019.speaker: 我
319971019.content: You think they'll give me a new job title or something? The Cognizant Killer, maybe?

319971020.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971020.content: I'll give you one: The King of Jinxes.

319971021.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971021.content: You should take me with you on your next mission. I reckon I could handle a Ladon or a Gremory now.

319971022.speaker: 我
319971022.content: Yeah? I might need to reconsider how I deploy you.

319971023.speaker: 我
319971023.content: If you can take a Cognizant solo, I could send you out alone when necessary. Like Tsukuyomi this time.

319971024.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971024.content: Hey, does this look like a tactical planning meeting?

319971025.speaker: 我
319971025.content: Huh? Oh, hehehe. Sorry, bad habit.

319971026.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971026.content: Hmm... I think you've changed since I saw you last.

319971027.speaker: 我
319971027.content: You're kidding? You're the one who's changed, if anyone has.

319971028.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971028.content:
I didn't mean in a bad way.
You just seem... steadier?

319971029.speaker: 我
319971029.content: Don't praise me. Feels weird when you do it.

319971030.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971030.content: What is there to feel weird about? "A brief parting, to see each other bettered." I mean, if you hadn't improved, that would be disappointing...

319971031.speaker: 我
319971031.content: Tsk. Where'd you hear that brief parting thing? Definitely not something you thought of.

319971033.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971033.content: But Tho-Tho, if you want to know.

319971035.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971035.content: Hang on, have you two met?

319971036.speaker: 我
319971036.content: Sure. The more friends I have to ask favors of, the better.

319971037.content: The two of us talk and we talk until we grow tired, then stop to have a drink of water. I can tell there are more things she wants to tell me, and I suspect I look the same to her.

319971040.content: I moisten my lips and sigh.

319971041.content: What if... and I mean, what if...

319971042.content: What if one day I leave Aether Gazer?

319971043.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971043.content: Wherever you're going, I'm coming with you.

319971044.speaker: 我
319971044.content: Hey, could you at least think about it. Did you hear what I said?

319971045.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971045.content: I did hear what you said and I did think about it.

319971046.content: Ver takes my hand. She's pouting a little, as if unhappy at my question.

319971047.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971047.content: Wherever you're going, I'm coming with you. Unless you don't like me and don't want me to.

319971048.speaker: 我
319971048.content: And if I decided to be a bad guy and destroy the world?

319971049.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971049.content: Then I'd figure out why you were doing that. Maybe you're being forced to and it's not your fault.

319971050.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971050.content: And if you have turned evil, it'll be easier to stop you if I'm nearby.

319971052.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971052.content: Better not turn evil then, okay?

319971053.content: I smile as I stroke her hair. I drop the topic.

319971054.speaker: 我
319971054.content: What were you going to say?

319971055.content: I feel Ver's grasp on my hand tighten. She checks the door is tightly closed and then moves closer.

319971056.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
319971056.content: I've got a message for you.

319971060.content: Ver's eyes widen in surprise. She might as well have a question mark hanging over her head.

319971061.content: I smile as I figure out how to put it and then take a breath before looking her in the eye.

319971062.speaker: 我
319971062.content: Also, I can guess what the message is.

319971063.speaker: 我
319971063.content: But Ver, I want you to know that ever since I met you, ever since I started working with Aether Gazer... everything changed for me.

319971064.speaker: 我
319971064.content: I'm so glad that I've shared all these experiences with all of you. The fighting, the training, the resting... it's all become part of me. Something I don't want to lose.

319971065.speaker: 我
319971065.content: So no matter what happens, today or in ten years, I'm going to promise you something. I will always be with you, with Aether Gazer—

319971068.content: Zhiming's so tired her eyes are starting to lose focus. She sits down on a roadside bench, takes the top off her cup of milk tea, and raises it to her lips.

319971069.content: But there's no milk tea in there. It's empty, as empty as the slum streets.

319971070.content: She lets her hand fall and slumps back against the bench. She looks up at the clouds drifting through the sky and shakes her head.

319971071.speaker: 执明
319971071.content: Are you sure you want to keep going? I'm really not sure it's going to work.

319971072.content: And as if in answer to her question, everything she can see fades to darkness. And in the darkness, a sigh.

319971073.content: There's a layer of dust on the shelves. The gloomy room smells of nothing but old paper and even older paint.

319971074.content: As record-keeping goes, this is old enough to be called primitive. But it must be here for a reason.

319971076.content: A pair of white-gloved hands remove a box from a shelf, tuck a file away at the very back of it, and then return it to its place.

319971077.content: The door closes, the footsteps fade away into the distance. The room full of secrets is silent once more.

319971078.content: There is only one thing in the room which isn't drab and dusty. A photograph, showing Paracaesar and several others standing near a forest. Just an ordinary group photo.

319971079.content: At the lower right, someone has written "Jokurr. Nov. 22nd, 2343."

411261001.content: Inside every CORG research institute of sufficient size is an office set aside for Paracaesar, and this one in Nordburg, Molander is no exception. It is a neat, clean, and safe office fully capable of handling whatever work is being undertaken in it.

411261002.content: Paracaesar is sitting at a desk, on a call with Thoth. She looks up while listening to the report from the other end of the line as she hears the sound of footsteps outside her door.

411261004.speaker: 托特
411261004.content: I have no idea. She went off right after we left the Source Layer. I had no authority to stop her.

411261005.speaker: 托特
411261005.content: I was actually hoping you'd know something.

411261006.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261006.content: I haven't received any request for cooperation from OPRIC. Having said that, this matter is apparently within their jurisdiction.

411261007.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261007.content: I'll ask Red Fox about this. As usual, you can send your reports directly to my office—

411261008.speaker: ？？？
411261008.content: You don't have to ask. Red Fox has no idea either.

411261009.content: Paracaesar frowns slightly and looks gravely at the person who's just swiped their access card and pushed the door open, as if they were walking into their own office. She cuts the call with Thoth, for there's something more important she has to deal with now.

411261011.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261011.content: ...If you're actually showing your face here like this, I'm guessing whatever I think has happened, happened.

411261012.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261012.content: Is the tech for Branching Space anchoring and migration protection mature? Which year did that happen?

411261013.speaker: ？？？
411261013.content: The year 2315. That's the first migration experiment of significant duration.

411261014.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261014.content: In ten years, huh... It's a little longer than one would like, but it'll do.

411261015.speaker: ？？？
411261015.content: I think you already know why I'm here.

411261016.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261016.content: Of course. Since the very beginning of this project, we've been prepared for a sea change in our knowledge and understanding.

411261017.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261017.content: Even if you didn't come see me, the Axis Observatory would eventually still uncover the problem. I'm just glad this is an experiment, not a "redundant branch line" that'll be remembered in history.

411261018.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261018.content: ...What happens to the other projects ten years down the road?

411261019.speaker: ？？？
411261019.content: Regrettably, most of them will end up fruitless.

411261020.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261020.content: Why? Was it the general direction taken?

411261021.speaker: ？？？
411261021.content: I don't recall ever doubting myself.

411261022.speaker: ？？？
411261022.content: But we might just see a breakthrough with Project Forgetower soon.

411261023.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261023.content: Have we reached a new iteration?

411261024.speaker: ？？？
411261024.content:
No... and this is why I've come here.
You, my past self, have failed to consider a number of things.

411261025.speaker: ？？？
411261025.content: Paracaesar, the truth is hidden in the corners of time. Even if you can't see it, it'll be washed ashore one day.

411261026.speaker: ？？？
411261026.content: By that time, you won't be laughing at yourself for being short-sighted, and nor will you blame yourself for being incompetent... The only thing on your mind will be, "I've finally found it."

411261027.speaker: ？？？
411261027.content: Then you'll become anxious, because you aren't sure whether you'll ever have such an opportunity again. That leads you to develop zero tolerance for error.

411261028.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261028.content: ...What are you saying? Just how do you want me to help you?

411261029.speaker: ？？？
411261029.content: This is an experiment. You know full well that the experiment needs to be robust, and that disturbances that should not appear must be eliminated.

411261030.speaker: ？？？
411261030.content: And as a member of CORG, you also know full well that CORG demands obedience and the readiness to sacrifice everything for our vision and the future.

411261031.speaker: ？？？
411261031.content: So, Paracaesar, as the head of CORG's R&D, are you willing to give your all for this experiment and the future it'll forge?

411261033.content: The force of the bullets sends the office chair and the person sitting in it rolling back a few centimeters, and a blood splatter from the target's forehead lands on the terminal screen.

411261034.content: Paracaesar puts down her gun, turns off the shield generator under her cuffs, and bends down to pick up the bullets deflected by the shield, which are now on the ground. Then, she puts herself right in the doorway before the guards who've heard the gunshots can rush in.

411261036.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261036.content: Convey my orders: All personnel on the base above the level of team leader are to gather in the conference room now.

411261038.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411261038.content: Do I have to repeat myself?

411261039.speaker: 科尔盖士兵B
411261039.content: No, no, I'll go right away.

411261040.content: Seeing the guards run away, Paracaesar closes the door, drags the body that looks exactly like herself to the side, and summons AGI Mechas to clean up the room. Then, she slowly sits back in her office chair and coolly closes her eyes.

411271001.content: The streets of Nordburg are empty. All that can be seen through the car window on the way back to the research institute is the repetitive sight of rundown high-rise buildings one after another.

411271002.content: But the only other person in the car seems to have no interest in talking. Bored, Lokken stretches out a mechanical tentacle. The tip of the tentacle sways a little, then starts moving toward the car window.

411271005.content: Lokken reaches out with her hand to push the tentacle back, then shows her empty palms to Thoth to indicate her compliance. She slumps back into her seat and watches Thoth, who's sitting opposite her and recording something on her terminal.

411271006.speaker: 洛肯
411271006.content: Why are you in this car with me if you didn't plan on talking to me? Are you just here to make sure that I won't run off with it or something?

411271007.speaker: 托特
411271007.content: As long as you're just kidding, you can say whatever you want if that keeps you entertained.

411271008.speaker: 洛肯
411271008.content: I have to say something, don't I? How would you get me otherwise?

411271009.speaker: 洛肯
411271009.content: And would you please drive a little more slowly? I'm still taking in the scenery outside.

411271010.content: Thoth ignores Lokken, makes some final edits to the document on the terminal, then closes it.

411271011.speaker: 托特
411271011.content: That "Prism-3" thing you mentioned earlier... is that a board game?

411271012.speaker: 洛肯
411271012.content: Why, do you want to learn how to play it? I can teach you.

411271013.speaker: 托特
411271013.content: Forget it. I won't have the time to play it anyway.

411271014.speaker: 托特
411271014.content: You, though. When did you learn to play this? You don't usually have access to the internet, and I don't think you can get that many people to sit down with you for a game either.

411271015.speaker: 洛肯
411271015.content: Ah. I see you haven't heard that the game has a solo mode.

411271016.speaker: 托特
411271016.content: ...I didn't see that when I looked it up.

411271017.speaker: 洛肯
411271017.content: Of course you didn't. I was the one who came up with solo mode. That's when one player takes on the roles of three.

411271018.speaker: 洛肯
411271018.content: But if you want to play with me, it won't be so complicated...

411271019.content: Their vehicle is now approaching the research institute. Lokken notices a flicker on Thoth's terminal screen, and scoots closer without any hesitation.

411271020.speaker: 洛肯
411271020.content: Are you in that big of a hurry to report to the Director?

411271022.content: Thoth gestures to Lokken to quiet down. Lokken shrugs and returns to her seat.

411271024.speaker: 托特
411271024.content: Yes, but we still don't know very much about the cause of the crack. All we've really done is to clear out some Visbanes in the vicinity.

411271026.speaker: 托特
411271026.content: She's right next to me, and she's heard you. But don't worry, Director, we didn't get into any trouble.

411271027.speaker: 托特
411271027.content: But we did run into someone from OPRIC in the Source Layer. She's a Modifier named Verthandi.

411271029.speaker: 托特
411271029.content: I have no idea. She went off right after we left the Source Layer. I had no authority to stop her.

411271030.speaker: 托特
411271030.content: I was actually hoping you'd know something.

411271031.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411271031.content: I haven't received any request for cooperation from OPRIC. Having said that, this matter is apparently within their jurisdiction.

411271032.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411271032.content: I'll ask Red Fox about this. As usual, you can send your reports directly to my office—

411271033.content: Thoth pauses for a moment, but doesn't hear any further instructions from Paracaesar. All she hears is what sounds like a door closing, and then the line is cut off.

411271034.speaker: 洛肯
411271034.content: Did she have any other orders for me?

411271036.content: Thoth looks out of the car window. From here, she can already spot the familiar form of the CORG research institute. From the building's cold exterior, there's no way of telling what's hidden inside.

411281001.content: It feels like no time has passed since they left the Data Plane Layer. Ver and Thoth come to, and find themselves looking at a deserted alleyway.

411281002.content: The duo slowly recover as they listen to the noise coming from beyond the alley. The sense of reality from returning to human society gives them both a feeling of reassurance.

411281003.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
411281003.content: How did we come out all of a sudden...? And where are we? Where's the bookstore?

411281004.speaker: 托特
411281004.content: The topographies of the Surface Layer and the Plane Layer map perfectly to each other. This is where we had that battle just now.

411281005.content: A confused Ver looks around, and images of the chaotic scene before come back to her mind and superimpose themselves on the current scene.

411281007.speaker: 托特
411281007.content: Do you know the way back to the bookstore from here?

411281008.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
411281008.content: Of course. I know this area very well.

411281009.content: Ver was already able to place the two of them after just a few glances. She often passed by this area during her weekend outings when she was in high school.

411281010.content: She walks out of the alley with great self-assurance. For some reason, there's a crowd gathered ahead. Ver walks around them while listening in with some curiosity.

411281011.speaker: 商店店主
411281011.content: How on earth did that happen? And no one saw anything???

411281012.speaker: 路人C
411281012.content: Nope. I was sitting across the road having my tea. By the time I heard the sound and looked up, the side of the building was already ruined.

411281013.speaker: 路人C
411281013.content: It does look like it was smashed in. But I don't see any heavy objects around. That's odd.

411281014.speaker: 路人A
411281014.content: That is so creepy. Did the bad guys just disappear into thin air???

411281015.speaker: 商店店主
411281015.content: Oh no, who's going to compensate me for this...?

411281016.content: Hearing all this, Ver can't help but turn back toward the crowd for a peek. There, through an opening in the crowd, she sees a building resembling a store. It looks like someone just smashed a giant hole into the side of the building, now surrounded by debris scattered all over the ground.

411281017.speaker: 薇儿丹蒂
411281017.content: Looks like the building was damaged just a short while ago... Were we here?

411281018.speaker: 托特
411281018.content: I think so... The hyperspace is a projection of the Data Plane Layer. If the data base in the Plane Layer is destroyed, whatever's projected will also be damaged.

411281019.speaker: 托特
411281019.content: But don't dwell on it. Accidents happen. There's no need to get too stressed out about it.

411281020.content: Thoth slowly turns her gaze away from the troubled shopkeeper, and looks over at the rather deflated Ver.

411281021.speaker: 托特
411281021.content: With new tech like this, problems will inevitably arise during the experiment from time to time. But of course, that doesn't mean that we ignore the losses caused to the people.

411281023.content: Ver turns around and sees several individuals in CORG uniforms pushing the crowd apart as they approach the scene. Thoth pulls Ver aside to a wall to avoid being seen by the CORG soldiers.

411281024.speaker: 托特
411281024.content: The professionals are here. They can handle this.

411291001.content: All the shops on the street of post-evacuation Nordburg are now closed. A figure walks along a quiet street, then pushes open the door of an empty restaurant.

411291002.content: She sits down at the only occupied table, pulls off her hood, and looks at the person across the table with an air of ambivalence.

411291003.speaker: 「托特」
411291003.content: ...I've looked at the hyperspace experiment data you gave me.

411291004.speaker: 「托特」
411291004.content: It's rather bold of you to ask me out like this. Are you so sure that I won't make the situation worse?

411291005.speaker: 托特
411291005.content: I've always had a good understanding of myself.

411291006.speaker: 「托特」
411291006.content: I suppose... It seems like something I might do. But maybe not quite.

411291007.speaker: 托特
411291007.content: The passage of ten years is enough to change a person, even if all they do is punch in and out of work every day.

411291008.speaker: 「托特」
411291008.content: And what kind of change are we talking about exactly? Have you found a way out?

411291010.content: As she speaks, she produces a book from her bag and places it on the table between the two of them. Someone seems to have marked a page using a photo with protective film specially applied on both sides.

411291012.speaker: 托特
411291012.content: "They brought forth both the earth which we see and the earth we cannot see, and the principle that the earth is the foundation of the world."

411291013.speaker: 托特
411291013.content: "Mankind, the reptiles, the fish and the birds... Countless in number, they all crawl on their flesh and blood, toward the kingdom of life and beauty."

411291014.speaker: 「托特」
411291014.content: "Not one amongst them, however, have ever apprehended them in their full and complete glory. Fortunately or unfortunately, due to its diminutive nature, life enjoys protection from ignorance, and floats on by in fleeting flashes."

411291016.speaker: 托特
411291016.content: Because I think that every one of us is unfortunate.

411291017.speaker: 托特
411291017.content: I'm not the one who found the way out. It's just that I happened to see something more in that person's eyes...

411291018.speaker: 托特
411291018.content: You can take the book and the photo. I'll tell you everything about the future if you want to know.

411291019.speaker: 「托特」
411291019.content: Maybe it'd be better not to know...

411291021.content: The two of them share a look, then chuckle as they look down again.

411291022.speaker: 「托特」
411291022.content: What do you need me to do?

411291024.speaker: 「托特」
411291024.content: ...Why do you need me to do this? After all, you've been in my current position for longer than I have.

411291025.speaker: 托特
411291025.content: If you could go back to when you were at the Information Security Center, or even the R&D Center, is there anything you'd want to find out?

411291026.speaker: 「托特」
411291026.content: Can't I help you with the investigation?

411291027.speaker: 托特
411291027.content: Paracaesar is watching, so the fewer of us who are privy to it, the better. Besides, I do think I know a little more about CORG than you do.

411291028.speaker: 「托特」
411291028.content: ...Now I finally know how much of a pain talking to a Thoth must be.

411291029.speaker: 「托特」
411291029.content: There's something I'm curious about. What do you see me as? A tool who's willingly put herself at your disposal?

411291030.speaker: 托特
411291030.content: Don't overthink it. Whatever I was doing ten years ago, I'll be doing the same thing ten years after. You are me, and I am you. That's it.

411291031.speaker: 托特
411291031.content: In any other situation, it'd be difficult for me to find someone I can trust with all the information I have. But thankfully this time I have myself to turn to.

411291032.speaker: 托特
411291032.content: Do you trust this version of "yourself" from ten years down the road?

411291034.content: The one in the combat suit is silent for a moment, as if she's trying to discern from the same face opposite her the ways time has changed her.

411291035.content: The person seated opposite her looks back at her placidly. There seems to be something in her eyes that's never changed, since the day of her Awakening, since the day of her loss, until now.

411291036.speaker: 「托特」
411291036.content: I probably wouldn't be here today if I didn't believe in myself... So, yes, I believe in you.

411291037.speaker: 「托特」
411291037.content: What is it that you're planning to do this time, then?

411291038.speaker: 托特
411291038.content: I have some official business to attend to in Shashvat. And some personal errands to run there too.

411291039.speaker: 「托特」
411291039.content: Just how much trouble did you get yourself into over those ten years...?

411291040.speaker: 「托特」
411291040.content: How many days do you need me?

411291041.content: The entrance to the research institute is heavily guarded as always. Thoth calmly looks around this scene from ten years prior, completes the identity verification process, and steps inside.

411291042.content: Along the way, she runs into several researchers and soldiers, some of whom greet her. She nods back in response.

411291043.content: Thoth still remembers the location of the office from ten years before. With complete ease, she walks into and out of the elevator, and makes the right turns in the hallway. However, as she looks up, her gaze freezes for a moment as she sees the person coming at her from the other direction.

411291046.content: The two of them pass each other with the usual nod of greeting and continue toward their respective destinations.

411301001.content: Nordburg is a sea of quiet with its deserted streets and empty restaurants.

411301002.content: It's almost time. The person who entered the restaurant first looks at her watch. An expression of relief finally appears on her face when the door is pushed open.

411301003.speaker: 「托特」
411301003.content: Looks like things have been going well.

411301004.speaker: 托特
411301004.content: I guess you could say that. At least we haven't been exposed yet.

411301005.speaker: 「托特」
411301005.content: Is there anything else I can help with?

411301006.speaker: 托特
411301006.content: I may have to go back in a few days. I remember we had a break after the Nordburg mission. I'm hoping you can help take care of Ver and my men while I'm gone.

411301007.speaker: 「托特」
411301007.content: Jeez. Just a few days left, and you won't even let me have a good rest?

411301008.speaker: 托特
411301008.content: Is there something you want to do?

411301009.speaker: 「托特」
411301009.content: I just want to go somewhere quiet, get myself a book, and read it all the way to the end.

411301011.speaker: 托特
411301011.content: How are things over on your side?

411301012.speaker: 「托特」
411301012.content: Hunky-dory. The problem is that we've found "Gremory."

411301013.content: The listener becomes lost in thought after listening to a brief description of the encounter with Ningishzida.

411301014.speaker: 托特
411301014.content: What was she investigating...? Might that have something to do with that crack in Nordburg? Or even something more—

411301015.speaker: 「托特」
411301015.content: Like the file you left behind said, she's really good. And after this encounter, she'll probably come find you again.

411301017.speaker: 「托特」
411301017.content: If the Cognizant Visbane really has a compelling enough reason to hide its identity at this time, I reckon both sides will take a step back.

411301018.speaker: 「托特」
411301018.content: I'm just afraid that she's more determined than you think, and will end up doing something unexpected... After all, she looks no different from a human.

411301019.content: She chuckles dryly as she recalls her confrontation with Gremory again.

411301020.speaker: 「托特」
411301020.content: The funniest thing is that, up until this point, no one in CORG knew who our opponent was.

411301021.speaker: 「托特」
411301021.content: ...Could you tell me again? Did you really find a way out???

411301022.content: The book on the table, Black Goat, looks brand-new. However, the photo being used as a bookmark has been moved to the title page.

411301023.speaker: 托特
411301023.content: This picture alone may not be convincing enough. After all, no matter how you look at it, they're just a human being.

411301024.speaker: 「托特」
411301024.content: But you truly believe in this person. Would you tell me more... about what's happened between the two of you?

411301025.speaker: 托特
411301025.content: It's not much of a story, really.

411301026.speaker: 托特
411301026.content: I suppose I just like people who give me hope.

411311001.content: The strands of hair that have fallen across Thoth's forehead have splintered the morning light coming from the sky. She pushes her hair aside, and the way back to the bookstore becomes clear and unobstructed again.

411311003.content: Thoth turns around to see a girl with light green hair running toward her with a big smile on her face.

411311004.speaker: 宁希达
411311004.content: I thought you'd be at the bookstore already. Looks like I didn't sleep in too late after all.

411311005.speaker: 托特
411311005.content: I had something to attend to last night and I just got back.

411311006.speaker: 宁希达
411311006.content:
Oof... I see.
No wonder you seem a little different today, Captain Thoth. You must still be pretty tired!

411311007.speaker: 托特
411311007.content: Are you sure it's not because I'm wearing a different outfit?

411311009.content: Thoth pats the girl with the bouncy hair on the head, then smooths out some of the strands sticking out here and there.

411311010.speaker: 托特
411311010.content: You lucky duck. I can't imagine being able to sleep in late like you.

411311011.speaker: 宁希达
411311011.content: I didn't sleep in late at all! I even made sure to make time for breakfast...

411311012.content: Ningishzida looks down and mutters something under her breath, then suddenly looks up with a start again. This last action nearly causes her to bump into Thoth.

411311013.speaker: 宁希达
411311013.content:
Oh, that's right, breakfast!
You haven't had your breakfast yet either, have you, Captain Thoth?

411311014.speaker: 宁希达
411311014.content: There's a pretty good diner near Land of Moons. Shall we go there now?

411311016.speaker: 宁希达
411311016.content: You know, the one called "Daily Bread." Have you never heard of it? It's just a stone's throw from the bookstore.

411311018.content: The look of enthusiasm is wiped off Ningishzida's face in a flash. She looks Thoth up and down in apparent disbelief, then slaps her thigh as if she's made up her mind about something.

411311019.speaker: 宁希达
411311019.content: Then today's the day I show you just how wonderful life can be, Captain Thoth!

411311020.speaker: 托特
411311020.content: Got it... Do you have to walk so fast, though?

411311021.content: The diner is packed with customers. Some of them are dashing off to work or school with their takeout breakfasts in tow, while others are leisurely enjoying their breakfasts in their seats.

411311022.content: After asking Thoth about her preferences, Ningishzida tells her to wait at the table while she dashes off to the counter. Moments later, she returns with a plate full of food.

411311023.speaker: 宁希达
411311023.content: They have omelets, pancakes, bacon... and of course, oatmeal! In fact, they're known for their oatmeal.

411311024.content: With this brief introduction, Ningishzida picks up her spoon and starts eating the oatmeal set down in front of her.

411311025.speaker: 宁希达
411311025.content: It's so nice and hot, hee-hee. Makes you feel so good all over... Now I'm sleepy again.

411311026.speaker: 托特
411311026.content: If you fall asleep, I'm letting Gremory get you.

411311027.speaker: 宁希达
411311027.content: What, trying to scare me like I'm a kid or something...?

411311028.content: Ningishzida raises the cup in her hand and looks at Thoth through the steam rising from it with her flickering eyes.

411311029.speaker: 宁希达
411311029.content:
Here, have some too.
You know, when I got home yesterday, I took out all the instant ramen I had in the place because I thought that I wouldn't be able to have hot, fresh food for a while.

411311030.speaker: 托特
411311030.content: You seem less frightened than you were yesterday. What changed?

411311031.speaker: 宁希达
411311031.content:
I mean, of course I'm still scared... Cognizant Visbanes, Cleansers, all of it's terrifying.
But the more afraid I am, the more I should cherish the present. Otherwise, I'll regret it if one day all these things really are gone.

411311032.content: Ningishzida watches Thoth eagerly as the latter takes a taste of the oatmeal. She can discern a mild sweetness in the aroma of the creamy oat that's sliding smoothly down her throat. Then, she can feel the warmth slowly spread from her stomach to every single part of her body.

411311033.speaker: 托特
411311033.content: Mmm. It does taste pretty good.

411311034.speaker: 宁希达
411311034.content: Mmhmm! Isn't having breakfast so amazing?

411311035.speaker: 宁希达
411311035.content: Would you come with me for breakfast tomorrow, and the day after too? I know of a bunch of other breakfast places around here...

411311036.speaker: 托特
411311036.content: Are you worried about running into Gremory?

411311037.speaker: 宁希达
411311037.content: A little, I guess... But I also really do want to have breakfast with you, Captain Thoth!

411311038.speaker: 托特
411311038.content: Sure. I'll come with you if I have the time.

411311039.content: The two of them walk back to Land of Moons with breakfast for Ver. Thoth walks in front with Ningishzida following behind. Suddenly, Thoth stops in her tracks.

411311040.speaker: 宁希达
411311040.content: Yikes! I nearly ran into you! What is it?

411311041.speaker: 托特
411311041.content: Shush. The door's open. Looks like someone's inside.

411311042.speaker: 宁希达
411311042.content: Who? Isn't Norn...? Is it... is it someone else?

411311043.content: Ningishzida stops speaking for a moment, but she can't help but ask in a hushed tone again:

411311045.content: Thoth doesn't say a word, but simply takes two tentative steps forward. Ningishzida, fearing danger, can't decide whether to move or stay where she is. After quite a bit of hesitation, she quickly follows Thoth.

411311046.content: Just as she starts to move, however, the person in front of her stops again. Thoth's movements become more relaxed. An odd expression covers her face.

411311050.content: She pushes open the door to the bookstore.

411321001.speaker: 宁希达
411321001.content: "You won't have much signal around there. Be careful."

411321002.content: Ningishzida takes a look at the last message she sent out, which the device now shows as read. Her heart starts beating faster and faster.

411321003.speaker: 宁希达
411321003.content: I can't get hold of Captain Thoth either...

411321004.content: She takes a deep breath, and focuses her attention on the real-time map on the terminal screen again.

411321005.content: The terminal remains silent, and there's no new info shown on it. But beneath this silence is a growing anxiety that threatens to drown out everything else.

411321006.speaker: 宁希达
411321006.content: I really hope nothing awful's happened... The Source Layer is so dangerous as it is. And they're looking for the origin of the Visbanes of all things...

411321007.content: She can't help but let her imagination run wild, pressing her thumbs hard into her slightly sweaty palms as she does so. Imagining the kinds of dangerous situations Norn and Thoth might be in shakes her to her core.

411321008.speaker: 宁希达
411321008.content: No, no, no... It can't be... No...

411321009.content: No amount of self-assurance can alleviate the growing worry in her mind. For the first time, Ningishzida, who's always relied on Thoth's command, is feeling profoundly powerless.

411321010.content: After staring at the closed door for a while, an impulse grows amidst the worry roiling in her chest. Ningishzida instantly gets to her feet, pushes open the door, and runs out clumsily.

411321011.speaker: 宁希达
411321011.content: I must find a way into the Source Layer...

411321012.speaker: 宁希达
411321012.content: I should head that way first. Then, when I run into someone I know, say from Aether Gazer, I can make up a reason and ask them to go to the Source Layer with me.

411321014.speaker: ？？？
411321014.content: What are you doing, Doctor Ningishzida?

411321016.content: Ningishzida looks up, and immediately shrinks back instinctively. However, like she's realized something, she quickly takes another half-step forward.

411321017.speaker: 宁希达
411321017.content: Director Paracaesar, I saw a squad enter the Source Layer earlier. Could we go in there and bring them back?

411321018.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411321018.content: The Source Layer? But I am in command of every single squad in this zone, and none of them has gone to the Source Layer.

411321019.speaker: 宁希达
411321019.content: I'm telling you the truth! Can I take some people with me there for a look?

411321020.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411321020.content: I'm afraid that's beyond the scope of our "partnership."

411321021.speaker: 宁希达
411321021.content: Then... Then I'll go by myself.

411321022.content: The girl takes a deep breath. She's about to take a step forward when Paracaesar raises a hand to stop her.

411321023.content: Doctor Ningishzida, did I fail to make myself clear? The one rule underlying our partnership is, while you may decline any deployment by CORG, any action you take must also be approved by CORG.

411321024.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411321024.content: I have not authorized you to travel to the Source Layer, and unauthorized action benefits no one.

411321025.speaker: 宁希达
411321025.content: But I can't seem to get in touch with them. Maybe they've encountered something dangerous...?

411321026.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411321026.content: "Maybe"? Sounds like you've been expecting them to run into trouble.

411321028.content: Realizing that she can't explain herself, Ningishzida decides to keep quiet instead. She continues to anxiously stare at the person in front of her with a pleading look.

411321029.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411321029.content: Don't worry. Just because I'm not allowing you to go doesn't mean that CORG won't do a thing... That is, if what you said is true.

411321031.speaker: 帕拉凯瑟
411321031.content: You stay in the camp, and we'll send someone to go look for them. As long as the people you mentioned are still in the Source Layer, I guarantee that they'll come back alive.

411331001.content: "Once upon a time, there was a little girl who left home and just kept on walking and walking and walking... Then, when she saw a tall mountain in front of her, she happily ran over to play..."

411331002.content: Two fingers travel along the curved alloy surface in a mimicry of a person walking. Then, they flip over to Ten's arm. Just as the fingers are about to launch into some kind of haphazard dance, however, they are shaken off by Ten.

411331003.content: What do you think you're doing?

411331004.content:
I'm "adventuring." Isn't that a very cool word? I learned it just yesterday. 
"Cool" is another word I learned yesterday.

411331005.content: Who did you hear that from?

411331006.content:
From that new research assistant. She says she's just graduated from college and has no idea why she was posted here.
I think I forgot to ask her what "college" means though...

411331007.content: "College"... It sounds like a place where you can also learn and train. I wonder how it's different from this place.

411331008.content: Then will we "graduate" at some point too? And where do we go after we graduate...?

411331009.content: Noontime is the time for parts repair and Divine Grace recovery, Nine. Are you trying to upset the instructor again this afternoon?

411331010.content: Ten doesn't say another word after this. Nine, a little unhappy, reaches out to give Ten another poke, but Ten has already pressed the button beside her and sent herself into the recuperation chamber.

411331011.content: But I'm not done talking yet...

411331012.content: She turns her head to the other side again. However, Eight, always the first one to do so, has also long entered the chamber. Eight is also always at the top of the pack in terms of her results, with Ten the perennial second.

411331014.content: She sighs dramatically, falls back into her chamber, and closes her eyes.

411331015.content:
"Adventuring," "college," "graduation"...

These are all useless things I don't have to think about. All I have to do is to become useful by the instructor's standards.

I have to become useful, become valuable, and kill Visbanes. Once I do that, I'll be able to...

 I'll be able to...

411331019.content: Why were you late for afternoon training, Nine? Please stop doing things that might affect our sparring results.

411331020.content:
Well, you should have waited till I finished what I was saying.
I went to play with something fun.

411331022.content: Um, w-what do you mean where did I go? What are you talking about? Where can I go...?

411331023.content: I'm glad you're aware of that. Stop wasting your time thinking about useless things. We take the final assessment for our training tomorrow. We should just focus on whatever the instructor says.

411331024.content:
Sheesh, why are you trying to tell me the things I already know again?
Hey, show me your Assistant Mecha.

411331026.content: Ten calls for her Assistant Mecha uncertainly. It's a small AGI Mecha that helps her with things like her schedule and vital signs. In addition, it opens her recuperation chamber on time every morning.

411331027.content: Try moving both its arms at the same time with your hands.

411331028.content: Ten purses her lips but says nothing. Then, she grudgingly follows Nine's instructions. She takes hold of the Assistant Mecha's tiny mechanical arms and starts pulling at them.

411331029.content: The screen of the Assistant Mecha flickers twice, and they hear a voice that sounds a little like Nine's issue a prompt.

411331031.content: Ten smoothly pulls up the numeric keypad and taps on it a few times. There is no response, however. Then, like she's realized something, she looks up at the beaming Nine, who's made herself comfortable right next to her.

411331032.content: Ten shakes her head rather indifferently, then punches in a few letters on the keyboard at random.

411331033.content: "Lok... ken." That's a pretty nice-sounding name.

411331034.content: Ten doesn't reply. Instead, she simply looks down to watch the newly written mini-program on the Assistant Mecha work.

411331036.speaker: 辅助机10
411331036.content: Please try to hit my hand the moment I make a move.

411331037.content: The Assistant Mecha puts away its robotic arm. Ten holds her breath and waits for a few seconds. Then, she sees the Assistant Mecha suddenly pop out its arm and then quickly retract it. While she misses the first time, she quickly reaches out to hit the robotic arm when it pops out a second time.

411331039.content: What kind of silly training is this?

411331040.content: It's a game called "Hit My Hand." Lila, that new research assistant, taught me about it. You know, she's so lame, she can't even get my hand every time.

411331041.content: I know you talk to your Assistant Mecha secretly all the time, so I asked Lila to add this little function for you. What do you think? I'm so thoughtful, right?

411331042.content: Nine, with a great big smile on her face, holds the Assistant Mecha up to Ten like it's some precious treasure. But how could it be?

411331043.content: It's just a silent training tool. Even if you do talk to it, it can't understand what you're saying. It can't give you...

411331044.content: You know, because now it's almost like it can respond to you!

411331045.content: Ten abruptly snatches her Assistant Mecha back from Nine and stops its frantic arm movements.

411331046.content: What do you think you're doing? You'd have been better off spending that time training.

411331047.content: I-I... I just thought this might help you... Lila said this sort of game is very common in the world outside...

411331048.content: I don't need this sort of help.

411331049.content: All we need the Assistant Mecha to do is to keep our records straight. Any other functions are of no value at all, and the same goes for us.

411331050.content: Nine, have you forgotten what the instructor taught us? Stop talking nonsense... and stop making useless stuff like this.

411331051.content: Ten gets up and starts walking toward the training room. The Assistant Mecha twitches twice, then trails behind her as usual, leaving the rather dejected Nine behind.
